I download audio books from the library so am not next to the tablet all the time. While the touch screen worked... it was as all the other touch screens out there. Good visual, BUT people should know that Android newer versions is not Adobe Flash capable so if you (for instance) want to hook it to your TV using HDMI you better have a geek friend who can download a different Flash player. I didn't have an opportunity to use it for the Amazon Prime Instant Videos before it stopped working. The touch screen stopped responding but for awhile I could dock it to the keyboard and it would respond. Then both went haywire. When it is outside the 30 days, Amazon will only refund a partial amount and the manufacturer warranty kicks in. It is about a 2 week turnaround but all of my data is gone. We first tried a factory reset but it did not resolve the problem. It is a big inconvenience. Since it is both the docking station/keyboard and the tablet I don't know what I will get back... rebuilt or new? Very disappointed now that I chose this particular product after a year of finding what would best suit me. This was it... until it stopped working.

Reviews.Title: So far...great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a inexpensive tablet that could be used to complement and older laptop, and it seems like we have found a great tablet.The Pros:-with 32 Gigs of memory, it can hold lots of stuff.-great graphics-decent battery life, and working on getting it better.  We can watch an entire movie without plugging it in.-Gorilla Glass touchscreen-Android Jelly BeanCons:-Flimsy plastic back, still trying to find the right size case for protection since it is an odd size.-didn't buy the keyboard dock with it, because it's priceyOverall, I recommend this tablet.  I know plenty of people that have IPADs and this can do everything an IPAD can do, plus I feel like it can do a little more.  I recommend it for adults that know how to use it, but probably not sturdy enough for young kids..

Reviews.Title: This is a great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these TF300s for Christmas gifts for my daughters. This tablet is really fantastic.  We have not had any issue with any of the Tablets.  One power cord got chewed up a little.  It gets great wifi signal and the batteries last about 5 hours.  They are so fast and responsive.  I own an ipad 2 and I like their tablet better.I just bought the keyboard dock for my two oldest as a Birthday gift. Yes they are twins. They really like the keyboard and it is like having a laptop when you want one and a tablet when you don't. Everyone thinks its a laptop when they see it and when I show them how they come apart...well I think you get the picture. Also its great for long trips due to increased battery life.Homerun tablet.  Hope your experience is as good as ours has been.We have had the tablets for 10 months and they still work great.  My youngest 8 dropped hers one to many times and the screen is cracked.  Worked like this for a month but just stopped.  I saw on YouTube you can replace the lcd and screen for about 70.  I am going to give it a try.  They use the keyboard when working on school projects.  They have also learned how to make free phone calls from their tablet and text from them all the time.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This tablet exceeded my expectations. Photos are displayed in vivid colors and are very crisp - better than I expected.E-mails and web browsing are fast via wifi. No issues. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great hardware, buggy software. Absolutely Ridiculous
Reviews.Author: J. Young
Reviews.Content: I have received this product within the first two weeks of release and have updated the software as updates became available.I never write reviews for purchases, but the number of system crashes I've seen combined with my keyboard dock no longer functioning has compelled me to post a review as a warning for others.GOOD:-from a user's point of view, the performance is good. Apps run quickly and the graphics/screen transitions in Android seem pretty snappy. ON PAR with my galaxy S2 phone.-price is decent-runs latest Android version-graphics are great, (thanks to Tegra3)-docking station WAS goodBAD:-apps constantly crash. I am furious that I can not rely on this device for tasks that are critical for work or school. I am not talking about just app crashing, but for some reason apps cause the whole system to reboot. This happens for multiple apps, which is why I suspect the problem is NOT the applications.The crashing needs to be fixed. I have seen NONE of these types of crashes on my galaxy S2.-I understand this is a review for the tablet, but my keyboard dock has stopped functioning. None of the keys work and is now rendered absolutely useless.-Android is pretty much stock. If you compare this to any Galaxy or Sony phone/tablet, you'll find some extra flare/widgets/apps added to the OS.Conclusion: I'm torn whether or not to even RMA this device. Should I risk putting myself through more headaches or just go ahead and get myself a different tablet. I expected much more from Asus.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of reading before I decided on what type of tablet that I wanted to invest in for my first one. The android operating system is really simple and I love the widgets. I also like that the tablet can be customized a lot to fit the needs/ wants of the user. I am very satisfied with the tablet and would have no problem getting another like it.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet!
Reviews.Author: zhaozer
Reviews.Content: WHAT I LOVE:- Quad core processor. Great graphics rendering capabilities.- Expandable memory via microSD card.- Large internal 32GB memory.- Asus kept the software almost identical to vanilla Android 4.1.  Only difference is it comes with bloatware, but menus styles are not changed.- The amazing cheap price! (I got mine for around $270).WHAT I DISLIKE:- Resolution is listed as subpar compared with the top-of-the-line tablets out there. However, I couldn't really notice a difference via the naked eye.- Android does not have a great app for taking notes during lecture.  ezPDF works for the most part, but there isn't anything as close to Notability on the iPad.Absolutely love this tablet.  Would definitely pick it over an iPad.  With respect to this versus the Transformer Prime or the TF700, I think those two come with overpriced frills that won't really affect your everyday use.  This tablet handles more than enough, but at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: Best tablets ever!!
Reviews.Author: Silvara1030
Reviews.Content: These Asus transformer tablets are the best for the price!  The whole family has 1 and we all LOVE them!  They are great for using in place of waiting to boot up the computer.  We use them as readers (they are a little on the heavy side for this, admittedly), for quick info look up such as gaming or IMDB, entertainment and it is so easy since we have android phones.  I highly recommend them to anybody looking for a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great price on useful tablet!
Reviews.Author: SheriLozak
Reviews.Content: I researched tablets before making this purchase. I was looking at an iPad but read about compatibility issues with other platforms and I do not have any other "i" products. I will purchase the keyboard (or get it for Christmas) - that was another reason I chose this model. This is a "fun" purchase for me, not a work necessity, so I had to be concious of the price. I don't have a laptop so it is great to sit on the couch and research or check facebook. It was a bit challenging to find a case for it, "i" products have cool colors and options, my case is basic black, blaaa. If you can get passed the lack of cool covers it is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Best all-around design for an Android tablet
Reviews.Author: B. Dunay
Reviews.Content: Pros:o Fast: Quad-core Tegra 3. Not as fast as the TF201 or TF700, but plenty fast.o Android 4.1.1 available. (Jelly Bean)o Extra apps added by Asus:_ Tegra Zone 3D apps and games._ Asus Studio_ Dual battery monitor,_ SuperNote,_ Polaris Office,_ MyCloud, MyNet, MyLibraryo (Optional) Great keyboard with trackpad, extra battery,_ USB host, mini-HDMIo Great IPS display, bright and easily read from an angleo Reliable operation. I've had no freezes or hick-ups in_ the 2 weeks I've owned the unit.o Popular platform with many tips and tricks on the web.Cons:o Power connecter is 12V-15V. I can connect to a 5V USB source,_ but cannot charge from it. Some people say that the TF300_ will charge slowly from a USB-3 port, when the unit is_ powered down.o Proprietary data cable. Extra cables are readily_ available at Amazon.o Quality Control. About 40% of the reviews here are 3 stars_ or less. Most of those unhappy customers are having some_ kind of quality problem. This is where Amazon really_ shines. Buy from anyone else and you may have a hassle_ returning your unit. Amazon is amazing. Personally, I was_ in that 60% that are very happy with their unit.Dock:  Despite the cost of the dock (~$100), it is still a bargain._ Compare that to the cost of a keyboard, usb adapter, hdmi_ adapter, and case. Plus, the dock is attractive and perfectly_ matched to your TF300. Go for it.Conclusion:  Best purchase I've made in years. Fun, fun, fun!

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: It is a decent tablet for the price.The Tegra 3 processor is ok, not impressed by it.though.I bought this tablet for the purpose of have adobe flash player but have found out android 4.0 and up does not support flash player,so its not the tablets companies fault.It is strange most all video on the internet requires flash player,go figure. The browser crashing from time toi time is one of the few problems with the tablet. All in all it is a decent tablet.

Reviews.Title: ASUS review
Reviews.Author: akk
Reviews.Content: Great product only one issue, Adobe Flash says it is not supporting this version of android OS which makes viewing certain web pages not possible.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the first two months
Reviews.Author: grncreek
Reviews.Content: As this was a new model I waited to review - the tablet was great for the first two months - LOVED it!  But after a couple of months the display started blinking off/on.  So far I've sent it in to ASUS for repair twice (and going back for the third time today) - but they still haven't been able to fix it.  This time I'm posting a video on YOUTUBE to show them what it's doing.  Recommendation:  from what I've experienced and have seen posted on other websites you may want to wait awhile before purchasing this model.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Linda J Laezman
Reviews.Content: Tablet met all of my expectations.  I use it all the time.  Consider it a great investment.  Very versatile and easy to manage.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: Buddy
Reviews.Content: This product was great for the money. Fairly easy to set up. Works great with wifi connection. I would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: mrcrpet
Reviews.Content: Bought item for my son. It does everything he  wants pedfect.item is fast great resolution. Large screen great competition for iPad at half the price.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 Big Brother
Reviews.Author: rokudaime
Reviews.Content: After playing with my Nexus 7, i'm sold! Gotta get the big brother - ASUS TF300. I was impressed with flawless performance of the Tegra 3 and UPDATE: Jelly Bean. Also a lot cheaper than my wife's $500 ipad 3. I just want something that works flawlessly and not anything less. No fancy animation or silly ringtones.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: Henderson
Reviews.Content: I have used this non-stop for about six weeks and have been nothing but happy.  For standard web browsing, light games, streaming media, email, facebook etc. it's incredibly convenient.  And I love that it fits in my purse.  I have been able to view and even edit Microsoft documents stored in cloud storage.  The screen image is gorgeous and it is easy to use right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Great all around except for screen colors
Reviews.Author: John Kwiatkowski
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the tablet, just updated to Jelly Bean but ICS was fine. Snappy responses and Tegra 3 video a plus. Keyboard dock is fantastic.Only nitpick, screen colors are washed out a bit at all brightness levels and lighting conditions. Might not have noticed but I also have access to Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1, Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 and Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 devices. Samsung colors are much richer, blacks deeper.  Wish Asus would provide some Gamma tuning app for the screen. Then 5 stars absolutely.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: spencer s rhodes
Reviews.Content: First off: I love it. I love the weight, the dimensions, the hardware specs!Asus also just pushed Android 4.1.1 (Jelly Bean) 2 days ago, so that's rad!My biggest complaint, and it's the android industry in general, is the lack of accessories. But that's no fault of this tablet. There are enough basic options out there. And this may change over time and Asus continues making devices in these dimension.One minor complaint with this plastic version of the Prime is some movement along the edge of the screen. It's really pretty minor, but I notice when holding it at the corners that the screen edge can be squeezed into the case a fraction of a millimeter. Additionally, with the case I bought, because it fits very snuggly, also started to pull the back cover off a teeny bit around the camera when I first put them together. So be careful. But this is why we're paying $380 instead of $500 :)Other than that, I'm very happy. I've hardly touched my macbook in the 2 weeks since I got this.Tip: Accessories that adhere to the device via suction or other "removable" adhesive methods probably won't work because of the radial texture on the back.Tip: Here's a dimensions table of similar devices that I put together to help me find compatible accessories.MODEL  DIMENSIONS (IN.)  THICKNESS  WEIGHT (LB.)-----------------------------------------------------------------------------Asus Transformer Pad TF300T  10.4 x 7.1  0.39  1.39Asus Eee Pad Transformer TF700  10.4 x 7.12  0.34  598 gAsus Eee Pad Transformer Prime  10.4 x 7.1  0.31  1.29Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1  10.1 x 6.9  0.38  1.3Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1  10.1 x 6.9  0.34  1.20Acer Iconia Tab A510  10.4 x 6.9  0.40  1.50Apple iPad (1st Gen)  9.56 x 7.47  0.5Apple iPad (2nd Gen)  9.50 x 7.31  0.34Apple iPad (3rd gen., 2012)  9.50 x 7.31  0.37  1.44

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: I am a college student who absolutely hates carrying those countless notebooks and textbooks around that huge campus. This tablet allows me to have everything I need in less than the weight of one textbook! I recommend buying the keyboard dock---it makes note taking and everything just easier. I can buy e-books or just scan the pages that I need that day and upload it to my tablet! Great for any anybody---especially students with a budget and high expectations, like me.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy anything from Asus.
Reviews.Author: A. Tam
Reviews.Content: I am delighted to use this tablet. You get a fast system, nice screen, the Ice Cream Sandwich with it. Everything is good --- when it is working.I have been using the tablet for less than a month. In the first week, the screen protector and cover that I ordered has arrived. So I put it on, but at that time I found the screen has an uneven intensity when it is showing white. I feel sad about that but it can be tolerated. Indeed, I can't see it if I am not looking at it closely.After the third week of my use, suddenly one day, I found the screen cracked! The glass is not broken but the LCD cracked. The system still running, and I can still retrieve my file using the USB. I swear I did nothing. May be temperature change due to this hot summer, or may be I put it in my car's trunk that shaked it. But I cannot see anything now. Simply speaking: It is dead.To all who want to buy this tablet: DO NOT BUY IT.I searched on the web, and I found that the higher end model such as TF700 has stronger screen. And TF300 is **very easy** to have the screen broken. Same manufacturer, but the price difference made a huge difference on durability. If you can afford it, get a high-end model with so-called "gorilla glass" that might make it more durable. But this one, no, no, no!UPDATE: I got back from Asus. They refuse to do any repair under warranty. Can you imagine that a screen problem is always customer's fault no matter what? That's Asus! You know what? They even have the template response for that ---"I have not received any internal reports that there is some kind ofdefect w/ the LCD screen where it would just break/rupture on its ownw/out some kind of intervention (i.e. drops, excessive pressure, misuse,something being dropped on the unit, etc.), therefore I must follow ourstandard policy which excludes physical damage from warranty coverage.Being that this isn't covered by the warranty the labor fee would applyif you'd like the LCD repaired.  I would be willing to offer you a 15%discount off the total cost of the repair to reduce the price for you."Exactly the same text you can see from another review here. A response template exists because the screen problem is very very common, as you can see from Amazon's review. The problem is common because that is a design fault. And Asus insist that it is customer's fault. Now Asus is trying to ask you to pay 50% of the price of this tablet to repair. So my advice is THINK TWICE BEFORE YOU BUY: this tablet is essentially coming with no warranty.

Reviews.Title: MDSNOW
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Snow "MDSNOW"
Reviews.Content: i got this tablet at gamestop i traded in my 16 gb nexus 7 witch is a great 7" tablet but there was not enough space on it and no memory card slot. I love this tablet, this tablet is just like A 10.1 inch version of the nexus 7 this is a tegra 3 tablet witch is great for playing hd games on it. Since i like to watch alot of video's  when go out i decided to get this because it has 32 gb of internal storage and it also has a micro sd slot with up to 32 gb of additional space.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: Anna Heran "snow mom"
Reviews.Content: Just received this.  Had it up and running very quickly.  Have set it to run at work and home.  accessing email and the internet are a breeze.  Very intuitive learning environment.  Easy to download apps, take pics, etc.  Haven't used all the features yet, but love the size, convenience, easy to read screen, but light weight.  It's a blast!

Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET AT GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Daniel Franco
Reviews.Content: This tablet has everything you can imagine and is very easy to use!! With Google Play you have tons of apps to download same as Apple store and the fact that this tablet has built in 32 GB memory and a micro SD card it gives you UNLIMITED storage!! The one thing i can say is a little off is the low volume when using headphones but i have recently ordered a noise canceling headphone to see if it will help drown out any outside noise and make sound quality better.Would recommend this to anyone looking for a tablet at a great price!!!!

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted in a Tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Cande Honeycutt
Reviews.Content: I've been comtemplating getting an Android-based tablet for almost a year. I also needed a new computer. The Asus Transformer can be everything I need... a tablet and (with the optional keyboard docking station) a small laptop. I use it both at work and at home. It fits the bill for both. At work, it has increased my productivity. I'm not a techie at all, so I'm sure this apparatus has capabilities that I haven't even discovered. I haven't had problems at all with the applications, Wi-fi, or other functions. I have an Android-based phone, so this was easy to use right out of the box. I do recommend the docking station.

Reviews.Title: truly a great product
Reviews.Author: Hammer
Reviews.Content: I waited to review as i have had experience with Android products that start out well then peter out as time goes by.  I had a  Viewsonic G Tablet that i had flashed with various versions of android with good and bad results but got tired of having to support my own device. After much research I landed on this Asus TF 300 with the keyboard/doc. I have now had this over two weeks and I have to admit this meets every need I have...and I have a lot. I use this product for business and pleasure. At work I use it with multiple cloud based solutions for sharing files, note taking, etc...I also RDP into Terminal servers using various products and join webinars on a regular basis. I experiment all the time with new apps to increase efficiency and all perform incredibly on the TF300.  At hom, e, I play games (including Flash...wink,wink), watch movies, Facebook, YouTube, browse the web, and anything else you can do with a tablet.. All in all, I work my tablets hard and this device hasn't broken a sweat or run out of battery. I read reviews about slow browsing which I think is somewhat inherent in Android 4.0 as I learned during my 'flashing' days and was ready to return this product and go with an iPad if performance was similar to my other tablet. Apparently Asus has released a few updates prior and one since I owned but frankly, never noticed any browsing issues since i owned it. Nothing but power and speed. Now don't get me wrong...Android is Android and the occasional force stop message and the need to reboot once in a while to 'clear it's head' are to be expected...but frankly since iOS 5, I don't know that my iPhone 4 fares all that much better. BUT, Android does allow for so much more customization, storage options, a browseable file system, and a huge array of useful widgets that make me a fan. And don't even get me started on what value the keyboard/doc brings to anyone wanting to use this as a business device. I can carry this with me from meeting to meeting and continue to easily stay productive. It may not be a MacBook Air, but for half the price, this allows me to be just as productive. The keyboard included a track pad for a mouse cursor and has a USB port if you wanted to connect a physical mouse and adds 5 hours of battery life on top of it. If you are looking to take the tablet plunge...you are not going to get more for your money than the TF300.

Reviews.Title: This tablet kills Apple completely!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Melvin
Reviews.Content: I got the tablet on time and also noticed how light it was compared to the previous models. Who cares if it doesn't feel all metallic....to be honest it way better that it has plastic cover and also has better grip than the other models. The only con (if you can call it a con) is that when it arrived I had to charge it before using it but other than that it runs smooth. The Tegra 3 video quality kicks ass. I've been playing multiple games and not a single glitch so far. I'm very pleased with my tablet and if you're doubting yourself you shouldn't because once you get it you're not going to want to put it down. This tablet is sick and makes the all iPad's look like a Leap Frog tablet lol!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: The Best I-Pad alternate
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research into which tablet to get and a month ago decided on the Asus tf300 and have not regretted it since.  The battery life is fantastic, the screen resolution is brilliant, I love the expandable memory and the ability to store on their cloud.  The thing that I was surprised by though is the camera.  It takes fantastic pictures and has lots of fun features.  I would not get the tablet/keyboard combo in place of a netbook or laptop though.  The android operating system is not windows and many of the things you'd do on a PC are much more challenging on the tablet/keyboard pair.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: I have only had this tablet for 5 days and so far I love it. My wife has a 7 inch tablet and I was originally going to but this for her so she could read certain magazines on the tablet and needed ICS. She ended up giving it to me. The speed, design, feel, and screen quality with video and pictures are as described. Over all great product for the price.

Reviews.Title: second generation asus tablet
Reviews.Author: rmur
Reviews.Content: I've been using this tablet for about five weeks now. This is the second asus tablet I received from Amazon. The first had one had light bleed at the left and bottom of the panel, this one is not quite as bad. The light bleed is only on the bottom, I thought about sending it back, but was afraid of receiving one that was worseNow, on to the good. This thing is fast, enough ram, do not have to constantly kill background apps. I am really enjoying ICS, and custom asus apps. The android web browser still stalls and hangs, but that's an ICS fault I hope will be addressed. I had had a froyo tablet that had no such issues. Battery life is above average, usually lasting a day and a half with moderate use. Still waiting for the games to start showing up for it in the play storeAnother plus is the support and following this tablet is seeing at Xda forums already. That's always  good thing!

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: INFUSELearning
Reviews.Content: The Asus TF300 tablet is a great product. This tablet has great horsepower and a solid OS with ICS.Asus has also been very responsive with product updates and service patches as needed.Great product that has actually replaced my laptop!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. It is nice and thin, light, and is easy to take everywhere. The processing is very fast and smooth.

Reviews.Title: Hummmm/Back In The Saddle Again
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Right now I am having problems with my tablet staying on, and the browser closing on me, and when I shut it down it seem to be back on. hummm!!  Changed the setting for timing out but it still just does what it wants.  Kinda wierd when you want to go and touch the screen and it just closes before you get there. This concern is really frustrating me, so I will give it a few more days and then I will exchange for another one. I read all the reviews of other customers, and seen that some are having the same concens, if not more. I have learned soooo much from all the reviews and resolved issues also. Youtube has been a wonderful place to go to understand a lot about the tablet. Like some have said the instrucitons are not really robust. I purchased this on the reviews on Amazon and from Cnet, and other sites that I have visited. Was looking at Acer but for the cost and for memory this one was it.  I do belive that this is a good tablet, I just think that I got one that is not built quite right. I will play with it more in a few days to see if anything changes with it. Love the keyboard, and all the functions that go with it. So, If I have to return the tablet, I will give a update and maybe bump those stars to the clouds!!!!! I just got this tablet before Thanksgiving. The Poetic leather keyboard case that I got from Amazon is a nice case, makes everything user friendly!!UPDATE:  Will be returning this one. This one has a quality concern. Turned on the Asus this weeked and came on real slow, then when everything came up, I seen that it stated that I was charging at 82%. I didn't have anything plugged into it. Gave it a last run for the money but will exchange for a new one. Will give another update when I get the new one.Hope the new one is better, if not I will not be buying Asus anymore, even if the ratings are great. Just the experience of dealing with something that doesn't work the first time is very disappointing. Some things you can just live with but not this. Taking a star away until I get the new one.Updated 2/17/13Well like I said, I would come back and give another review of the ASUS. It's in and it is a keeper. Got it back the beginning of January. I liked the tablet since day one, but just got a bad one. They were happy to exchange it, which I really thought I was going to have problems with this, but didn't. It's fast, smooth and very responsive, to my touch. Have gotten all my updates, and running like butter. Wi-Fi has been great and it tethers absolutely great from my phone when I am not in Wi-Fi reach. Really love it for this, so I can take it anywhere, and connect to the internet. If you do get this make sure you get the dock and the case for it. It will make it look, good and protect it also. You will get rid of the top heavy concern. My friends are really impressed with what I can do with this, and so am I. This will be a journey with this tablet and I hope it last me for awhile until the next best thing comes along, but until then I will roll with this one. Raised the review stars, because of my satified experience with the product. Oh, one more thing, I do believe they had a major quality issue get out, but just didn't catch it in time. They took the blow but will recover, by making the product better. Tighten down on the Quality Control ASUS. Many people like your product and the price range.

Reviews.Title: A solid tablet, at an affortable price.
Reviews.Author: Santiago
Reviews.Content: As I am writing this review, my TF300 is running 4.1 jelly beam and not ice cream sandwich. So the quick review for this product is it is a very solid tablet, that for the speed, memory, and screen is well worth the buy. So to go over some of the the real life facts that might change some peoples opinion on if they should get this table or not. First off, this is a fast tablet. Running on normal mode (you have power saver, normal, and performance), this tablets takes on everyday tasks and even some very intensive games like a champ. The screen is also beautiful enough to truly show off to friends and family, and combined with the speed can already get some auto buys from some people. The memory is 32gb, which is more then enough for most people. Some minor downsides include no flash on the back camera (taking pictures can become difficult because of this), a battery life that only lasted between 6-8 hrs, a badly placed speaker that gets muffled if the table is on its back, and no expandable memory. Of course though, all of those downsides are not too terrible and most of them can be worked around. Taking into account that this is a quaid-core tablet that is sub 400$, this tablet has earned my everyday use and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Constantly Freezes, touch screen stopped working
Reviews.Author: John Tan
Reviews.Content: ASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue)3rd UPDATE NOV 15 (system keeps rebooting)-------------After the 2nd time at the service center, the touch screen was replaced. When we received the tablet back the touch screen worked perfectly. HOWEVER, the tablet now continuously reboots itself. We can't even go 5 minutes without it rebooting. Even when we're not touching or using the tablet I noticed it just reboots itself. After 3+ of purchasing this tablet we still have not been able to use it and I'm assuming customer support will tell me to send the tablet back to the service center for a 3rd time. Don't they test their products before selling them to the public. Any confidence in Asus products has gone out the window and I would never purchase anything of there's in the future and i would recommend for anyone to stay away!2nd UPDATE OCT 25 (touch screen still does not work after being serviced)-------------After contacting support, I was told to create an RMA and ship the tablet to one of the service centers. After a couple of week I received the tablet back, when I turned on the tablet the initial screen worked and and i set it down. When I came back and had to swipe the lock, ONCE AGAIN THERE WAS NO RESPONSE FROM THE TOUCH SCREEN and I CANNOT DO ANYTHING WITH THE TABLET.What was the use of spending my money to ship the tablet to the service center and they can't even fix the issue! Once again I'd recommend NOT purchasing this product, even when you ship it back to get repaired they send it back with the same issues.------------------------------FIRST COMMENT (touch screen does not work)Bought this tablet a month and a half ago. Without even installing any apps the system started constantly freezing. Its completely useless when everytime I try to browse or open gmail the system freezes. Rebooting and cold rebooting doesn't help.Then 2 weeks after amazons 30 day return policy, the touch screen completely stopped working.I tried to reboot, cold reboot, wipe data and now all i get is the startup screen when you boot up the tablet for the very first time and because the touch screen does not work I can't get past the initial page.When the tablet is working, it's great!! But needless to say as much as I do not want apple products, maybe I should have gone with an ipad. As much as Asus is still probably trying to work things out with their technology, my suggestion to you is to stay away from Asus tablets. More of a waste of time trying to get repaired and probably a complete waste of $300.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Hope D. Tolboe "Dealsllc"
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before but I wanted everyone to know what a great  tablet this is.  Just bought this a week ago and was originally looking at the Ipad 3 but thought i'd try this one first because for a hundred dollars less than the Ipad 3 basic model, I was getting twice the storage space at 32gb vs 16gb, with the capability of expanding even farther with an SD card.  Has a usb port which i quite surprisingly found out i can use my xbox 360 wired controller to play android games, pretty simply, just plug and play. Not even the sales people knew it would do that.  The graphics are awesome too.  I purchased the keyboard as well, and i'm amazed at how long the battery lasts.  I can play around on this thing for hours and don't have to worry about the battery one bit.  This probably isnt the most technical review, but i truely believe this tablet is worth looking at.  I have found nothing at all to complain about.  Unless you want to buy an Apple product just because of the popularity, then go ahead, but i'm sure compared side by side i believe the Asus Transformer would kick butt.

Reviews.Title: Quality control issue
Reviews.Author: D. Son
Reviews.Content: I purchased Transformer tf300 a week ago and immediately noticed it had battery life issue. Running on balanced power mode and at 25% brightness, it was running only 5-6 hours.Returning and getting the replacement unit was very easy with Amazon. Initially, I contacted ASUS to ask whether the real-life battery time I am getting is reasonable or if I have a defective unit. Tech. support is essentially useless. They have very poor knowledge on the product they are servicing and lacking even common knowledge on electronics. Example: one tech support insisted that 10 hours of battery life advertised is the 'stand-by' time as in the cell phone, and 5-6 hours of usable battery time is normal, which makes absolutely no sense. ASUS does not seem to educate their tech support properly.Now I have new replacement unit and the battery life is much longer 7-8 hours under the same condition, although it is still shorter than what they advertise. But I noticed the replacement has a different issue: a gap along the bezzel on the left side of the screen near the volume button. It's wide enough to notice easily. I don't want to rely on my luck to receive properly functioning tablet with no defects. ASUS definitely needs better quality control.

Reviews.Title: tf300 resets and reboots
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: Finally got a replacement unit. This has completely resolved the resets issue.There is still a minor issue with the docking station (keyboard) to tablet connection.The connection is not too reliable, and the tablet may disconnect from SD plugged into docking station rather easily.Nevertheless since its a minor issue I increased my rating to 5 stars.Previous review:This is a great product with questionable reliability.I got my tf300 four days ago. From day 1 I noticed peculiar freezes and unit reboots. The reboots may occur while surfing the web, in the settings screen, or in any other app. The reboots were especially frequent when I tried to download data via USB from my desktop to the tf300 (after installing ASUS sync application on the desktop still got reboots).Initially I thought it might be a firmware or android problem, however they were both up to date (As of 16'th June). Then I was told by customer service to try factory reset, which did not help at all. Currently I'm trying to return or replace the unit at the local dealer but even this is difficult.Its a shame that Asus debugs its product and production line on the backs of their customers. The tf300 price advantage was diminished for me due to the time I wasted on trying to make it work.

Reviews.Title: Can't take a hit..
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Abretske "Mike A."
Reviews.Content: Have had a Viewsonic Gtab for about 2 years and it has taken several hits, and is still going.. Bought this Tablet from Fry's electronics and it is sooooo much better in every way.. Software, features, speed, screen, weight, thickness.. But damned if the thing can't take a hit.. Fours days old and BAMM!! the party's over - I'm back to the old Gtab.. Now I get to try out my virgin AMEX Purchase Protection Program; 90 days from purchase against accidental damage and theft (looks like it will be covered).. Anyway - "they" say that this newer style unit with the plastic back is supposed to remedy the WiFi and GPS reception issues; gotta weigh that against its ability to take a hit - or at least get some type of softshell protection because it is thin and fragile..***EDIT*** - 1/27/2013: This is nice Technology, BUT!! Make sure you buy the insurance.. Some sort of Drop coverage.. Cover yourself like I did.. You WILL experience a drop; It's not a matter of IF, but rather, only a matter of WHEN. And this thing has abysmal chances of coming through it intact. If not for this - I would have totally given it five stars.

Reviews.Title: Good affordable Android table with a few drawbacks
Reviews.Author: random thoughts
Reviews.Content: Pros- Affordable Android tablet- Good overall performanceCons- Unique/proprietary charging requirements- Possible issues with screen popping outJust wanted to share my findings briefly. I've had this tablet for a month, and it has satisfied my needs in almost every way.However, I discovered that the wall wart to charge this table outputs 15V rather than the 5V the iPad charger has, and the same 5V you get from a computer's USB slot. This means that you cannot effectively charge this tablet via any method except the wall wart, and I imagine you shouldn't use the wall wart with any other device. I imagine the reason for the 15V is either a hardware requirement or possibly a proprietary requirement. If anyone has more experience in electricity, please send me a notice so I can update this review with more detailed information.Second, I heard that it can be easy to pop the screen out of this unit if you twist the unit enough, so keep that in mind. This may be a side effect of the less expensive construction.Having said all that, I have been very satisfied with the device.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product at an Excellent price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this product and I'm loving it.  After extensive research, I decided that this was the tablet for me.  It really is the best deal for the price. I was torn between this tablet and the Samsung Galaxy 2 Tab.  Sure, the Samsung tab has a phenomenal screen, but it is only dual core.  For me, speed won over screen resolution.  After doing all of my research, I went in to Best Buy and talked with the sales associate in the tablet section.  He agreed that this Asus tablet is the best value out there for top of the line tablets.  He said he actually owns the older version of my tablet and has had it for about a year and still loves it.I would highly recommend this tablet to anyone in the market for a speedy, top of the line tablet.

Reviews.Title: Screen tearing issues
Reviews.Author: Saurabh
Reviews.Content: Got this tablet a week back. Screen tearing started occurring within a couple of days. Somewhat related to the keys on the left side bottom. Restarting the device fixed the problem temporarily. Maybe I just got a lemon but ASUS you need to get your act together. I really want to love this device because it worked perfectly at other times. Really fast responses, a couple of app crashed here and there. And there really is no dearth of tablet specific apps on Android, that's just a myth now.I have returned my device as of now but will be ordering another soon.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but problems.
Reviews.Author: R. Vasquez
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this short because in reality it's not worth the effort. I'm officially through 3 TF300s. First one would not power on after about a week, Second one the entire screen because unresponsive no matter how many times I reset it, and the third and final one has unresponsive spots. In order to click the view all apps button I have to flip the screen because horizontally with the "ASUS" logo right side up it will not respond to me pressing it. The camera has become completely useless. I click record, click it again to end, click the preview to watch it in gallery and it starts to record again. Half the time gallery will not open. I've spent a good 2 hours trying to get it to connect to my Bluetooth. When I did it on the first and second tablet it took 30 seconds. Terrible terrible product. Never again will I buy from ASUS. Time to wait for the Surface to release.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Screen VERY EASY to crack
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I will add more to the review when I have time but I wanted to go ahead and put this on here as a warning to anyone who owns one or is considering buying one.  The LCD cracks VERY easily.  I have only had mine for just over 1 month.  It has been in a protective case and has been handled with care.I have had an ipad since the original so I am very used to a tablet.  Anyway, I don't even know how it cracked.  It wasn't dropped, bumped or held by the corner.  The housing and glass are perfect (no scratches, marks or anything). After looking at it carefully, it seems the housing does not provide enough support.  After it cracked, I gently flexed it and with the slightest of pressure you can see the housing flex and the LCD flexing inside.  I liked the usability and the overall device but there is NO WAY I would buy another one until they fix this issue. I guess the metal housing on the ipad keeps it from flexing.By the way, I called ASUS and they are not very helpful. I was on hold for nearly an hour.  I could barely understand the first person I talked with.  I then asked to speak to a manager.  He was fairly easy to understand and attempted to be helpful but he just kept telling me I had put too much pressure on the screen. I am far from an Apple fan (in fact that's what drove me to try the ASUS).  However, ASUS could learn a thing or two from Apple Customer Care.I have read other reviews regarding this LCD issue but ASUS was adamant that I caused too much force and that's what broke the screen.  Again, my advice is if you haven't bought one, don't until they fix the LCD issue. If you have bought one, handle it like you would an egg and strongly consider buying some type of a warranty that covers screen cracking.I honestly think there should be a recall or some type of a warranty on these LCD's.  I am convinced there is a design flaw or faulty parts involved.  Does anyone know how we go about having someone look into doing something like this?  Is there an online site or an address to mail to where we could make a request that this be looked at?UPDATE AFTER REPAIR - So, I sent the tablet in for repair after being told they could test it to see what caused it to crack.  I told them that was great because I knew I didn't anything more than normal pressure on it.  Well, I got an email back saying I broke it (Customer Induced Damage).  I called to find out how their tests concluded that when I knew better.  I was then told that they didn't have a way of testing it but that it was certified during original testing to withstand 50kg (110 lbs).  So, for anyone reading this, take comfort - your TF300 (according to ASUS) will withstand 110 lbs of pressure on the LCD without breaking.  I can promise you that is not true.  I wouldn't be comfortable with it withstanding 10 lbs of pressure....I know mine didn't.Anyway, they won't budge.  They just keep saying it was my fault.  In all fairness, the lady I dealt with was being as nice as she could be.  She didn't have final say and she can't help that her company doesn't care about the customer.  I am sure she needs the job so she isn't going to do anything to risk it.  So, I pay the ransom to get my tablet back.  It arrives and I turn it on to test it out.  After a short while, I find out the screen does not respond to touch on the narrow edge near the headphone jack.  I was using an application in protrait mode and the icon to close the app was located on the bottom edge.  When I touched the icon, nothing happened.  I then tried out more apps and more icons on the botton edge and it doesn't work.  I can rotate it so the top edge becomes the botton edge and the icons then respond to touch.So, my nightmare with Asus and their poor products, poor quality and poor customer service continues.  For everyone loving theirs, my only hope is that you never have a problem because at that point, you will regret the day you ever trusted this company with your money.  I will report back when I know more.

Reviews.Title: Screen Cracked while in Dock
Reviews.Author: Noumena
Reviews.Content: I literally put the tablet in the dock, closed the dock, came back later and when I opened the dock the screen had cracked tremendously on the top right.  Do yourself a favor and get a gorilla glass version.  The tf300 is a dud.If yours hasn't cracked, it will.

Reviews.Title: Faulty unreliable product!!
Reviews.Author: Dan.L.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item at a retail store a few months back.  So far its been serviced 4 times.  Touchscreen was unresponsive the first time, power button and rebooting issues the other times.  It will probably be going back for the 5th and final time for more touchscreen issues....it seems to like to touch itself.Reading some of these reviews tells me these problems are quite common.  After this experience I'll be staying away from Asus products for awhile...or forever.Disappointed with the product, disappointed with the brand.

Reviews.Title: Bad Customer Service/Support
Reviews.Author: Dan F.
Reviews.Content: After looking for nearly a year at different tablets I was excited about getting the TF300.  The tablet worked fine for a few weeks.  I had a simple question that took ASUS three days to respond to.  Then my HDMI port got a short.  I now have to twist and hold the cable to get the signal.  I emailed their customer service for a repair ticket 5 days ago and am still waiting.  Two stars for the decent tablet and no stars for no-customer-service.Update:  after waiting 7 days for a response to my email, I finally called the customer support.  While ASUS is willing to make the repairs, I have to pay the shipping to their repair facility.  This doesn't sit well with me, especially for a product that is less than 2 months old.  Companies like Canon will provide a pre-paid shipping label when I've dealt with them in the past.  I would think a reputable company like ASUS would do the same which is why I paid a higher price than for one of the cheap knock-off brands.Update 10/25/12:  Sent in the tablet and it needs a complete main board replacement!  This is a major repair to a two month old tablet that will be done in the back of a shop instead of the clean room factory environment.  I contacted ASUS to request replacement instead as the tablet will no longer be the same after such a major repair.  It doesn't even make sense cost wise to as the tablet retails for $350.00.  I can't imagine their cost is more than half of that.  What does it cost to replace a main board in a repair center?  Needless to say they refused.  I now have a refurbished tablet that cost retail plus shipping.  If an additional problem crops up (much more likely after this type of repair) I'll be out another shipping charge to send it in.  I will never buy ASUS again.

Reviews.Title: spend 200 more and get the apple
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: It keeps turning off. It's scary, I would spend the extra 200 and get the apple. The battery is full, but the thing keeps turning off. I did some research online and apparently a lot of people had this same issue.

Reviews.Title: To Good to be True becaus it is.
Reviews.Author: J.W.
Reviews.Content: Do not purchase this product you may regret it in the end and could end up spending more then you think for this tablet. My tablets screen broke 31 days after purchasing and had to use asus repair facility it was the worst experiance I ever had with any company don't just take my word for it look up there costumer service satisfaction reviews. They took over two weeks to even contact me and then they told me it was costumer induced damage. there is no arguing with them or telling them your side the only way to contact them is by email and they refuse to give you a number to call so you can talk, and they take days to respond to each email. Also before you purchase google cracked screen TF300 you will find alot of complaints on how easy it is to crack a screen mine broke in my hand I was holding it with my right hand on the side and the weight of the tablet cracked the screen does this sound like costumer induced damage to you I am not the only person who has had this issue most others where people that use them in docking stations you will find reviews about the screen cracking while using a dock. also you may want to refrain from the nexus tablet considering it uses the same flimsy glass as the tf300 just my opinon though.8/13/12Still have not recieved my tablet back from the Asus repair facility they have had it since 7/8/12.

Reviews.Title: Crashes...A LOT!
Reviews.Author: Sydney M. Willett
Reviews.Content: The ASUS Transformer TF300 with Android Ice Sandwich is a terrible tablet. It crashes at the slightest provocation. Using the Flash Player crashes after a while. Using Skype crashes. Browsing the Internet crashes. Accessing my network drive crashes. The tablet has difficulty recognizing a microSD card when it is plugged in. Sometimes the tablet has to be booted multiple times to see the card, then can't see it after the tablet crashes. The WiFi is slow, even though I have a high speed N network using a top-notch wireless router. I don't know if the problem is the tablet, ICS, the apps, or a combination of two or more. Whatever, my iPhone is a much better product. I bought this tablet as an experiment to see if I liked using a tablet. This product soured me on tablets. Fortunately, it is not my primary computing device. Do not buy this tablet. If you must have one, spend the extra money and buy an iPad...or buy a cheap notebook instead.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet computer and did not know what to expect.  I had used a co-worker's ipad for a couple of projects in the office; however, because I have an android smartphone decided I should stick with an android tablet.  While I was not expecting the same performance of the more expensive ipad, I never expected such a poor performing tablet as the asus 300tf.  First the browser is practically worthless it constantly crashes with the message "Browser is not responding. Would you like to close it? [Wait / OK]".  The touch screen is non-responsive at times and when it does work it begins to freeze, skip and jump.  I do not know if I have a lemon, but I will give it a couple of more days to see if things improve, otherwise I will be returning.Update...Asus came out with a firmware update today(May 18), I installed the update and it completed bricked my tablet.  The touch screen became completely unresponsive I had to attach the keyboard so I could enter my password and log on.  I called customer support and they were no help.  Apparently I have a lemon, will be returning.Can anyone recommend a good android tablet?

Reviews.Title: Some minor issues found but the jury is still out
Reviews.Author: Wayno
Reviews.Content: Update 1: Removed comment about ecompass; seems to be working better after reboot with Sky but still wacky with other compass app... likely a SW issue.One thing I forgot to add earlier... the automatic brightness setting appears not to be functioning correctly.  When you turn it on it goes WAY dark, to the point where it is pretty much unusable even in a dim room.  If ambient lighting is turned on it goes to the midpoint and then just sits there forever without any dynamic adjustments.  I'm sure this is a software issue and it doesn't really bother me but I thought others might want to comment about possible solutions, etc._______________________________ORIGINAL TEXT______________________This is my first tablet.  I prefer the flexibility of Android and I already have an Android phone so I decided to give this one a try.  I also do not want to install iTunes on any of my PCs.I decided to purchase a tablet because I do not like having to boot up or keep a PC running just to check my email, surf the web, watch a video, or read an ebook.  I decided to go with this unit because it's being sold at a reasonable price for its specs.  I really wanted a tablet with a USB port so I could transfer photos in the field but no models so equipped were/are available at the time with an IPS screen (another one of my requirements).  In the end, I decided that the USB adapter and this tablet would suffice.  I do not believe in spending big bucks on something that I can't do real work on so I stayed away from the expensive iPads and premium Android models like the ASUS Transformer Prime.I have mixed feelings after using the TF300 for a couple of days.  It is speedy and comes with plenty of RAM.  RAM is expandable via a microSD card which is also a big plus.  Pretty much all the programs that I have tried on it fly and I haven't noticed any bothersome slow-downs that some have noted.  The USB adapter works but I would have much preferred a cable because it becomes a rather long moment arm hanging off of a delicate connector when it is in place.  Also, you pretty much have to use the tablet upside-down when the adapter or the power cord is connected.  For normal use this is fine because the screen flips automatically but some programs, mainly games, insist on displaying in only in native orientation.The screen is more than bright enough for indoor use but not enough for daylight outdoors.  It's also a HUGE finger magnet. At this point in time, the "Next iPad", with its much higher resolution screen (I refuse to use their incorrect marketing jargon for it) just wipes the floor with all the Android tablet displays out there.  Hopefully that will change sometime soon but I foresee the manufacturers charging a large premium for the increased resolution.  The screen does have some minor light bleed that is noticeable when the background is black but nothing that I consider overly objectionable.  What bothers me more is that when the background is completely white I can see a slight yellowish gradient near the top.  Not sure if most people would notice this but it bothers me; especially when I'm reading ebooks.  Both Wifi and GPS work great.  I wish there were speakers on both, or even three sides like some competitors have, but they sound clear and are loud enough for me.  If I want louder I plug in headphones or connect some via bluetooth.Now on to the bad.  The build quality (or maybe the internal design) is not what I would call "bulletproof".  When I push on the screen near the left bezel I can feel it flex.  If I look into the microSD port I can see the opening change shape when it's flexing.  I'm worried about the long term repercussions of this.  The screen feels solid around the rest of the bezel perimeter.  I checked on the display model at a local store and it has the same issue so unfortunately this does not appear to be an isolated case.Being a fan of Google Sky, I quickly found that ecompass to be terrible.  It's off by about 90 degrees and very inconsistent.  I've tried calibrating it and trying different applications with no luck.  If anyone knows how to put this tablet into diagnostic mode let me know so I can figure out if this is a hardware or software issue.I'll try to update this review as I log more time with the unit.  For now I give it 4 stars because of the bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: ASUS TF300 Software
Reviews.Author: Ronald R. Miller
Reviews.Content: Sept 3 2012.  Got this tablet from Amazon three days ago.  I bought this to stream Netflix and Amazon movies.  The TF300 won't do either one due to Adobe Flash not being supported.  This is really a big deal.The installed email client hangs forcing me to use web mail on all 4 of my email accounts.On some apps the virtual buttons require up to 6 finger taps to initiate the button. On other apps the screen buttons work perfect.So far can't get the tablet to work on the home network.  Some of the problem is probably Windows stuff but the Windows machines don't even see the tablet but the tablet sees the Windows machines.  Networks are always a pain.The hardware seems to work great but the software is weak.  The fiddle factor seems high to do anything useful.  All the great reviews made me believe this tablet might work out of the box.  Not working out that way.Bluetooth and GPS and camera work great.I will fiddle with it for a few more days but atm I am undecided about this tablet.Btw, when ordering this tablet one has a choice of blue or white.  Does anyone know what that means?  It sure does not refer to the color of the tablet.  I ordered blue and got black even though the box said blue.  The Amazon ads for the white one also show black.  Guess you can order any color you want as long as it is black.More later.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: K. Lee
Reviews.Content: This is the only second tablet I have owned, the Kindle Fire being the first. While the Fire is the best at reading ebooks and with Amazon based services, I can now see where it is severely restrained compared to full fledged tablets, since it meant to be mainly an Amazon based device.The TF300 is quite a leap forward in abilities and options. And that's not including the keyboard.  The TF300 runs the few games and apps I have tried, so far, without a glitch.Pros:It is extremely fast.It has lots of memory( I got the 32gig), and options to add more( micro sd on the tablet and full sd card with the keyboard).The 10 inch display is stunningly beautiful.The tablet is not too heavy for its size.The wifi is very strong.The GPS works great.The body of the tablet feels solid.Keyboard option.I haven't found any of the problems others have so far. Looks like I got a good one, like most others have, right out of the box.I made sure to do the software updates immediately after powering it up, that is always a great idea.My choices had been down to the Iconia 510 and this ASUS TF300. While I really like specs on both, the $50 extra Acer wanted was not justified buy the very sight edge it had in a couple of areas over the TF300, plus the TF300's keyboard option along with ASUS's excellent customer service ( based on many customer and professional reviews) were the deciding factors in my choice to by the TF300.My only cons so far are: The single speaker slot and its placement. Speakers widely separated at the top of the tablet would have been better.(Still, the sound quality is  very, very good and plenty loud.)The ports could have used covers. Even so,the microsd card would be extremely hard to eject by accident, a big plus.In the 3 days I've had it, I have been putting many hours in to learning the tablet. These are the only cons I have found so far.It seems to me to be the best bang for the buck at this time.

Reviews.Title: best tablet out there
Reviews.Author: Robbie Ware
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing. Its extremely fast and ice cream sandwich runs without a hitch. Asus did a fantastic job with the hardware and software and the result is a tablet that rivals the iPad. I have had no problems whatsoever and I definitely recommend this to anybody looking for a great tablet for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Bad charger-seems to be a problem....
Reviews.Author: amazoom
Reviews.Content: Tablet worked well until I tried to charge it after its first battery drain the first day of use. It would charge then stop charging in a contual cycle. I learned that the charger can be defective via forums. I tried some temp fixes to try and get it charged again. Put the charger in the freezer to reset the thermal breaker--yes it worked, so far..... Currently it is charging. ASUS needs to fix the charger isssue! Another charger is $30--will I have the same problen with that one?

Reviews.Title: A Good, Affordable Tablet With Some Minor Quibbles
Reviews.Author: Antonio Shaw "SHAWAM!!!"
Reviews.Content: Besides its price, I opted for the Transformer TF300 over the Transformer Prime because its plastic construction wasn't as flimsy as I'd been led to believe, and the plastic build also ensured I'd have better wi-fi reception and avoid the issues with GPS and signal strength that the Prime suffered from. With the exception of the Prime's aluminum body, longer-lasting battery, camera flash, and moderately brighter screen, the TF300 is practically identical while costing significantly less.The TF300 has the same Tegra 3 quad-core processor as the Prime, and it shows; it's fast, powerful, and fluid. It has surprisingly loud audio, but it lacks stereo output (either because there's just one speaker, or, if there are two speakers, they're too close together). Still, it's far louder than even my laptop. When my screen is black, I notice some light bleed in a few of the corners, but it's nothing major and becomes unnoticeable when the screen is displaying colors other than black. That being said, the Pad's screen is a bit underwhelming. I wouldn't say it's terrible, but the screen on my Galaxy S2 blows this thing out of the water. The Pad's colors aren't as vibrant and text/images aren't nearly as sharp. It took me a while to adjust to the lower resolution and more subdued colors. If you don't already have a mobile device with amazingly high resolution and vivid colors, then you probably won't have any problems with the Pad's screen at all. The native browser is unforgivably slow and buggy at times; hopefully, they rectify this in a future update.As for the battery, I'm impressed. I'm not a heavy user (I mainly use my tablet to play word games and do light web browsing and reading), so I find that I rarely have to charge my TF300, perhaps once every other day. Apps that are optimized for tablets really shine on this device thanks to ICS and the quad-core processor. With the exception of the browsers, I've never had problems with any of the apps that were actually optimized or specifically designed for tablets. I love the keyboard dock. It is, of course, significantly smaller than a regular desktop or laptop keyboard, but if you're at all comfortable with typing on netbooks then you shouldn't have any problems using the keyboard dock. I have fairly large hands for a man, but I still find the keyboard dock adequate, just make sure you turn off the hyper-sensitive track pad while you're typing. Oh, and the keyboard charges the Pad when you dock it, provided the keyboard dock has an adequate charge.The keyboard dock leads me to my biggest and final gripe with the TF300: it doesn't come with productivity software. This should have been a no-brainer, especially when one considers that Asus made such a functional keyboard dock in the first place. Yes, you can use Google Docs (now merged into Google Drive, if you weren't yet aware), but that presents you with Google Docs' main shortcoming: you need to be connected to the internet in order to use it. If I could open, edit, save, and create word documents without having to be connected to the internet I'd probably get rid of my laptop, or at least relegate it to the same dust-gathering status of my netbook.So, that was my rather long review of the Asus Transformer Pad TF300. I'm truly pleased with it, despite some shortcomings. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone in the market for an Android tablet. If you've always wanted the Asus Transformer Prime but were put off by its sticker price and/or GPS/wireless issues, then this is absolutely the tablet for you.UPDATE-6/17/2012It was brought to my attention that the included software, Polaris Office, is a productivity suite. I opened it up briefly when I first received my tablet and assumed it was nothing more than a file manager, but you can, in fact, create word documents and such with it.UPDATE-6/18/2012After doing some research for a problem I was having with Polaris Office (it would open my Word documents but it wouldn't let me edit them) I found out that there is a major bug with this software that causes random, irreparable corruption of files. Users have reported losing homework, papers, and lab reports.

Reviews.Title: some minor issues
Reviews.Author: Yasser
Reviews.Content: It was perfect, until several hours of use.When I turned the device on I noticed a bright spot on the bottom of the screen but I can live with it. The tablet feels good itself. however I started experiencing some screen flickering, the task bar jumps up and down, on the left side of the screen. It disappeared after some time without using it. I'm really hoping its a software issue, if not I'm returning it. But its really good for the price!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Mother's Day gift!  I love it.  Nicely compares to iPad 2 but with flash available so I can see things on the PBS site (a big deal for me).  I already had an iPod touch and an Android (Samsung) phone.  Unlike my Samsung phone, I had no problems setting up a VPN to connect to my corporate network and there were several RDP clients available to connect to my servers.  The dock is wonderful--gives me much more screen space for those server connections when I need it.  Of course, without the dock is nice, too--just not for doing server work.I have no issues with wifi connections or the GPS.  I like the c:geo program for geocaching (I use it on my phone).  The 10 inch screen makes geocacher nicer in some respects (although harder to hide from muggles).  It's about as easy to see as my phone--I think the 201 would have been easier but it was dinged for both wifi connectivity and GPS.  And my husband's iPad 2 doesn't do as well picking up GPS signals (and I don't find it as easy to see in bright sunlight but he thinks it's more of a toss up--I think it may have to do with glasses and tints).

Reviews.Title: I really like this tablet!
Reviews.Author: silvercoupe40
Reviews.Content: As a newbie to the tablet market, I originally was quite enamored with it.  Since then, I've grown weary of the tablet's flaws. I am a casual user and use my TF300t to play games, surf  the web, read eBooks, organise my life, and listen to music.Pros:1. The flexibility of converting a tablet into a net book using the optional dock. (My  primary reason for choosing this brand over any other.)2. The screen resolution is very crisp indoors. Don't bother using this in sunlight.3. The WiFi is very strong and fast but like other reviewers, I get the "wait" or " disconnect" message regularly.4. Very good battery life; especially using the dock.5. The price is very competitive for what this tablet offers.6. Very  good camera.Cons:1. The responsiveness of the touch screen is not consistent. Because the screen is either too sensitive or not sensitive enough, playing games or typing very frustrating at times.Overall, I am having fun with my tablet. So far, I am not seeing any defects in the h/w or s/w as described in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: LESS THAN PRIME, MORE THAN AVERAGE
Reviews.Author: Evans MS
Reviews.Content: I'm quite amazed with this product, indeed a great product for the price. The blue color is a really nice dark blue, you won't be disappointed, many features and very good speed.

Reviews.Title: Best Android Tablet for its price level.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet about a week after it came out. Although I was initially wary as Asus sometimes is known to delay and have problems in its first launch, I took the chance.  The tablet arrived on time and with no issues. I have had the tablet for about two weeks know and am still learning about all the cool ics features but in all I think that this is an excellent tablet for its price range, and in my opinion the best most affordable android tablet out there right now. I do no have the dock.Pros:Appearance:The tablet looks and feels solid, the back is plastic but its both durable and refined. The spun look feels good and grips well. Also, the edges are easy to hold onto and feel comfortable. It may be thinker than the prime but the tablet is damn thin and certainly doesn't feel bulky at all. It's as heavy as it looks which allows to be easily carried by two hands but I wouldn't hold it with one for an extended period of time.The screen is very prone to fingerprints but also feels really smooth and cool. I put a skinomi clear screen protector and that helps. It's also really responsive.Hardware: With the Tegra 3 this baby is a beast, it delivers high quality graphics and can run a ton of apps at the same time without any lag. The 1280 by 800 screen looks pretty great and is better than most laptops. It may not look as great as the Ipad 3 but it is great for it's price point. Some games like Shadowgun thd and Galaxy on Fire 2 look amazing. Also the cameras are quite formidable, the 8mp on the back takes detailed, natural pictures but works best outside and the front facing is fine for video chatting.The speakers sound really good, nice and loud for such a small device. Mic works fine as well. Wifi and GPS have no problems and are very quick.Software: Now this is my first Android device and up til now I've only had my windows 7 laptop and my ipod touch. Google's Ice Cream Sandwich is pretty great but still has some flaws and glitches. I find the multitaksing way better than in ios and same with task management. I find myself using both the stock browser and chrome beta with some issues on both of them. With flash I love that I can surf the web in its true form and I like being able to automatically set to desktop sites always. Google Play store is certainly a work in progress but it has a good number of apps and is looking nicely. The tablet also comes with some preloaded apps like Polaris Office which I really like and gmail which is better than the stock email in my opinion.  While I've had a few crashing apps that's mostly due to me rooting the device and whatnot. Anyways the interface and custom widgets really make it look cooler than iOS but the play store and ease of setting up apps isn't as great.Battery life: It's really great and I find that even doing stuff like watching films or downloading files doesn't take a huge toll on the battery.Storage: The 32 gb SSD is fast and works great, expandable memory up to 32 gigs is also awesome.Cons:If you hold the tablet for a long time it can feel warm around your grip. Also as I've mentioned the screen smudges pretty easily.The stock keyboard kinda sucks, luckily you can change it which I would highly recommend. I got the thumb keyboard which I find easier to type on though there is occasionally some lag.There simply aren't as many apps. While some apps you really won't need since using flash you can access the website version, There are some apps I was looking for but just couldn't find yet for tablets.Also, many apps are there but not great because they're made for android phones.Furthermore, the screen is lacking that super IPS+ that the prime has and while it is great for indoor lighting, outside the T300 is found wanting.Conclusion: For it's cheap $379 price, this tablet can't be beat. I highly recommend it, issues and all.UPDATE 5/25Okay so I've got to know the tablet more, I still stand behind everything I said about the tablet but I do have more opinions about ICS. I like it but I've noticed some issues, browser freezes kind of a lot but then continues. Also the launcher (main screen) has crashed on me like 3 times and makes me have to reboot the device to fix it. I've gotten 2 firmware updates so far one for the camera and one that gave me the face unlock. So Asus is on top of updates which I think is pretty important. In short, I like ICS because it allows me to do a lot more than iOS however it's not as stable (yet at least).

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Mother's Day gift!  I love it.  Nicely compares to iPad 2 but with flash available so I can see things on the PBS site (a big deal for me). Reviews.Author: Evans MS
Reviews.Content: I'm quite amazed with this product, indeed a great product for the price. The blue color is a really nice dark blue, you won't be disappointed, many features and very good speed.

In short, I like ICS because it allows me to do a lot more than iOS however it's not as stable (yet at least).

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for price.
Reviews.Author: Willy Wailer
Reviews.Content: I have had computers for a very long time (Apple II) and change them out periodically.  I also have a Kindle Fire, my wife has an iPad3 and I just bought this ASUS Android.  I find nothing wrong with this ASUS tab or the other two as well.  There is a lot of commonality between all three so I suggest that you look at the differentiators and the cost to make your decision.  I like my Fire for size & weight; the ASUS for price point on a good 10" tab that is light weight.  The iPad for all that is good/bad about Apple plus screen and solid construction but very heavy.

Reviews.Title: ASUS does not stand behind their products
Reviews.Author: Steven O'Hara
Reviews.Content: This was purchased expecting it to last well.  Within 9 months, the plastic rim near the hinge started to break off.  The design places too much strain on the plastic case when operating the hinge (in notebook mode).  Once the plastic adjacent the hinge broke off, the hinge was very loose and damaged the connector between the keyboard and the tablet.  It was returned to ASUS under warranty.  They responded that it was not a manufacturing defect and we were charged in full for their design flaw.  Fortunately we purchased this with a third-party warranty.  This is likely my last ASUS purchase, but I will be using Square Trade again!I forgot to mention, ASUS has no regard toward protecting identity theft.  In addition to submitting a payment form w/ credit card information, they require everyone to scan the front and back of their credit card and drivers license and include them as well.  Buy another brand!

Reviews.Title: Poorly constructed
Reviews.Author: V Taveras
Reviews.Content: The power button is poorly constructed, kept getting stuck, and so the tablet kept thinking it needed to restart constantly. I would suggest avoiding this tablet and Asus until they get their act together (if ever).

Reviews.Title: nice for it's time
Reviews.Author: Yuva
Reviews.Content: so obviously by now there are much better models of this tablet .. but for its time it was quite a gem ... only reason i will take away a star ... is the keyboard ... i found that it causes the battery to drain out much faster than expected. when the tablet is by itself .. it sleeps for a considerable time ... but when the tablet is plugged into the keyboard .. i find the battery drains even faster ... go figure

Reviews.Title: hate it
Reviews.Author: Tamiris
Reviews.Content: I can't watch online movies at all, constantly stopping and rebuffing, don't detect wifi easily, do not recommend it, bad choice

Reviews.Title: Biggest Mistake I Ever Made by Purchased this Junk
Reviews.Author: an2011
Reviews.Content: Please Do NOT waist you hard working money on this, you rather buy generic tablet, buy Surface, Amazon Kindle lot better quality and Customer service, not only that you don't ever need the customer service or trouble shooting for these tables.. Ever since I have bought this (just because of my daughter insist) not even 3 months so far, it's "finally Rest In Peace" I have bought lots of accessory along with all those flushed.., worst customer support you could ever encounter in Jamaica..,this table should be totally recalled. Or company should be shut down they don't have right to robbing people..

Reviews.Title: ASUS Transformer TF300
Reviews.Author: Rose Campbell
Reviews.Content: Having problems with mine, it is slow, and sometimes it kicks me out of a program, especially on the internetThe games I download on it are easy to play and we seem to have no problems there.  I do love the size of it and it is easy to use, just too slow.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful so far
Reviews.Author: Savannah Chancey
Reviews.Content: I am more of a pessimist when it comes to technology, since I'm a huge geek and love my two laptops, but so far this little device has done nothing but impress me.  It surfs the web better than i had hoped but i hadnt played around with a tablet for a few years, also it has great gaming capabilities for such a slime device.  I have had a few problems with games but i would assume that is due to the app itself and nothing to do with the tablet.  I will report back in about 3-6 months with a progress report and a final verdict.

Reviews.Title: Good product, had shipping issues
Reviews.Author: cranbiz
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tablet because of the price and the company reviews. I also paid for expedited 2 day shipping.I did NOT get 2 day expedited shipping. The tablet was shipped USPS and was shipped on Tuesday. Tracking showed the tablet out for delivery on Friday (3 days). Did not show up, out for shipping on Saturday (didn't show up) and finally showed up on Monday.The tablet does function flawlessly, is cosmetically perfect and did come with the AC adapter and cable.I would order from this vendor again but I would not pay extra for the shipping. That was a rip off.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Joshua Tyler
Reviews.Content: Not a bad buy I use it daily and easy to use, and much easier to carry around when traveling

Reviews.Title: Without Wi-Fi why bother??
Reviews.Author: NJBaseball
