Reviews.Content: It’s been 2 years since I bought my ASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue) and at best I can only give it a 2 star at this stage of use. My unit always has the latest android available from ASUS. The single biggest detriment contributing to my rating is the poor Wi-Fi performance. It single handedly promotes slow boot up as well as weak app performance and slow sync. I’ve seen some posts on other websites attribute the poor performance to app overload but I have to say that doesn’t wash, especially when you consider that the smartphone you may own will probably have the same apps, as is the case with me. My smartphone boots up fast and quickly syncs all apps and downloads as needed. That is the same performance I expect from a tablet and this ASUS never has, not even when new. I’ve seen other posts state that a tablet is not meant to be turned off preventing boot up issues. That’s a false crutch and it still doesn’t solve this unit’s intermittent Wi-Fi failure. All the other features of this tablet can be compared favorably with all other apps on the market. The ASUS has a terrific screen and nice size/form matter. Too bad as I really wanted this tablet to come thru. I would not recommend any ASUS tablet based on my unit’s performance.

Reviews.Title: TF300T
Reviews.Author: Stephen Gardner
Reviews.Content: Great little touch pad. Came with keyboard that includes extra battery. Interfaces just like my android phone. Makes for short learning curve.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Customer Service
Reviews.Author: A.N.12
Reviews.Content: I would give the tablet 3 stars, but ASUS customer service deserves 1 star at best.I purchased this tablet last year.  For exactly one year, it worked well.  Then one night I plugged it in to charge overnight and woke up the next morning to find that both the connector on the charger and the charger port had overheated and melted.  I contacted ASUS customer service.  I was assured that my tablet was still under warranty and that I could send it in for assessment and possible repair.  I received an e-mail in which I was assigned an RMA# and given mailing instructions for sending in my tablet.  In accordance with the ASUS mailing instructions, I sent in my tablet.  The service center received the tablet three weeks ago on April 30th.  As of right now, I have not received any updates or information from the repair center regarding the status of my tablet.  I have called customer service twice, once last week and the second time yesterday to see if I could get any information.  Both times I was told that I would receive an e-mail from the service/repair center in the future, but they could not say how soon that would be.  The service representative I spoke to last week said that he would elevate status of my case, which I guess means I might hear from ASUS after a month or two instead of three or four.  The service representative I spoke to yesterday also said that he would elevate the status of my case.  I told him that a representative had already done that last week.  After a moment, he confirmed that the status had been elevated last week.  At that point, he could do nothing more for me other than to once again assure me that I would receive an e-mail at some later date.  This has been a very frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: LCD went bad after 4 weeks of use
Reviews.Author: Cameron
Reviews.Content: I did get money back since I purchased warranty from square trade. I have had a few others and they have been ok

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Clarity
Reviews.Content: Works well. A quality tablet worth the price. I've had it for over a year and its still working like a charm. I would recommend it to anyone interested in a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Tweaked Out with no Support
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: The whole system became unstable, switching screens randomly etc. sent it to Asus they charged me and said they fixed it, but the problem persists and Asus is nowhere to be seen.Very disappointed in the customer service, and in the resilience of the Transformer.

Reviews.Title: tablet is good
Reviews.Author: Cari J. Jackson "C@ri"
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the tablet. it won`t download Adobe media player and some things need that to play on the tablet. Otherwise I love it

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: Randi
Reviews.Content: I really like this tablet.  I love the fact that it works as both a tablet and a mini laptop.  It really makes it convenient to type messages and emails and reviews like the one I am doing right now.  It is simple to use and has not given me any issues so far.  The screen is clear and bright and the sound is loud and clear  as well.  I feel that it is great quality for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Got if for my wife
Reviews.Author: jacob
Reviews.Content: She loves it, mainly because it has a usb and a micro sd, so we can back up more pic. She takes pictures of everything.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for the time
Reviews.Author: Wesley T.
Reviews.Content: First off, this is an outdated device by today's standards. It's even rather overpriced at current market value. It's a decent tablet if you can get it on sale, but otherwise, there are better options today.With that said, however, I'll be judging the functionality of this tablet based on the time it was released. When this tablet came out, it was one of the more powerful ones on the market. The Tegra 3 was a top-of-the-line SoC and even the lower binned chips in the TF300t were still rather snappy compared to the higher binned chips in the TF700 or TF200. Using the stock Asus Android build, it was a little choppy here and there. While Android itself was largely unmodified in the stock build, Asus added a lot of bloatware to push their ecosystem of services. These apps generally ran in the background and could not be killed/uninstalled. As a result, they ate up a non-trivial amount of processing power and memory. Unlocking and rooting the tablet (A relatively easy process thanks to the good people over at XDA) and installing a custom ROM meant you could overclock the CPU/GPU, and get rid of the bloatware. With that modification, the tablet rivaled anything else on the market, and definitely was one of the better priced options in the high-end market.The wifi and GPS on the TF300t was greatly improved over the previous TF200, thanks to the plastic body. It still retained that swirled finish, which looked very nice and was practical too, since it provided a better grip.The single external speaker was pitiful as most tablet speakers are. However, the TF300t speaker was particularly irritating because it was on the side of the tablet when held in landscape. This means that watching a movie or playing a game in landscape (as they should be watched/played) meant that you only got sound out of one side, which doesn't sound like a big problem but it actually is really annoying really quickly considering that tablet speakers tend to be tinny sounding and aurally grating. Imagine someone talking loudly into one ear, and you'll know what it was like to listen to this speaker at any useable volume. If the speaker were centered on the top, this would have been a much better location for it.The resolution is 1280x800, with the Android notification and home bars on the top and bottom, meaning effective screen resolution was basically 720p. For a 10" tablet, this is adequate, but pixels are noticeable when you're doing up-close reading or surfing. There was also some light bleed on the edges of the screen, noticeable only when viewing dark images/video. This was a common problem for this model, and in general, is a common problem with IPS screens.The biggest drawback to this tablet is the 1GB of RAM. Devices began coming out shortly after this tablet that had 1.5GB and 2GB of RAM, and the extra memory makes a huge difference in Android, probably more so than a faster processor would.All in all, it was a good tablet at the time it came out, and is still a decent tablet. There were no glaring deficiencies, as the TF200 had. The dock was a nice option. As long as you know what you're getting (which is old technology), and you are smart about the price you should pay for that technology, you will be happy with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Everything was great, but....
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: The tablet is great and the service was great.  The only issue I have is that the unit was an AT&T; device previously.  It has a socket and service for an LTE sim card.  Great Right?  Well it is locked and I have tried to get it unlocked by AT&T; since I use Verizon.  The have not provided me with anything.But what can I say, this is a great deal no matter how you look at it. I might just get another one.

Reviews.Title: Has its Bugs
Reviews.Author: scottr
Reviews.Content: Ive had the tf300 for 2 years when it started acting like it had a ghost in it, opening up apps on its own, typing letters like yyyyyy to the point I had trouble turning it even off. I liked it and bought another only to have it start doing the same thing on and off and no I was not Hacked. Bought the tf701 everything was fine but was not impressed with it and got a Samsung Note 10.1 2014.Update...I did seem to find a fix to my problem with the ghost inputs. 2 days so far with me in control of my tablet.

Reviews.Title: Unique design, but it seems I may have gotten a lemon
Reviews.Author: S. Melvin
Reviews.Content: Was a fan of the "Transformer" design from the moment I saw it - so it saddened me to give it a low rating - but I'll explain.First, the plus of the design.  It uses the Android operating system, allows for an optional (highly recommended) keyboard dock, and has a fairly nice system bump by ASUS to give it a slight advantage over the stock Android design.  ASUS has supported this up to the Jelly Bean upgrade (no official Kit Kat as of this review - but there are unofficial upgrades for it), which is a nice upgrade over the pre-installed Ice-Cream.  Scrolling between screens is smooth and software loading is fast and responsive.Now the bad - and I will caveat, this is only my experience, so I can't say if it is common or not.  Approximately 3-4 months after purchase, my tablet would reboot by itself whenever I touched it.  I called ASUS and they issued an RMA, stating that it was likely a short in the tablet.  After a few weeks away (and complete loss of my data on the tablet), it was returned and worked great.  Then, 2-3 months later, the connector ports that hold the tablet to the optional keyboard started showing signs of stress.  The plastic of the frame at these locations is thin and poorly made.  I use this tablet at home and only to surf while I am sitting watching TV.  How the wear was so great as to cause cracking of plastic is beyond me.  Even the center port, where the tablet actually interacts with the keyboard cracked.  The plastic is a bit thicker, but still too thin to be a secure point between two pieces of equipment that, while light, put stress on each other.  This eventually led to a small crack along the back of the tablet between the two ports.  I sent it in to ASUS for review and they stated - "Nothing found - no repairs necessary."  Then just this month (right after my warranty expires of course) the tablet started experiencing the same issue it did the first time - auto rebooting whenever I touch the tablet cover.  Sent it back in and looking forward to seeing how much ASUS wants to charge me to fix something that shouldn't be an issue to begin with.Overall, I've lost my data twice (as the reboots eventually lead to data loss) and had to send it in three times for repair.  I'm hoping this repair is my last, but I am now very hesitant to recommend an ASUS tablet to anyone.  It very well could be a lemon and not indicative of ASUS quality control, but it has left a bad taste in my mouth.  I love ASUS motherboards, but can honestly say it does not extend to their tablet products right now.  I gave it a 3 of 5, however, as I have found it to be very useful and responsive during those periods that it worked without issue.  I believe such technology should last longer than 1 yr, which is how long the warranty is good for - but I'll hold off on a final verdict until they fix it this time.  I'd recommend looking at other products unless enough of the feedback from owners is positive without issue.

Reviews.Title: keyboard docking station "buggy" from the start
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: This tablet lasted me all of 11 days before I sent it back for a refund.  When I got it, I connected the tablet to the docking station and charged it overnight.  Tablet worked flawlessly, but the keyboard docking station kept giving me problems.  Sometimes it worked fine: both would be fully charged, I would un-dock tablet and use it, re-dock and the docking station would recharge the tablet like it's supposed to work.  Other times, I would do the same thing and the docking station would immediately go from a full charge to zero WITHOUT charging the tablet.  Finally, the docking station just stopped taking a charge altogether.

Reviews.Title: AMAZON SHOULD BE YOUR FIRST STOP
Reviews.Author: Jillie alicea
Reviews.Content: I love my new tablet it works great and I saved $300.God is so GOOD when HE BLESSES HE BLESSES.I love you amazon.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!
Reviews.Author: Johnna A Ford
Reviews.Content: I put off buying a tablet for a long time. I finally decided to get one. My brother suggested asus which is his go to brand for electronics. Hubby wanted one with optional keyboard. I did not get keyboard but it is great without. Love it! Screen size is perfect for my old eyes. Bright colors. Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: disappointed in the performance
Reviews.Author: TracersAngel83
Reviews.Content: from day one I have had trouble with the device being a little slow and if I let things get backed up it'll crash. So I must be careful about how many app I run before clearing out the active stuff.LOVE the keyboard / battery. I last about 2 days of heavy use.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet-Keyboard is Junk
Reviews.Author: horegirl75
Reviews.Content: Tablet arrived on time. Faulty keyboard when it arriveed. Company sent another, also faulty. Sent both back and company refunded part of my money. Recently bought just the keyboard from another company, that one is faulty too. They all DO NOT charge when plugged in, which eventually runs down the battery in the tablet when you are trying to use both as a unit. This makes the battery last a maximum of an hour when you are trying to use the keyboard. Great customer service and quick responses from this company though.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Alesia
Reviews.Content: Read alot of reviews on this model and it rated the best and so far, it's working great...sweet HD quality screen and surprisingly great sound for internet radio

Reviews.Title: AWESOME NEW PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: realfunnytime "eric"
Reviews.Content: I have been totally satisfied by Amazons quality with this order. The ASUS Tablets have always been my favorite products anyway, they come 2 different cloud storage programs one with 8 gb and the same. The video player that is built in is awesome, if you need to go to your home page then back to the movie it shuts down but when you hit play again it starts were you left off perfectly. The battery in this tablet is crazy long lasting, I watched 3 movies and played games for an hour and still had 35% or more charge left to go. Wifi has awesome reception and audio is good too. The HDMI MICRO cables I bought at Best buy cost $53.00 and are worth every penny.The higher the quality of the video the better.  I have tested every connect and app that is built in and few that were downloaded, and I love this Tablet. I want to buy the TF700 for the wife and test it too, but I think it will pass the test as usual for ASUS products. Cameras front and back are great crisp clear pictures and video too.

Reviews.Title: versatile and lovely
Reviews.Author: hope h
Reviews.Content: The tablet does just what it advertises.  great processing speed, beautiful screen quality, good battery length, and the dock makes typing much, much easier.  With a 3rd party app you can put it on your phone's data plan or use wifi.The only downside I saw was in accessing certain base things.  Setting up the background images was a bit of a pain.  Little things.  Nothing major.  It was very, VERY much worth the money.  It holds up well against any other tablet I've worked with and better than some.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD price/quality. A VERY GOOD tablet, it has everything you need.
Reviews.Author: M.A.O.H- "Explorer"
Reviews.Content: VERY GOOD price/quality. A VERY GOOD tablet, it has everything you nee: microSD port (till 64GB), USB port (with a cheap optional adapter), microHDMI, good GPS, fast...

Reviews.Title: Amazing after upgrading to ice cream sandwich 4.2
Reviews.Author: Christi Smith
Reviews.Content: It was a little slow at first but still okay. After the first update it was painfully slow however the next day it seemed they had a new update and it is now much faster. Great product and works for everything I need.

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery
Reviews.Author: Owen Desgouttes
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with this product, it is just what I needed. I can do just about all things I usually do on my computer but most important of all I can travel anywhere and have access to most of the apps that I used.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price.
Reviews.Author: Dennis Wahl
Reviews.Content: This is a much better value than the overpriced Samsung tablets.  You have a notebook or a tablet at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: C. Gensheimer
Reviews.Content: Going budget on this tablet and giving it to my little brother, I didn't expect this tablet to last more than a year. It's been 3+ and it's still going strong and performing well.

Reviews.Title: not good
Reviews.Author: eric
Reviews.Content: This asus transformer is glitchy dose not respond well when trying to click on a link or viewing video it has lots of problem rite from the first time uesing it its worth the price  tho

Reviews.Title: Nice 10" Tablet
Reviews.Author: Homer L. Arment
Reviews.Content: I usually read for an hour or so each night when I go to bed and this tablet with its mobile dock only needs charged every four days or so.  The screen is plenty bright and clear for reading and if I take the mobile dock off and turn this on its side I can get a full magazine page at a time on the screen with the type large enough for me to easily read it.  My only complaint with it is that its wireless doesn't seem to make as good of a connection as it should.  I have a pretty strong wireless signal in my bedroom but this tablet seems to often drop the signal.

Reviews.Title: It worked and my mother in law loves it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It worked and my mother in law loves it! It's not an Ipad but its more affordable for the beginner.

Reviews.Title: much happier after customer service assistance
Reviews.Author: J. Hall "Juniper"
Reviews.Content: Is it too much to ask to be able to load pages at a speed greater than dialup?  No, I take it back, my T300 loads even more slowly than dialup.  I use mine strictly on home wifi, with the highest speed router on the market.  Maybe it would load faster on 4G but I doubt it.  Apps, graphics, so what?  They're fine.  I'm not a technophile so I can't give you those kinds of details, but the display is lovely, the optional keyboard is exactly like my eee PC, sound is fine.  It just isn't working for my intended use - to read articles, browse and shop.  I hate its speed.  Did I save $200 by not buying the Apple I didn't want? or did I waste whatever I paid for this because I can't stand its intolerably slow page load speed?  I'm writing this review on my 5+ year old laptop.  I had such high hopes.UPDATE: ASUS customer service suggested my Android OS was corrupted (or I had problems with my WLAN - could rule that out as other devices work perfectly well). I wiped the tablet and reset it to factory settings. Reloading and reconfiguring a bit of a pain but download speeds now as I would wish them to be.  I hope no more problems and I can read my news from my comfy chair on my T300.

Reviews.Title: Feels cheap
Reviews.Author: jamesnewyork
Reviews.Content: Not long after I got it, it started to give me problems. Spent an extra hundred trying to keep it usable.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished with problems
Reviews.Author: Amazon Buyer
Reviews.Content: electronic bug in the system keeps messing with my tablet. Bought it refurbished. had the same NEW model one and loved it tho.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Ian-Michael Anthony
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet.  My friend recommended it and I went along with the recommendation.  Apart from needing more sound from the speakers, its a very good product.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Y. Cruz
Reviews.Content: Great product and quality. I love Asus tablets. Amazing performance and well built. I recommend this product to anyone. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Considering the cost, great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Lauren L.  Henderson "Lauren"
Reviews.Content: When you compare this tablet to an iPad it's a great buy.  Half the price, 32GB with solid OS, and ample Android ( which really isn't bad) software availability. The screen resolution isn't as good, but unless you're super picky there's not enough difference for it to matter.  I've watched movies while traveling on both this tablet and the iPad and notice very little difference.  AND the screen is slightly larger than on an iPad.  On the down side the battery life isn't as good as the iPad's and requires more frequent charging.  I'll take that for half the cost!

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I was looking to get a new tablet and chose the TF300. I was split on OS's between Windows and Android, but went with Android since I was familiar with the architecture. The processor isn't the most powerful on the market (1.2 ghz), but the overall device is worth it. I love the screen size and storage capacity for the price. I would recommend this device.Primary uses:Web BrowsingMedia Streaming (Youtube & Netflix)and personal media (Movies & Comic books)

Reviews.Title: Performs well normally
Reviews.Author: Jerad Wallace
Reviews.Content: But mine wasn't the normal situation. I received the tablet and a few days later had problems with it. It fixed itself for about a week and then the digitizer went out. By then it was too late to return the device. So I replaced the digitizer and was good for about two more weeks. Then, the backlight inverter board blew a resistor (slam head on desk at this point). So I am still waiting to replace that since you can't get the board by itself. You have to purchase a new LCD panel altogether which is about 60-80 USD. So I do like the tablet and it works great, when it works. Just bad luck on my part I guess.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Notypst "future beach bum"
Reviews.Content: Love this tablet. Once I figured out that it is not really a keyboardless netbook, I have really become quite fond of it. It is my only computer and suffices quite well for social media, a few games, banking and letter writting. I can Hangout  with the grand kids without problem and shop Amazon like a wiz. I did purchase the external keyboard and really enjoued the extended battery life. But as a stand alone item its just great, for me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet.
Reviews.Author: JC Canterbury
Reviews.Content: I find myself using this tablet for more things each day.  I knew I would love it, I just didn't know how much.

Reviews.Title: One of the best tablets
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet has all the features I needed in a portable "computer" both with and without the keyboard. The screen is beautiful and easy to view, with websites, videos, and text! The keyboard really improves it's use for real office work. The battery in the tablet lasts about 10 hours of heavy use and 3 days with sporadic use. When you plug it into the keyboard it will charge up the tablet completely or if it is used from the beginning (after you finish charging both the tablet and base) I got almost a week out of it with off and on use each day.

Reviews.Title: Unstable
Reviews.Author: Ambrose Massaquoi
Reviews.Content: My one year with the TF300T has been a very disappointing one. I bought the tablet based on several reviews that claimed it was about the best android tablet on the market then--given its speed, innovation, affordability, and upgradeable android OS. However, the TF300T has mostly been erratic and clunky for me. Compared to the iPad I recently bought for my wife, it is really nothing much to write home about. I think Asus focused more on innovation than giving this machine a soul that really gets it going.

Reviews.Title: Good but...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jeff Pruett"
Reviews.Content: As non-Nexus tablets go, Asus tends to have great specs. Unfortunately, Asus also likes to clog them up with a custom skin that slows everything down to a crawl. The TF300 has a great developer community. I ROMed this tablet with a Kitkat (android 4.4) ROM and it runs very very well now. If you are not going to ROM it you might be disappointed with the speed of the device using the stock ROM it comes with. Especially if you are going to use their feature to have multiple accounts.The display is good but does not do gradients well. Good visibility and good view angles. But in gradients you will see some banding. The resolution is good but not great (not in the post Retina-display era of Android anyway). Color reproduction is excellent though.Battery life has generally been very good for me though it will not hold up great under gaming. It does seem to charge fast though and hold a charge very well while the display is off. The included SD slot makes it very expandable and is something that Nexus devices will never have. With the optional keyboard dock, expansion and battery life are increased dramatically even further. The keyboard is very well implemented (snaps on and off securely). Though it makes the tablet a lot heavier and bulkier.So if you are looking for a mid-range tablet and do not want to wait for the new Nexus 10, this is a good alternative. Not the best, but fast enough to be relevant in 2014 and with a decent display and great expandability.

Reviews.Title: regarding asus tf300 tablet
Reviews.Author: Steve Avery
Reviews.Content: Am just getting into the modern world and this is something I have to learn.. perhaps the things I dislike are fixable when I find out how to do it.  The instructions were pathetic !  I had to go on line and find out how to operate it for the most part.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have wanted a tablet that isn't too big and bulky, but not too small of being much use. I use it mostly with the keyboard and portfolio stand case to give me keyboard capability, to extend the battery life. It also gives me usb ports. Be aware that when you are charging the keyboard, the tablet won't always charge to 100%. You may want to charge them separately.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been very impressed with this tablet. Has good WIFI range, fast, and no issues since received. Not the highest resolution out there, however I have been more than satisfied watching tv shows & movies on it. The keyboard is definitely a wonderful match for it, just like a small laptop!

Reviews.Title: 4* with custom ROM
Reviews.Author: Daniel Parchisanu
Reviews.Content: Quite slow with stock ROM. After a lot of headache trying to get Cyanogenmod, I gave up and put instead Cromi-X. This follows the stock ROM and eliminates all ASUS junk. Performance is quite decent. A few more tweaks (using Xposed to force the launcher and the browser to stay resident) makes for a satisfying experience. I am ordering the micro SD card to boost additionally the speed and, of course, get more memory.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Tablet would recommend to all
Reviews.Author: janet ann
Reviews.Content: This is my second ASUS tf300, the first one is in the shop being repaired, it stopped working after only six months. This one is even better because it has Jelly Bean which is better than the Ice Cream Sundae which isn't as easy to use

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: poet2dagger27689
Reviews.Content: Good price, great seller, good shipping, the cover that it came with smelled of smoke, but it was used after all, and in good condition over all. AWESOME conditionThe tablet itself doesn't get the battery life stated unless you have it on the power saving mode, which seriously cuts down on processing power. I enjoy this tablet a lot.

Reviews.Title: Came Brand New
Reviews.Author: Boris Morocho
Reviews.Content: In the plastic and everything, no fingerprints, everything reset. Working and looking perfect. The price was awesome, and the quality even better.

Reviews.Title: After a year and a half - this is still my "go to" device
Reviews.Author: oucat5
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted to read books and watch movies, tv shows, etc. on a screen that was larger than a Kindle as my eyes are bad. I couldn't be happier! I have my books set to sepia pages and large type and I am one happy reader. I average a book every one to two days. I can also watch hulu or netflix and don't feel like I miss a thing. The device lasts about 8 hours before it needs a charge which is about the same as when I got it. The only thing I don't like is having to wipe off the fingerprints. I would highly recommend this device to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: very nice product
Reviews.Author: In Virginia
Reviews.Content: the asus tablet has been very nice to use the last couple months. i needed a tablet that i could use micro SD cards and one that had a mini hdmi port. to this date the only concern i have is the way the charging plug sticks directly out of the bottom of the unit. it makes it hard to sit with the unit in your lap on the couch and have the charger plugged in. it does have far superior battery life than my previous acer tablet had.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Brad Gibbs
Reviews.Content: Oh yeah, loved it till tablet is no longer usable.  Seems there's a factory glitch that it shuts itself off and on every couple minutes.  Searched internet and found out this is a major problem with other users.  According to them ASUS is not doing anything to fix the problem.  Poor customer service.  Spent over $400 on this and now it's useless.  If I had only spent $100 and this started happening after a year of use I could understand but this is ridiculous that on that expensive of a tablet that  is not usable after a year.

Reviews.Title: Love the tablet
Reviews.Author: Charles Reeves
Reviews.Content: Very very happy with tablet and with seller. I got shipment earlier then expected. tablet works great.For the price I did not expect this type of tablet. Thanks

Reviews.Title: What can I say... GREAT
Reviews.Author: Fred J. Morgan "Jeff Morgan"
Reviews.Content: Have worked Android for years. Have two other tablets... multible phones....  THIS IS BEST.... Opt for T300 for faster speed (Could not justify 700)  The quad core handles the slowest Apps with speed. Matched with keyboard dock.. it blows away all other.. GOOGLE PLAY makes it update-able with you already purchased apps. Comes with quality apps installed... Lacking only a Good Navigation program for the excellent GPS built in... Standard Navigation was not pre installed though Google maps does a second rate job, I installed a freebee Navigator from Google Play with offline maps.... Tethers nicely with phone.. Sim slot available.  Team with keyboard for up to 15hours on battery.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ms. Diva
Reviews.Content: great tablet, the asus is the best ever and light weight. I would highly recommend. My mom loves her new ASUS.

Reviews.Title: a great gift and ready to go
Reviews.Author: Linda Walls Beauregard
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed giving this as a gift to my son.  He is really enjoying it and there is  very little learning curve.  My son-in-law has one too and has done some amazing things with it, especially at work.  We are sold on tablets for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: It is easy to learn, but there are problems.
Reviews.Author: Ruth Fuller
Reviews.Content: I have to learn how to download some of the things that make it work.It charges fast and I love the portability of it.

Reviews.Title: A Fantastic Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I couldn't afford the fruit of the Cupertino tree and thought I would have to settle for second best. WRONG! I paid way less and got far more capability. I have used it every day since receiving it and most days for hours at a time. I unlocked, rooted it and installed a custom rom but quickly returned to the provided Android Jellybean. I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: My favorite purchase!
Reviews.Author: John R Loser Jr
Reviews.Content: I love this thing, it does everything I need it to and more. I can watch movies, read comics/books, comfortably surf the web, play games and more. My absolute favorite electronics purchase of the last year.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Marberfa
Reviews.Content: If I could give it 4 1/2 stars, I would. My unit is a refurb and it works beautifully. I've had it for about a month and haven't had any of the problems with screen cracking or other major stuff that seemed so prominent in the negative reviews. Most operational problems are mainly caused by the still-clunky Android OS. File handling and generation of sub-files, especially with email, remain the Achilles Heel of Android. The only physical glitches inherent to the hardware that I experience are the twitchiness of the physical keyboard, and Its ridiculously small shift-key.That's it for the negatives. This unit is a superb and handy tool for everyday use. Just figure a way I can install Windows 7 or XP (Windows 8 is so wrong in so many ways), give me a larger shift key, and this becomes a 10-star product.

Reviews.Title: Love the tablet
Reviews.Author: Margie Ryan
Reviews.Content: The tablet arrived in the time promised. I have used it as an additional access to the internet. Going on a big trip this fall and wanted something smaller than a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Good one!!
Reviews.Author: fftwo
Reviews.Content: I buy this one first for myself when I planned a trip.  Later, my mom start using it and she loves it.  So I gave this to her as a gift.

Reviews.Title: recommended
Reviews.Author: Jose Guzman
Reviews.Content: met my expectations .. I like .. what was expected of the product by delays in customs of my country had not commented .. is recommended to one hundred percen

Reviews.Title: recommend
Reviews.Author: gram's reading "ebb"
Reviews.Content: I have truly enjoyed this tablet. the only problem is that my computer skills are limited and I could not find answers to some questions I had. Great for working trips.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for my husband.
Reviews.Author: P. Robles "Love to read"
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted a tablet and didn't want to spend a lot of money. This ASUS tablet is great. Good graphics. Great pictures. Easy to use. I like it as much as my iPad and it was at a fraction of the price. I wish I had seen this earlier. He loves it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet!
Reviews.Author: R. A. Croner "Texas Realtor"
Reviews.Content: This unit was refurbished. Touch screen didn't work, sent it in, and they claimed nothing was wrong with it but when I got it back the touch screen works perfectly. Fingerprints on the screen are distracting but doesn't impact the operation. I wanted a small laptop for e-mail and movies while traveling and this unit fills the bill. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Super!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jhenielle Sinclair
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet/netbook. First to things first, the sensitivity is phenomenol!! The cord from my headphone barely touched the screen and it was sensitive enough to respond. The sound great, the apps great! Tho i was a lil disappointed when i couldnt download  abc family app, or whattsapp, but that's minor in comparrison to this great device I have. I was very reluctant to buy a tab online, but my fears were laid to rest when it came on time and in great condition! two thumbs up amazon!

Reviews.Title: Handy and Fast Tablet
Reviews.Author: eddieg
Reviews.Content: I reaaly find this tablet to be very handy when I'm out or just want to check something real fast on the deck rather thango up to my desk top

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: chaitanya mudumba
Reviews.Content: good product, but this model does not have sim card slot... builtin appliction for microsoft word editing is not impressive. can not use this for office purposes. watsapp is not compatable with this tab :(... Overall its a good tab whithdecent performance and bright ui

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: We have several "no-name" or almost no-name android tablets.  One thing they had in common is if they were running 4.1.1 they couldn't connect to a corporate network.  This one can.It is compatible with everything I tried except lync 2010, which probably needs a phone connection to work.The Wi-Fi speeds are blistering fast testing with speedtest.net, and the graphics are amazing.  The app that finds Techra optimized apps is on the device.  Check it out.Paired with the keyboard and fully charged, I easily get 12 hours of operation, and I use mid-scale brightness with Wi-Fi always on.  I also often connect a Bluetooth headset B002BH3I9UI bought a second charger B009HK30V0 which can fully charge the device in a few hours, and will actually charge it while you are using it.5 stars.Update 8/20/13Two nights ago it pushed the 4.2.1 update to my tablet.  I didn't like the new launcher but it gave the option of using the previous one.  Everything seemed to be working but when I got to work I found that while I can still use the corporate network and corporate web applications, I can no longer receive corporate email while on the corporate wifi network.  I can receive them at home or by using my phone hotspot.  4 stars until this is resolved.UpdateCorporate IT support says this happens a lot after an update.  I just had to forget the connection and then re-enter my credentials.  That worked.  Back to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Really love the tablet, in repair right now because touchscreen is dead
Reviews.Author: Koz
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for more than a year (outside of warranty). Right as the warranty period expired, the touchscreen began to fail. I don't have any drops or cracks in it, but it just started becoming inconsistent in recognizing touches and now it pretty much recognizes nothing. Fortunately, I have the docking keyboard and the mouse worked so I retained some function.But a tablet isn't worth much without touchscreen capability -- docking keyboard or no. It's at a local shop for repair and will probably cost me about $150-$175. I'm not thrilled about it, but if it works again that's better than losing it's functionality completely and still cheaper than replacing it with another 10" tablet.I googled and found a lot of people complaining about the touchscreen/digitizer issues. Just know that this is a problem going in.Otherwise, as far as functionality, screen quality (visually), and ease of use I really like the tablet. The add on keyboard is worthwhile because it gives you extra battery capacity and makes the tablet more functional as a laptop alternative for short business trips. You can maintain email access but be able to type much better than you would just off the screen. The keyboard dock also will hold the screen up hands free if you're going to use the tablet as a TV or video player.This tablet always gets Android updates very quickly after they become available, too.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I love my tablet. It has taken my some time to adjust to using my tablet without MS windows, but it does what I want and works great. I love it over our laptop and have used it more. Touch screen is great and so far it has been all that I need to keep up with things.

Reviews.Title: Really Great
Reviews.Author: Julia Wilson
Reviews.Content: I love this item. I am using it right now. It is so helpful for my day to day use.

Reviews.Title: A Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: It's great for traveling or home use.  The screen is a perfect size.  It connects very easy to Wi-Fi. It's light weight.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: FAN_______TASTIC
Reviews.Author: Art Powell
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised and more. It allows me the freedom I need while not imploding with my other devices or events.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: Ronald Greenwood
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet because it had the option of connecting to a docking keyboard.  I also bought the keyboard and love the extra memory, USB port, and battery life it offers.  I ordered a refurbished tablet for me and also my wife.  So far we have had no issues.

Reviews.Title: Its Nice but with some drawbacks.
Reviews.Author: SomeRandomGuy
Reviews.Content: Pro:Asus stays on top of things with updates so no worries about that.Nice and thin, great battery life. especially with keyboard attachmentCon:Colors are a bit washed out on mine kinda like someone turned gamma way to high. I guess they will send you a new one if you ask but I just installed a custom rom and adjusted the colors my self its not perfect but I only use it around the house anyway.Notes:I bought it for screwing around on the couch in the living room and reading manga/books. But it works great with netflix, crunchyroll, xfinity, brighthousetv etc. so its nice for watching stuff while working out. I have a galaxy s 4 now so this thing basically sits home for reading now cause the s4 is much quicker and has a way better screen for movies and stuff. When I bought it, there was nothing better but these days theres tons of better cheaper options.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: James McDonald
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet. My first was a Lenovo, which gave me a few problems, but I liked it and was skeptical about trying the ASUS.So far, I have been pleased with it. It is a little slow on refresh, but the resolution is good. Sound is adequate.I do like having the detachable keyboard. If anything, just for the fact that I don't have to ever worry if I forget to charge the tablet itself since the keyboard battery will charge the tablet, so I am not tied to an outlet with the very short power cord they supply.If I change my opinion, I will update.

Reviews.Title: WON'T CHARGE
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this unit for a month plus 4 days and it will no longer charge.  It is dead!  And I cannot return or exchange it?  That is a problem Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use this tablet for my home use but with the keyboard I will be using it for more things and I will be using my laptop less.

Reviews.Title: I love this tablet
Reviews.Author: P. Henderson "Part time gaming sniper"
Reviews.Content: I am using this tablet so much more than I thought I would, I replaced a Chrome laptop with this. I can't recommend this enough

Reviews.Title: This is a terrific piece of equipment.  We are very happy with it.
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: See above.  We are extremely glad we bought this.  It meets our needs perfectly.  We are happy with the price and delivery.  There have been no problems.

Reviews.Title: A solid workhorse
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm finally writing a review having heavily used my TF300 for about a year.First thing I'll say is that ASUS has kept this product current with regular updates to Android.  Bravo to ASUS for that!As far as build quality goes, my TF300 has held up perfectly.  As others have noted, there is some slight light leakage at a few points around the bezel.  I can honestly say that it really isn't visible while watching videos, reading ebooks, or even browsing my portfolio.Speaking of viewing my portfolio, I'm quite pleased with the way my photos look on the TF300 screen.  One may perhaps quibble when compared to a calibrated monitor, but when viewed under a variety of conditions I'm fully satisfied.I managed to drop my first TF300 a couple of months after I bought it; I had no qualms buying another to replace it.  I think it's still the best value tablet out there.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue)
Reviews.Author: Hughrster
Reviews.Content: As a computer user of nearly 50 years, I am not a gamer, nor do I have a smart-phone. I purchased the Asus tablet as a reasonable-priced iPad. After using it now for several weeks, it meets my expectations and needs. Asus' descriptions and various reviews are accurate and fair in my opinion.The issues of excessive reflectivity of its screen in strong light, contrast in same, I do not care for, but knew of before-hand. The screen-keyboard is  little awkward, but quite suitable for its portability as a travelling workstation. The TF300 is much lighter than my laptop, and has similar battery life. The recharge adaptor is quick and effective, and plugging into a computer maintains the battery, as well as allowing synchronisation, data sharing.It is an effective tool.

Reviews.Title: Love the ASUS
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I am very Happy with the ASUS, it has lived up to my expectations and surpassed them.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet.
Reviews.Author: David Zephaniah
Reviews.Content: It is a good qualify tablet. It is thin and lite. After testing it in many situations, including surfing, writing, and playing games, I am satisfied. The battery lasts about 7 hours. I am planning to get the optional keyboard dock, because the unit can function as a small laptop. The only tiny drawback is that it doesn't have a mini USB port, and the screen is not as sharp as the Dell XPS tablet that I own.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Hannahs
Reviews.Content: My old tablet died (acer iconia tab a100). The touch screen quit responding. So that prompted this purchase. From what little research I did, this seemed to be the best choice (cost a little more than I wanted to spend, but not much. Amazon technically didn't have the lowest price according to Invisible Hand, but the other company I had never heard of before). I trust Amazon's reviewers and information and return policies. And usually Amazon has the best price. If they don't, beware! The other company my be misrepresenting their product or leaving out something vital. Anyways, this tablet works far better than my old one, and I think it's lighter, too, even though it is a 10" vs. 7". And thinner. And longer lasting battery (almost double). And has a better camera (although no flash, for whatever reason). Still takes good pictures. Quad-core rocks. Although I haven't tried anything super intense yet. Mostly web-browsing and some casual gaming. I'm getting too old! It works well with a cheap stylus, which is something my old tablet couldn't do (no matter the expense of said stylus, actually). I just need to order a cover for it to protect from potential accidents. Happy so far!

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Hayespip3807
Reviews.Content: A 32gb tablet and 10 inch screen for the price is hard to beat. Also you can now upgrade Android to Jelly Bean. The hardware seems to be getting out of date though as I get a couple stutters through animations, app switching, etc.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.  Light and powerful.
Reviews.Author: Metsdada
Reviews.Content: Let's see... my 4 pound laptop, or this...ha.Very well built.  I saw some comments about this is plastic  vs. aluminum.  Hey, I have a $10 case for it, and now it feels like leather.  I have not had any heat issues, if that is what makes the aluminum preferred.I do email, surfing, and some board games..........and some small office spreadsheet work.  This is all I need.  It's light, and very easy to tote around.Excellent product.  Shipped quickly and was well packaged.  Thanks.5/11/2014 update:  I find the speed of this product to be too slow.  Pages load slowly.  Battery life is poor - I have to recharge it all the time.  I would not buy this again.Alternative.... get an old laptop and put Linux on it.  I have an old Lenovo... and it speeds through everything.  No touch screen, but with the speed diff, I will use it from now on.

Reviews.Title: perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Debbie Tota
Reviews.Content: This tablet is awesome, huge screen, great price and ice cream sandwich makes everything run quick and smooth. The item also shipped and arrived ahead of scheduled very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: In love with it!
Reviews.Author: Haitham
Reviews.Content: Asus is a very respectful company and its MB products are one of the top in the computer market. Its tablets; like this one; is very useful and I do really like it. Unlike Samsun's tablets, Asus' tablet has more useful and handy I/O like the USB mini port. If you add the keyboard; ASUS Transformer Pad Mobile Dock TF300T; then you'd get extra regular USB port.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Alan Wright
Reviews.Content: Super cool, my only complaint is android not supporting flash, which of course has nothing to do with ASUS.  Nice tablet, though

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: gllags
Reviews.Content: Item arrived quickly and in good condition. I use this mainly for surfing the net and streaming movies/TV from Netflix. Works well. I've had no problems or complaints. As with all electronics, I wish the battery life was better, but I also tend to have my settings at less than optimal for sparing the battery, so it's partially my fault. This is a good tablet that functions well for my intended purposes. Pleased with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Works fairly well
Reviews.Author: Robert Steigerwald
Reviews.Content: I have found that the touchscreen is not very responsive at times. I prefer to just go back to my desktop if I really want to do some serious web browsing. It's my first tablet, so maybe I was expecting more than they can deliver.

Reviews.Title: tablet
Reviews.Author: Lucille J. Harding
Reviews.Content: grandson loves it now have to buy the keyboard and a case so he can carry around with him safely.

Reviews.Title: awesome, awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: M. Wong
Reviews.Content: i had wanted a tablet that is an upgrade from my 1st tablet, a nice size keyboard, and a long lasting battery life. i got what i wanted in this tablet! i haven't timed how long it lasts on the battery but it being hooked to the keyboard sure helps it last even longer. the keyboard is the perfect size for my hands to not be so close together i can't type like other netbook keyboards (this was a worry for me). the only real down side to me is that the charger cord is ridiculously short!!! so i'm extra grateful the battery lasts so long, i'd hate to have it charging constantly on a short-as-hell cord.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT SO FAR
Reviews.Author: Douglas K. Fish "D. the  Anime-niac"
Reviews.Content: Hey I really am impressed so far. I think its a greatoverall Tablet.  It has a great screen for the price.I have no complaints so far, and its very flexible.I would recomend it over the  kindle Fire HD ona price basis and the fact that its OS is set up soits more open and flexible than the OS on the kindle.Sorry Amazon but I didn't like the restraints on thekindle  just to have a fancier screen.

Reviews.Title: Would recommend it to everyone!
Reviews.Author: elizabeth zeccola
Reviews.Content: Love the crisp display and the vibrant colors. Very easy to use, lightweight, and perfectly customizable. The only con: can't really use it in very bright sunlight. That goes for many other tablets as well though so not a big isssue. Great battery life also

Reviews.Title: asus TF300T
Reviews.Author: Rafael Arevalo
Reviews.Content: muy buen equipo de calidad y precio accesible, lo que esperaba, para ser una marca no muy conocida es una excelente opcion

Reviews.Title: QUE BUENA TABLET
Reviews.Author: MARIANO
Reviews.Content: QUEDE COMO UN PRINCIPE ANTE MI ESPOSA FUE EL REGALO DE CUMPLEAÑOS Y QUEDO ENCANTADA CON ESTA TABLET BUENA TECNOLOGIA A UN COSTO RAZONABLE

Reviews.Title: Just what  expected
Reviews.Author: Horst Boese
Reviews.Content: Togetehr with a key dock this transformer is just the device I always wanted to have. Easy ordering and fast delivery on time made it a good buy.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: have had it only a couple weeks, but love it so far. great clarity and easy to operate.  great tablet

Reviews.Title: A surprisingly good tablet
Reviews.Author: Charlie Cycle
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the ASUS TF300.  I already own an IPAD2 and wanted to get a low cost tablet for the family.  I was afraid that the ASUS would fall way short when compared to the IPAD2.  It costs a lot less so I thought it would do a lot less.The Transformer's screen is bright and vibrant when using apps or watching netflix.  However when it displays websites, the resolution suffers a bit.  The same websites come out clearer on the IPAD.  I was told that it's not due to the tablet but how most websites are optimized for IOS vs Android.  Hopefully this will change since there are so many great Android products out now.  I was also surprised at the responsiveness of the touchscreen and how smoothly I can navigate through the tablet's contents.  The shape of the ASUS tablet also makes it better for watching movies.  The plastic backing doesn't feel as sturdy as aluminum, but its never given me problems.I've read reviews about the ASUS pad crashing all the time but it's happened to me only a couple times so far (some apps and safari on my IPAD also crash every so often so it's not specific to Android).I'm more of a casual user and find the IPAD2 easier to use since IOS spoon feeds you, but after using both products I don't see much difference between the two performance-wise.  IOS and android both have the apps I use or feel are practical.  I also could have bought two ASUS TF300's for the price of one IPAD2.  The expandable memory on the ASUS is also very convenient.  All in all, this is a solid device that I am very happy with.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: Works well.  Fast. Great purchase for the money.  Considered Windows 8 tablet but this was half the price and runs a mature OS (Android).

Reviews.Title: Rich look
Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: this product looks rich and is well built. I love the look and feel the texture of the leather is smart. if you need to whip this baby out in a meeting it will do the job of impressing everyone.

Reviews.Title: A great Tabel computer for the busy college student
Reviews.Author: D. Mcguinness "Home Theater Guy"
Reviews.Content: This is a "high performance" table the worked right out of the box.  It is the perfect size for the campus student at college and fits well in most back packs.  Very fast and connects well to many different networks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: Jim Holmes
Reviews.Content: Transformer is what I expected.  Does all that I require. Unable to compare with similar products as this is my first purchase of such product.

Reviews.Title: Bad video recording sound
Reviews.Author: CarlosVelez
Reviews.Content: I Buy ASUS TF300 in nov/2012, it is very good product... almost, I got a problem: When I video recording, it is recording the video with a whistle sound included... I was trying in several environments to discard any sound source, but always it recorded the sound with the whistle. I discovered it problem disappeared when I video recorded while I was charging the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Merrill Manymules
Reviews.Content: I like the product but the recharging time is very long and the sync cable that it was sent with only works every now and then. So i had to buy another cable.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENTE
Reviews.Author: makdecra
Reviews.Content: NICE TABLET, vERY NICE, FITS WELL, COLOR MATCH,  WORKS FAST, NICE TABLET, vERY NICE, FITS WELL, COLOR MATCH,  WORKS FAST

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Susan L. Wallace
Reviews.Content: I could'nt afford an I pad, so went looking for a comparable alternate.  I spent many months looking and researching and came across this one.  I wanted the red one, but it was quite a bit more, so I went with blue.  Then I put it in a red case and you can't even tell that it's blue!Anyway, this little bugger is fabulous.  I have had it for about 2 months and just love it!  I did have 1 issue when it wouldn't turn on one day, but the guys at tech support fixed me right up!  They are personable and understandable.It's been perfect since.  The reason I chose this one was because of the quad core and the storage.  I don't do alot of "app" downloads, but when I do, I want enough space to hold it.  I figured that if I'm going to keep this thing for a long time, I getter get a lot of space.  So I did.  I also wanted fast.  It's been pretty fast, but I think I still go faster than it does.  It also depends on the site I'm on.  If it is a fast site, I have no problems.  If it's a slower site, I will get an error message saying that the browser is having an issue.  It's not the machine, it's that the browser wants to go faster than the site will accompdate.  I know this only because the same sites give me issues on the desktop machine.I did notice that there seems to be a challenge with Chrome.  That was one of the first things I installed and it doesn't seeem to want to play nice with the pre-installed browser.  I installed firefox as an alternate browser and it works fine.  (Uninstalled Chrome very quickly)I have chatted with my sister in Europe several times via skype and it works great.  Skpe itself has issues, but the machine was perfect.  Love the portabliltiy.  I actually spent New Years with her from my own home!  It was still daylight here, but for her it was the new year.  That was fun.I do suggest that you get a screen saver only because I'm anal about protecting my new toy.  I have a case and a screen saver, you don't touch the actual machine except for the start button!  :-)All in all, I love this little thing.  As far as I can tell, it doesn the same stuff that the I pad does and costs about 1/2 the price.  Hightly recommend!

Reviews.Title: One of the bext tablets out there
Reviews.Author: Bhola Bhala
Reviews.Content: Forget apple, bananas and oranges. This baby beats them to ground. Superb display, no crashes at all, no errors, camera and video results are so sharp, that you will be stunned, sound is amazing and so are the graphics. I am in love with this tablet. Battery is so stubborn and it doesn't die with 8 hours of aggressive use. Lightweight and SOLID built. This pad is a top quality pad, and 1/3rd of the price of premium tablet. Buying another one for my mom

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it.
Reviews.Author: kjackson20
Reviews.Content: Gave this to her for her big christmas gift.  She is always on it with games or internet.  I am a tablet widower!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: dabrewer52
Reviews.Content: I love my tablet, once I got one that worked.  The first one delivered didn't work right but the company sent me a new one and I am really enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet, but not without (minor) flaws
Reviews.Author: Kate L
Reviews.Content: My overall opinion of the tablet is that its great, and absolutely worth the price. I'd recommend it to anyone looking into getting a tablet. I wanted a tablet to be a middle ground between my desktop and my Android--portable, but with a large enough screen, and enough processing power, that I can use it like a mobile computer. I use it for reading books, browsing the internet, Skyping, playing games, and when I worked as a private tutor, I used it as a teaching aid. I've had it for about 8 months and loved it the whole time. That said, while it hasn't had any real problems, there are definitely some little things that I would change.Appearance:- It's a good looking tablet. I love the blue, I love that it's textured, and I love the glossy screen. The edges are large enough to hold it comfortably without accidentally touching the screen. The display itself is beautiful as well--bright colors and clean edges. I watch videos on it all the time, mostly from YouTube and Netflix, and they always look great.Operation:- Mostly very smooth operation. I have no problem with starting programs, connecting to a wifi network, streaming video, playing music, etc. Occasionally, it will lag if I've been playing a game for a while, but only within the game itself; other programs are not affected. Using a task killer solves this most of the time, though a couple times a restart was required.- The browser is definitely the worst part, but I don't like the default Android browser on my phone either, so this is not a tablet-specific problem. I solved it by installing Chrome, which doesn't close without warning, or constantly bring up messages that the browser is not responding, or make scrolling jumpy. If you're having these problems, switch browsers.Sound:- The sound quality is decent. It has one speaker, and that speaker is good, but it's still only one speaker. Don't get me wrong, I have no complaints about this. It's pretty much on-par for a portable device of this sort, and much better than the speaker on my phone, so I'm satisfied.- The location of the speaker is slightly awkward. It's on the back right-hand side, exactly where I want to put my hand when I'm holding it. None of this is a real problem, though, because I've found that I can still hold it in the same place if I cup my hand around the speaker (which also, incidentally, makes the sound richer/louder/better in general).Keyboard:- The pop-up keyboard on the touchscreen is kind of a hassle. Part of the issue is the size. When the tablet is in landscape, the keyboard is pretty large, but still cramped. It's too big for me to hold it in both hands and type with my thumbs, but it's smaller than a netbook keyboard, so typing with both hands like it's a regular keyboard can be tricky as well. Typing is a lot easier when it's in portrait.- Its version of the Swype system also is pretty buggy. Word recognition isn't great, and it's auto-spacing feature needs work.- However, one of the fantastic things about this product is that it can plug in to a physical keyboard and be used like a touchscreen netbook. I attach the keyboard if I have a lot of typing to do, and detach it to play games or read e-books. I definitely recommend getting the keyboard, but its still a great tablet without it. I only got my keyboard a few days ago, so I've been using it most of the time without it, and still really enjoyed the product. The keyboard just adds some extra functions.Charger:- I'm not sure if I just got a bad wall adapter, or if they're all like this, but mine falls out of the wall with just a light bump. It sort of "hangs" loosely out of the socket, so it doesn't always maintain contact while charging. I've noticed that, if I'm using it while it's charging, the battery logo (the one that shows up in the middle of the screen when the tablet is first plugged in) will show up every 10-15 minutes. The cable itself is perfectly fine, so I just started using a different wall adapter.In summary: despite a couple small issues, I highly recommend this tablet. If I could go back and select a tablet again, I would stick with this one.

Reviews.Title: the best tablet
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: I really liked it, and had formerly a TF101, but there is no comparison with this, I really recommend it

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: upwardglances
Reviews.Content: I love it tremendously. It works fast, has good speakers, and the display is very crisp. The touch screen supports handwriting apps okay, but might be better without the screen protector I have on it.

Reviews.Title: Money's worth
Reviews.Author: Sreejith Satheesh
Reviews.Content: I held out on buying a tablet till the time I felt that I could get a decent replacement for my laptop and reasonably future proof. I had my eyes set on the tegra 3 core for some time but the initial lot of tegra tablets were too premium.. I bought the tf300 as soon as it got out and haven't regretted it since. Great battery life, a good screen, good performance and a tempting price make this an awesome buy.

Reviews.Title: ASUS makes the best Tablet for the best price.
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: If you have been waiting to buy a Tablet, don't make the mistake of buying an over priced piece of fruit. ASUS makes one of the top selling and top performing Tablets on the market.

Reviews.Title: LOVE!
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: Fabulous tablet, no problems with it so far. I am excited to see everything that can be done with it as I have more time to play!

Reviews.Title: Great product... I do not carry my laptop any more.
Reviews.Author: Angelo P. Laloggia "NYKILLJOY"
Reviews.Content: This one you will use...You will use nothing else... Great Product.I would recommend this to anyone who likes portability....With the keyboard you get up to ten hours on one charge...

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Edmundo Garcia
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet. is super fast. did not give any error. upgradeable to Ice Cream Sandwich. quadcore processing works great. the resolution of the screen is great. very intuitive. the only thing I see is against that is a bit heavy but I love this tablet rest. 100% recommended

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Rob K
Reviews.Content: Good- big screen, camera, easy to use, great build qualityBad- No flash for camera, battery is alright, but as a heavy user only about 5 hours

Reviews.Title: TF300
Reviews.Author: Darien Nevers
Reviews.Content: Very good tablet...doesn't feel or look cheap despite being plastic...compares well with the prime beating it in instances and glad i got it..

Reviews.Title: ASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue)
Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: I really like this tablet; it is solid and works very well.  Great battery life too.  I didn't get the dock with it and really haven't felt a need for it yet.  My only disappointment is that there isn't a version of Adobe Flash player for this OS yet!  I hope that will be remedied soon!

Reviews.Title: Awesome !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Plechaty "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  I don't know why someone would spend $600 - 800 on an apple when this thing is fantastic at $340.  But to each his own I guess.  The camera is great but no flash.  Web speeds are pretty good, the glitches are in the os not the device so as far as that goes it is good.  I can stream video, surf effortlessly view and alter Office docs  what more could you want?  My laptop now stays home never leaving it's spot on the table.  The portable computing is completely accomplished with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Alacrytous
Reviews.Content: Blows my first gen iPad out of the water. The Tegra 3 processor is stunning on performance. Just need the dock to complete it

Reviews.Title: Good .
Reviews.Author: Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I purchased it brandnew since the product first available on Amazone 8 months ago, it looks good ( not as good as Ipad) the touch screen sensitive is good and smooth , the quality so far so good... my kids use it to play games and watch youtube videos alot .  Ok , i dont have much experient or knowledge with other tablets but base on how my children used it for months , i rate it 4*.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Andrew Gross
Reviews.Content: I give it 5 stars. I love it. Does everything i want it to do. My son loves to play games on it as well

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jason R. Ehlert
Reviews.Content: I love it , easy to use and the touch screen has perfect sensitivity. I've been waiting a while for this and the price dropped enough on black Friday week for me to get it.

Reviews.Title: Worth buying
Reviews.Author: Kimlin Moore
Reviews.Content: it is great better than i expected i like that i can play the keyboard on it and that i can add more memory.Great product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Tseng-yen Yen "Rosa Yen"
Reviews.Content: I use it every day since I bought it from Amazone and it's very easy to carry on everywhere.  Yes, I recommend it to everyone who should get one of those.

Reviews.Title: Very good tablet
Reviews.Author: WillieT49
Reviews.Content: I have several desktop, laptop and netbook computers but this is my first tablet. My phone is an android so I understood the basics of how to operate. I like the size and use it instead of my laptop. It's not perfect but I would recommend to a friend. Thanks to my sister Lu for the gift certificate to Amazon that helped made this purchase possible!

Reviews.Title: Sweet!
Reviews.Author: Chick Hearn
Reviews.Content: Great price for on the go use.  I saw this tablet at Best Buy for $10 less but it only had 16GB, this has 2x as much memory.  What a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: A. Simmons "Amazon Shopper"
Reviews.Content: I use the tablet all the time and it performs well.  I really like the graphics and performance.  I love it.  Its April 2013 and I'm still using my tablet on almost a daily basis.  I have not had any hardware problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Francine Wolfkill
Reviews.Content: I already had a android phone so it only makes sense to get an android tablet. Love it! My new favorite thing cant wait to get my docking station!

Reviews.Title: Best Ever
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: This device really lives us to its name. It really transforms especially when you plug it into the keyboard duct. LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: exceeded my expectations!
Reviews.Author: Amy DeMoss
Reviews.Content: does everything and more than it promised.  the price is fabulous for this tablet, too.  i am a homeschool mom who enjoys techie tools that enhance my life.  this transformer definitely does that!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: carlpefran
Reviews.Content: What's not to love!?Excellent performance & specs, great price.Upgraded to Android Jelly Bean 4.1Compares favorably with other similar tablets.Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Fred Gengnagel
Reviews.Content: Love it!!! I has done everything that I have asked it to do with no problems. I would recomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Harold
Reviews.Content: DOES THE JOB AND THEN SOME. THE MEMORY IS GREAT AND THE GRAPHICS ARE AWESOME. PLAYS MOVIES ON THE PLANE RIDES. CHECKS ALL MY IMPORTANT UPDATES FOR ME. I CANT IMAGINE HOW I EVER TRAVELED WITHOUT IT!

Reviews.Title: tf 300!! ipad?? whats that??
Reviews.Author: DatBoiChris
Reviews.Content: Okay so i never write reviews but this piece of heaven is amazing. So right out the box you want be able to use for about 30 minutes because of an uupdate and upgrade to 4.1 JB. So first thing i did was got adobe back,(youutbe some great tutorials) its a little slow to start but once it gets going im trying to catch my breathe its so fast.Im a real guy so i want real spec not computerize specs so i put this badt boy to the test. Feel is awesome. Even the plastic back. Look is amazing its look like a netbook its a huge screen. Im loving it. But i have sweaty hands so i leavefog marks on the back and lots of fingerprint on the screen. Recommend screen protector but not an anti glare but an anti finger smugg.Android, im a little new been an apple man since grade school with the color backs. I had android before with a htc hero love customization but hated everything else lag,load, and ec. Typing on the on screen key board is pretty hard. Im using it now. So if any misspelled or grammar issue is because im not deleteing. I wantyou to get the true look. But im having troublw with my cursor jumping every where. Have to push on the screen kinda hard to get letters to registar and the space bar im punching the screen. Web surfin awesome fast i use stock browser i love dont need that other stuff. I really impress with andriod i feel so free from apple no more jailbreaking ;). Joke.  Apple may be more easy but android is more user friendly. Hope you like. Write me for any more question. Last note only bad thing so far. I mentioned early but On Screen Keyboard and Typing SUCKS it horrhorrible.*Update*I JUST wanted to let everyone know how it is going. I'm in love. Lol. Seriously i sleep with this thing. But i encountered some of the problem I have read in other reviews. I almost sent it back but thanks to some research i found a solution. First dont care what you say the stock browser sucks. It is so laggy and slow. My grandma is on a walker imagine her walking ten yards on a football field. Take a long time right that's how long it takes for the stock browser to load a page. Painful i know. Explore a little bit i had huge success with chrome speed but no flash can be loaded. And dolphin was swimming like a dolphin it is fast and i can adjust my flash so i can use it when i need to. I dont recommend root if you just want watch movie and get free apps use 4share or blackmart( i dont support) most people dont understand root. Its not like jailbreaking which is necessary on apple. if you want fast go performance mode its all the fast you need you dont need 1.6 you dont have the screen that need that much power. But you paid do what you need want. I found that the tablet runs better on normal mode when you doing basic browsing. Still haven got the dock but when i do i will make a full review on youtube so be looking out and not one of those boring ones with the mono tone guys or the guys with the funny accent. No offense.but ask question and thank you for looking at my review rate if help if not send a question. And ill help i have great followers on this review site so im sure they will help also. Thank you for reading hope it helps you make your chose on tablet this Christmas. Oh one more thing. Must have a screen protector its a must. No if and or buts. Trust if you dont your screen will look like a kid coloring. Terrible. Lol.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Ben Olkowski "bro238"
Reviews.Content: Dont know how I lived without it. Super fast and easy to use. I use it for work and play.

Reviews.Title: One of the best android tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have used this since May, there are couple of minor issues like lagging and stopping.But I am fully satisfied and happy with various applicability unlike Apple.I rooted this with JB to delete bloatwares when I changed font with font changer this was bricked sometimesbut recovery is not a issue for me.

Reviews.Title: The Best Android Tablet Out There
Reviews.Author: Luis Bermudez
Reviews.Content: Hey! This is REALLY the best Android tablet a have purchases so far, thanks to ASUS. I'm now looking forward to the Asus Infinity. Great Support on updates, no issues so far. Everything works as expected and is really fast. =)Thanks to Amazon Prime I got it in just 3 days.

Reviews.Title: So happy i chose this tablet
Reviews.Author: Tom Snow
Reviews.Content: Great Interaction.  Fast.  Easy to setup.  I can't say enough about this tablet, I made the right choice in using this tablet for my business.

Reviews.Title: Too good.
Reviews.Author: Soumok
Reviews.Content: I purchased an ASUS Transformer last week. Just love it....Too good. Cant expect more than in that price...All good. Cant find any negative in it yet.

Reviews.Title: glad I took the chance
Reviews.Author: technically challenged
Reviews.Content: I was looking to update, my computer is older.  I went with a tablet. I did a lot of research and found this one fit my needs.  It  is great. Best choice I could have made. It is easy, quick,fun, and has a good screen. The graphics are wonderful. I would recommend this tablet to anyone. I also got a keyboard for it. Just like a netbook.

Reviews.Title: Asus TF300 32Gb tablet
Reviews.Author: Romy
Reviews.Content: Had tablet for 2 months and got over the air JB upgrade without issue and working great.  Speed is not super fast like a PC but ....  Unit work well and have seen similar download waits on Ipad (have not speed check yet) and have had no issues with wifi.  Still reading manual and playing around with this and downloaded several apps\games without issues.  Waiting for keyboard price to drop but may bypass as working great at present.Checked TF300 sites looking at issues others seen before purchase my unit (None so far) and for their suggestions for apps and set-ups.Vendor was quick and USPS delivery worked out great.  Recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet  - but has problems
Reviews.Author: Bill C. Riemers
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my son's birthday 3 weeks ago.  The tablet works reasonably fast, and seems to give good bang for the buck.  However, my son still prefers to do things like watch youtube videos on the $300 laptop I bought him last year.  The problem he says is the videos regularly timeout on the pad, indicating the wifi network connection is slower.  When he does use it, he lays down on my bed, as the is the closest comfortable place to where the router is located.My wife's laptop died, so she ended-up using it for about a week.  During that time she complained it did not register her screen touches in the right location.  I installed a drawing program, so I could confirm my touches were recorded right where I touch, so I finally concluded it is something unique with the web browser.  However, the same problem happens with the default browser and Google Chrome.  So it seems more complicated than that.  Upgrading android helped, as now android pop-us a zoomed window when clicking on buttons and links in the web browsers.However, after the upgrade we have a new problem.  Sometimes when the device has been asleep, or freshly booted wifi refuses to turn on.  It gets stuck in a permanent "starting wifi" state.  Toggling airplane mode does not help.  The only workaround I found is to turn airplane mode on and then reboot.  After booting, turn airplane mode off.The last problem is more with quality control on the google play store, than the tablet myself.  My son likes to play games, that is his main use of the tablet.  So far mostly he has just used free games.  However, he did try to buy a couple of games on the android market.  Each time while downloading, I read the reviews of the game and found that they consistently crashed on this tablet.  You have just ten minutes after the download is complete before you can no longer use the refund button.
