But 10 minutes has been exactly the amount of time it takes to get past the initial install, updates, and tutorials to try the games and see the reviewers are right.  If you do make it to the refund button in-time, you cannot leave review for the game, so when reading the reviews you are only seeing failed to run/crash reports from those who failed to make the 10 minute time window.However, this problem in a minor way is a blessing.  You see I had set up the tablet to use my gmail account, so it could be paid through my credit card.  But it seems when doing that, there is no way to keep my son from being able to access my e-mail.  Had I not had to request refunds for 100% of the game, I would be stuck.  But as it is, I still have the opportunity to create a new gmail account to use exclusively with google play.

Reviews.Title: Great product for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: I'm not a tech savy person but I am very happy with this purchase.  It allows me more flexibilty than a lap top, is easy to carry with me, lets me surf the web, check email, read ebooks, and play games.  Not a replacement for a desk top computer by any means but it gives me a portable option that works.

Reviews.Title: Beats the hi proced Apple tablets
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Lazarski "GrandpaRick"
Reviews.Content: At less than $400 and 32kb I can do everyting I want on this tablet. The only drawback is that some apps are not android compatable like Fidelity Investments. However, I feel this tablet meets my needs. Clear

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: david51w
Reviews.Content: This is a good tablet for the price I paid for it. The size is perfect and it is easy to use and fast. The apps loads fast. The only thing that I was disappointed about was the inability to stream videos except youtube. The camera takes clear pictures and you are able to play video games that has lots of speed and motion. Overall, I love this product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent perfomance vs price
Reviews.Author: jmachado
Reviews.Content: This tablet was a gift for my son. I liked.Pros:1) The Price is good.2) 4 cores. Is fast.3)APPs android excelent.Full aplications4)The display is very good.5)The connection wifi is fast.6)The multilenguaje.Cons1) Signal the wifi is short.2)The not  incluided APP: Antivirus and parental control.I recomended this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: jillmill
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the tablet. My son uses it for highschool. Has a lot of great features. Is thin and lightweight.

Reviews.Title: it's a pretty good product
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bill
Reviews.Content: This tablet is really want I was looking for. Something that I can use for leisure but then I can use it for school note taking or paper writing as well with the keyboard. I love the android slide touch keyboard that comes with it. It makes writing with the tablet so much easier. My biggest complaint is this, that occasionally the device freezes and restarts even if you aren't running a bunch of crap in the background. This especially seems true when I use Skype. And also the internet will not convert for some reason and I have to restart it for it to connect. Just stuff like that gets pretty annoying pretty fast. The app store for Apple is way better. But it serves it's purpose and usually runs well. The video is fantastic as well as the response time of the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Asus TF300T tablet
Reviews.Author: My Profile
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet for surfing the web and using email online. it is very fast with a quad core Tegra processor and Andriod ICS operating sysem. The touch screen is fantastic and has great color and resolution. The run time is very good when using lower back lighting settings and at full bright it still runs for 5+ hours before needing to charge. The additional dock keyboard adds another 4+ hours run time and a built in USB port. I am very satisified and would recommend this tablet to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet - Bang for Buck second to none
Reviews.Author: Techie Camp Director
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this tablet it was about $375 on Amazon. At that price for a quad core tablet and 32Gb of space I don't think there is really any competition in the space.Pros: Well supported by Asus (software is already on Jelly Bean 4.1), Asus' bundled software isn't total crap, Fast!, Great IPS screen, viewing angles etc. Lots of space and expandable. HDMI out, smooth clean design, optional keyboard is a real differentiator.Cons: Short charging cable, proprietary cable, where it is mounted is understandable for the dock but annoying because it makes it hard to use with a case and charge it and use in general while charging it. Speakers could face forward and would be much much better.Conclusion: I love it so far. It does everything I want it to and for the price the only real competition is it's brother the Nexus 7. But in a 10 inch tablet I am really happy with it. Still android doesn't have the app ecosystem that the iPad does, but for more space, HDMI out, expandable storage, keyboard option etc. it fits my lifestyle much better and the price is incredible especially if you can find it for $375. Asus between the Nexus 7, Transformer Pad, Transformer Prime, and Transformer Pad infinity seem to really be know what they are doing differentiating their products from other tablets and hitting all the price points providing exceptional value at all of them. Really great, and probably the only competitive android tablets out there (with the iPad or any tablet for that matter)

Reviews.Title: fantastic device!
Reviews.Author: chris "whatever73"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing for the money.  It does just about anything you can come up with. Plenty of space with room for more, 10 inch screen, HDMI, jelly bean system and more.  You can get an optional battery/keyboard for but not worth extra 128 bucks in my opinion, if i wanted a keyboard i would bought a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Replacement for my TF101
Reviews.Author: Geno "100percentmechanic"
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this as a direct replacement for my original transformer. This one is faster, more powerful, and has twice the storage capabilities as the original TF101 all at the same price. Even though it appears they refined some aspects of the device ( better, louder speakers, clearer sound, button placement and layout, and more storage), they have skimped on the screen slightly.  I say this because the screen is not Gorilla glass like the original, the Prime, or the new Infinity, which the user risks the screen cracking with the dock installed. Why did i buy it knowing this ??? Because i use the screen and don't intend on buying the dock so this problem is irrelevant to me. If you plan to use the keyboard dock, spend a little more and get the infinity.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I Love everything about it. I have had it for a couple of months now and I have not had any issues with it. OS just upgraded to 4.1.1 and I love the new features. The camera's are great quality. I now control everything in my house on it including computers and electronics in the Den and seucrity camera system. If anyone needs help with it please let me know @ jevans12312@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: fred
Reviews.Author: P. Schaap "fred"
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no problems. Great tablte. Use it all the time and love it. Downloads quick and streams with my 20 Mbps speed with few if any buffering.

Reviews.Title: The best choice in tablets segment
Reviews.Author: coreSh
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone! I Want to say a couple of words about this great device. It's realy amazing! Its performance strikes! Functionality along with Micro HDMI Cable and ASUS USB Kit grows larger!! Connect game controller, keybord, any memory sticks, everything you want. Play 3D games and watch movies on your LED TV!! Good price, very good performance, the best functionality!! Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: Just love this tablet
Reviews.Author: S. Strassburg
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet that I have owned. I did a lot of research on various sites, including Amazon. I originally was going to purchase the Transformer Prime, but started to see reviews that the GPS and the WIFI didn't work as well as the TF300. This issue is caused by the metal case. So, I decided on the Asus Transformer TF300. I am glad I did. It has worked flawlessly. It is fast and the OS is easy to use. Not buying the prime saved me some money, too. So, I was able to buy my wife the 7" tablet she wanted. Oh, BTW, Asus just updated my tablet to Jellybean 4.1.1 and I am stoked. I don't have any complaints about this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Missellvyra
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  Very responsive touch screen, fast, reliable, and always has the latest updates.  I have had this tablet since May and would not trade it for an ipad!

Reviews.Title: Best for the price
Reviews.Author: Discerning and Frugal "Baka"
Reviews.Content: I waited until I lived with the tablet for a couple of months before reviewing it. In retrospect, I wished I had waited for the TF700 before I bought the TF300, but you need to consider whether or not the $100 premium is worth it. The biggest difference I can see is the screen. If you use your tablet outdoors, definitely get the 700. My 300 is usable only if it is cloudy or you are in substantial shade. As far as the nicer metallic finish and thinner depth of the 700 is concerned, since I use a case, this does not matter at all.But the good things...The tablet is quick and capable. It does all the everyday surfing, game playing, and video watching without any hiccups. I appreciate that I can use external media and change out cards easily. Try that with an iPad...Then my more specialized need... The ability to handle external storage is very important for my use. On long trips I need the ability to offload photos taken with my SLR and I can generate massive volumes of data as I shoot in RAW format. Standard USB devices connect well to the keyboard dock so I can attach my CF cards through a reader to transfer data to an external hard drive and free up media to continue shooting on the four cards I normally have with me. In the past I traveled with a laptop, but no more...

Reviews.Title: Jelly Bean update solved freezing issues
Reviews.Author: Ryan S. Mcclelland
Reviews.Content: This tablet was good, pretty smooth and fast, except it would freeze up and stutter fairly often, just not a *great* user experience. That was totally solved with the Jelly Bean update today. Kudos to Asus for getting it out quickly. Awesome tablet.

Reviews.Title: First Impression is a good one
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I've been thinking of purchasing an Android based tablet for some time and have looked at several at the various generations have come and gone.  I was originally looking at a slightly older pair available at another retailer as refurbished.  However, after considering that an update to Jelly Bean is important to me I decided that Asus's statement regarding the update being planned "in the coming months" and the quad core processor were worth the bump in price.The aesthetics are pleasant.  I knew I was buying a 10" tablet so the overall size and weight are inline with what I was expecting and have found it natural to use.  The screen does collect finger prints and debris easily so I'm experimenting with a stylus and have a screen protector on order to see if that will help.I am a fan of Ice Cream Sandwich (and looking forward to Jelly Bean), so while that's not a unique feature of this tablet, but they do pair well together.  The apps/widgets/etc included are OK, the Note app in particular seems to have potential.  However I like that there are not a ton of unnecessary apps/bloatware included that you can't remove; it provides a nice, clean, simple environment for you to go crazy downloading apps catered to your needs/wants.  Contrast this to my smartphone which came with a dozen apps I never asked for nor want but take up precious space and constantly want updates and I'm a happy camper.As for performance of the tablet itself, I have seen one or two hiccups including apps closing themselves and lag/slow performance.  I'm not certain yet if it's relating to the specs of the device itself, the performance settings being used (Asus includes an easy to access setting for low/mid/high performance to help manage the trade off on battery life/performance), or the apps I've installed.  Hoping to experiment more and zero in on a possible cause.Overall I'm happy though, with my few minor concerns so far either having work arounds or being "livable".

Reviews.Title: Outstanding, Easy to use, even for a six year old.,
Reviews.Author: W. McAvoy
Reviews.Content: Purchased for the family, battery life is very good only charge overnight every two or three days. Searched for a case found one for $10, was just patient and looked around. I dont think I will need the keyboard, at least not yet. I hope to have this device for 4-5 years. I have had this device almost 5 months no issues at all. I Use GPS,headphones, added memory card. Having child use this has freed up computer for other family members.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I looked at several tablets and chose this one. It has a quad core and 32Gig of storage. I added a 32 Gig micro SD card. It has all of the speed that I need. I have multiple apps active at the same time with no speed penalty. I use a Verizon MiFi when mobile and use the Ericson AccessToGo to connect to Windows servers. The touch screen works great for the access.I had looked at tablets last year and tried a 7 inch one. I returned that one the next day because it was so slow and the touch screen was random. Not a problem with the Asus pad. It is fast and the touch screen is accurate. I have not tried the camera yet. I transfer pictures from my camera by removing the micro SD card, copying from my PC and re-inserting it in the tablet.There are several drawbacks and that is why I give only four stars.It requires a special cable to charge that does come with it.There are no USB connections, unless you purchase the docking station. I didn't get it yet.

Reviews.Title: Asus Tablet T300
Reviews.Author: Jim in SD "jwk"
Reviews.Content: I now have had it for a month and am beginning to get a handle on how to use it.  The android operating system is a little different then Microsoft and Apple computers and one has to adjust.  I am glad I purchased this Asus T300 tablet over the Apple i-Pad for it not only saved me a ton of money I can also syn many more items with my Microsoft computers.  Highly recommend anyone to purchase one of these - I know you too will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: My New Hard-working Tool
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "I absolutely love to read! I...
Reviews.Content: My Smartphone is jealous of my ASUS Transformer Tablet. My phone was attached to me like a limb; now it appears that I have grown a bigger limb. However, now that I have my Tablet,I can do so much more--faster. Connectivity and reliability are on the top of my very long list of why I am enjoying my Tablet. What a great graduation gift from my family.ASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue)

Reviews.Title: great product..
Reviews.Author: arn007
Reviews.Content: I bought the ASUS Transformer TF300 last month and is using for a month. Very happy with the tablet. Has all the capabillities I was looking for, light weight, easy to setup and use. Has HDMI, GPS,etc... worth for the money.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I did a lot research before deciding to pull the trigger.  So easy to set up and all the apps on my droid phone downloaded to my tablet after logging into my gmail account which was so cool. The screen is beautiful and I love the expandable memory capability. The browser speed seemed a little slow and the touch screen response is sometimes delayed but I love it so far. Heard the Dolphin HD browser was faster so plan to try it out.

Reviews.Title: Better than an ipad2
Reviews.Author: omh
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying the Asus 300  my wife has an ipad2 this asus works circles around it you can add and delete easily. The ipad requires connecting to the computer to do the simplest tasks. I am a linux ubuntu user too, this android pad is powerful.  More free apps that do something than apple. Reminds me of linux open source.  Asus, great tablet. Amazon great service.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Carbajal
Reviews.Content: I like all capacity this tablet gives me, the only thing i don't like very much is the presicion for pointing places on the screen. Sometimes i'm forced to use my little finger.

Reviews.Title: really wanted this to work
Reviews.Author: C. Martinelli
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to go the ipad route. But i think i am going to have to. I opened the box charged the tablet, when i turned it on i noticed dead pixels right away. I will be returning this.

Reviews.Title: Great option
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: The price is great, I have used this tablet for video watching, and taking notes at an all day convention. I was able to take notes faster than i could before by hand on paper and pen. the battery life was more than adequate. I turned the pad on eco mode and turned onto basically Airplane mode by turning off GPS, Wifi, Sound, Auto Sync and Auto Rotate. But i finished each day with over 50% battery life.Gaming on this is awesome as well. I have noticed though that the wifi signal is not as strong as it should be compared with other items, but over all this is not an issue.

Reviews.Title: Updated review after good unit.
Reviews.Author: Johnny Cinco
Reviews.Content: There was a time when all ASUS computers were made in Taiwan... They were built like tanks. My first two ASUS laptops from 10+ years ago STILL run today... and I never turned them off, they run 24/7.NOW this ASUS tab worked fairly well for the first 2 weeks. The unit itself looks great. The plastic backing doesn't look cheap at all. The display was crisp and the sound was surprisingly loud with only 1 speaker. I did have some problems with the light sensor that was suppose to detect environmental light levels and adjust the display automatically... It just didn't work. Where ever I was, when set on auto, the tablet screen always adjusted to the most dim. Another problem is the battery display. My battery can be charging or fully charged and the unit would give me the most random battery status. "52seconds on 100% battery charge.." really? The Android OS isn't polished either. Certain apps don't work on the tab and alot of apps seem like they are still in the beta phase. Adobe reader was laggy, and google chrome as well (without flash support???). The weather app was useless on auto detect mode as well... I had to manually set my location...I could deal with all this except 2 days ago the tablet started randomly and frequently rebooting itself. I would set it aside and when I come back to it, I'd notice the tablet had shut down. After a bit of trial and error I found the unit was defective. It was sensitive to me placing it on any surface, even on the couch or the carpet. I wasn't throwing it either and from day one I had a hard case placed on it. I'm sure this is a QA issue. I'll give the tablet another chance and it's been shipped back to Amazon for a replacement.UPDATE: First of all the Amazon replacement program is AMAZING. I never left the house! Makes me not worry about ordering from this company ever. Printed my labels and called, they dropped off a new unit the same day they picked up my defective one. This unit works perfectly, no more shut downs for no reason. The OS is running smoother now with the latest update. The ASUS weather is working finally, as well as the auto dim option. Adobe's update also makes my image heavy pdfs run alot smoother. I still have complaints with some apps not optimized though, but this I think is the same with all android devices. I am upping to a 4star.

Reviews.Title: Screen Issues - Resolved
Reviews.Author: Ragnar
Reviews.Content: Was super excited for this tablet to arrive (and am still looking forward to the replacement one I should get in a few days). As soon as I started to charge the tablet and the screen came on, I knew there was a problem. The bottom right corner looked grey-white while the rest of the screen was black. There were additional grey-white patches around the edge of the screen. Googled it and discovered that a fair number of these TF300s suffer from this 'screen bleed.' Some users suggest this is normal for tablets but I've seen/used a number of tablets and haven't noticed this issue before. Amazon (as usual) was awesome about it; they shipped me a replacement immediately. I hope this problem was specific to my tablet and not endemic to the TF300. I'll definitely update this review as soon as I get the replacement. Hopefully will be able to add multiple stars once I get to actually use the device. Best.***UPDATED***New tablet arrived today and it appears that the screen bleed on the initial tablet was an anomaly (if you can call 1/2 that but I'll give Asus the benefit of the doubt). Absolutely zero screen bleed even in  dark room with a black screen. The tablet and keyboard dock work great together. Tablet is super responsive and fast. Incredibly happy and would recommend both.

Reviews.Title: What a great tablet for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Great tablet. The only things I have a small gripe about are, there is a little light leakage at the corners of the screen when the background is black, and the WiFi could be better. 5ghz dual band would be nice.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Biggles "Cheri"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet! So, why 4 stars instead of 5? The instructions are non-existent. The only thing included was a small booklet that tells you what each button is and then...zippo. I had to go online to find a more comprehensive set of instructions, and even that is geared to the tech heads. If you're a beginner, you WILL be lost. Fortunately, there's a great group of folks at a Transformer forum that has been walking me through the basics. If they hadn't, I'd have a very expensive coaster for my drink.Despite the above, this is one awesome tablet.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet
Reviews.Author: vikkk
Reviews.Content: This is the best tablet hands down. It poops on the ipad. Allows for laptop feel plus remote desktop to a pc with dock. Eadily rooted and unlocked thanks to asus. Mine runs at 1.6 Ghz when I need it to.

Reviews.Title: Love it.  A real iPad killer
Reviews.Author: Eric in CT
Reviews.Content: OK, so I am a huge Android fan since version 2.0 but this is the first tablet i have found that can really compete with the iPad.  And for the money it is a much better buy.  Super responsive and awesome clarity.  A very, very good deal.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I had hoped for.
Reviews.Author: B. Wood
Reviews.Content: Ordering/ shipping:  Amazon you've done it again. The process was quick, simple and straightforward.  It even showed up a day earlier than posted on the website tracking information.ASUS Transformer TF300:  Very handy, does what I need.  The apps are plentiful, the display is beautiful, and not being a Techie, all of the talk about display, processor speed, how it does or doesn't compare to this or that doesn't mean a hill of beans to me.What I will say is, it's not a replacement for my laptop. I don't expect it to be.  I want some apps, I want something to read a book on, I want something to play some music on. This tablet does all that and more.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Smurf
Reviews.Content: Great product. It's a little top heavy and having the speakers on the side is a little annoying but worth the price!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Smurf
Reviews.Content: Great product. It's a little top heavy and having the speakers on the side is a little annoying but worth the price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Marcelo Mazzitelli
Reviews.Content: Awesome Android Tablet with excellent graphics and perfomance.Special mention to included Asus applications enhancements (from widgets to Cloud services).** EXCELLENT **

Reviews.Title: Cool tablet
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: Tablet is awsome. It fast, good for gamings and browsing. Pre-installed softwares are not upto the mark.Softwares are not customized, its as we can find in ICS 4.0.If Asus will modify the softwares like samsung. Its an awsome tablet in the price range.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Gervin Torres / Isabel Bastidas
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing tablet, fast, nice android apps, camera, mini sd card slot. Get it, the price is the best.

Reviews.Title: Summary: I recommend the ASUS TF300 tablet
Reviews.Author: William C Ratliff
Reviews.Content: I have been working with this item for approximately a month now. I have found that the construction of the tablet itself is of good quality. The cameras are not the best on the market but for my purposes they are more than adequate but I'm not a heavy user of them. It will never replace my laptop or a desktop but it does do 80% of the casual work that I would normally do with my laptop in a far more convenient and portable fashion.I would highly recommend this tablet to anyone in the market.

Reviews.Title: Overall good buy
Reviews.Author: Randy P
Reviews.Content: This is actually a great purchase....i like everything about it but first of it doesn't do so well outside ...i couldn't really see alot (direct sunlight) ...but the screen is nice otherwise ...it has a lil screen leakage where you can see a lil white light coming from the edge but you'll only really notice it if the screen is totally black in which case ..your probably not even using the tablet...i do recommend a screen protector! Its just harden glass...so while still durable i would get one .... I like the sound quality alot....hope i help

Reviews.Title: A Commuter Student's Best Friend
Reviews.Author: Vikki P.
Reviews.Content: Here's some quick background to frame my review: I'm a student that travels 20+ miles to school via public transportation everyday. I got tired of lugging my laptop to/from school everyday. I'd been eyeing the Asus Transformer family with lusty eyes, but didn't have the money for it. Then Asus quietly released the TF300, which coincided beautifully with my (pseudo)graduation and consequent graduation money. I snapped a TF300 up to get me through my final summer classes, and DAGGUM, I wish I had this little beast for my regular semesters!OVERALL: It's a solid tablet and the best bang for your buck. I haven't taken a look at everything that the TF300 can do, but what I've used has worked for the most part. I'll try to update the review as I try new things.APPEARANCE, BUILD QUALITY, AND ERGONOMICS: 4/5- True, it's not "sexy" or shiny. It's understated and professional (which I prefer). Most importantly, it doesn't scream "I LOOK EXPENSIVE. STEAL ME!", which is perfect for studying a train or bus. However, if you have it out, you should still maintain a firm grasp on the device.- It doesn't FEEL cheap, and the plastic body makes it feel very lightweight despite being 1.4lbs. HOWEVER, it is kinda cheap. I have a tight-fitting slim-fit case that has a clasp that holds it shut. In trying to close the clasp, the plastic body did separate a little from the display around the clasp area. I was able to pop things back into place, but the point should be noted.- The edges are more rounded and thicker than the Prime's which will make it more comfortable to hold after long periods. Typing is a bit difficult while holding the TF300; I recommend downloading "Perfect Keyboard (Free)" because it comes with a "thumb" keyboard that splits the keyboard in half.PERFORMANCE 3/5:- Moving between homescreens is snappy, apps open quickly, and switching between open apps is pretty quick too- Polaris Office sometimes tells me that there isn't enough memory to run the application when it's the only app that's open. This is a major annoyance because I would lose any notes that I had taken since the last time I saved the document. To be fair, the PowerPoint that I have open is often 50-80 slides (4-8MB) long and has MANY images on it. I've also been running the tab in Balanced Mode, but I doubt bumping it up to High Performance Mode would help much, since it only clocks the processor at an additional 0.1-0.2 GHz. I haven't experienced any app crashes outside of Polaris Office.- People say that their apps freeze or that they get that "this is taking longer than usual" message. It's not because there's something wrong with the OS or processor. It's just that the READ SPEEDS are slow (despite it being an SSD). The OS will think something is wrong, but in reality, it's just the data isn't loading fast enough. (I'm lead to believe that this is the case because the large PowerPoints take forever to load in the sidebar in Polaris Office)- Loading Gallery images/thumbnails also took a bit of time. Weird, since I don't have many images on the device. Again, my hypothesis is slow read speeds.- The stock browser experience isn't much better than the one found on Amazon Silk. It'll often give you the "this is taking longer than it should" message, but as soon as that message pops up, the page will finish loading. Just tap "wait" and move on. The Google Chrome Beta and Dolphin Browser are great alternatives.- I can't speak for gaming performance, as I did not purchase this tablet for games. HOWEVER. I do have a few art/photo editing apps. Strokes in SketchBook Express rendered well enough, and the zoom was pretty smooth. Adjusting saturation/brightness/contrast in Photoshop Express was very smooth, and adjusting fill/shadows/highlights in the stock Gallery Editor was very smooth as well. I'd say the GPUs are a very capable bunch (they better be - there's a DOZEN cores!).SCREEN: 5/5 (if you can live without IPS+)- 300 or 350 nits (I keep finding conflicting numbers) is plenty of brightness for indoor use. I usually have the screen at 80-100%- I really like that the screen can actually get pretty dark. It's great for using in the dark. Back when I had the Kindle Fire, I'd have the brightness all the way down and it would STILL be too bright.- The colors are neutral, if not a tad bit on the cool side. I prefer warmer colors, but honestly, I can't really tell unless I had something to compare it to.CAMERA: 3.5/5- I haven't put the front-facing camera through its paces- The rear-facing camera is good for a tablet. The colors are a bit washed out. The zoom is..pretty amazing, actually. I managed to snap a photo of a rail operator extinguishing a smoking switch that was about 100ft away just the other day. Some quick touch ups in an app, and the photo was pretty acceptable.- You can move the focus box around the viewfinder, which I really like. But it takes forever to focus. Factor in my shaky hands, and you get a picture that never really focuses.TAB + KEYBOARD COMBO: 6/5- I'll leave a review of the actual dock for the dock's product page, but as for the combo...LOVE IT.- It's top-heavy, so be careful not to tilt it too far back.- Naturally, the form factor is like that of a 10.1" netbook. You would think that it WAS a netbook until you noticed that there is a camera sensor and speaker grill where they normally wouldn't be.- The best part is that I can take notes with the dock while I'm at school, then review those notes on the train with just the tablet. This is another big plus because it's easier for larger items such as netbooks and laptops to get stolen while you're using them on the train. A tablet that is firmly in your grasp would be much more difficult.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet with sound issue
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Have had it for more than 2 weeks. did not see issues related to bleeding screen, system resets, etc.However, occasionally, sound will be muted/gone. the only way to correct it was to turn it off and then back on. It happened when the wife or kids were playing Mahjong, Smarf or fish tank games. Feels like it is software related.

Reviews.Title: Exellent Pad
Reviews.Author: PPJJ
Reviews.Content: This is an exellent pad considering the price. I use to work at my company but only have a desktop. It's not convenient. This makes my job much nicer. With the optional keyboard, i am able work remotely just as a normal computer. Great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Dave from VT
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great so far.  Works great, has a stock android 4.0.3 OS, screen is very clear and bright.  This is the first tablet I have ever owned, but I have other android devices.  I would definitely buy from ASUS again as they keep the stock look and feel.  I don't have the dock (yet) so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: No warranty or support
Reviews.Author: David S Zike
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Asus products over the past few years and until this purchase have always been pleased the technology and value. The tablet "bricked" itself after an over the air update from Asus. Initial customer support provided an RMA number and it was returned with description of what happened. After that I never heard from them again, always having to contact them myself for updates. They claim the tablet was "jail broken" and refuse to fix it under warranty. The technicians and tech support are not very knowledgeable and have no authority to help you. The problem has been escalated, but again the same story. It seems the company's policy is to save money by providing minimal tech support and not honouring their warranties.If you're willing to take your chances, it is a decent product at a decent price. But don't expect a warranty or support.

Reviews.Title: Touch screen didn't work!
Reviews.Author: Emma Levingston
Reviews.Content: When i recieved my tf-300, the touch screen didn't work. I realize that happens, so i figured i would just exchange it. I didn't have a problem with that. So, I paid to have it shipped back. Well after waiting 2 weeks i receive an email stating my money would be refunded. I didn't want a refund, i asked for an exchange. So it cost me $27 to ship the unit back and i still don't have a tablet. Very frustrated with this whole situation.

Reviews.Title: Has my recommendation
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Hughes "Ron"
Reviews.Content: I've got a lot to learn about how to use a tablet, but, so far, all is going well.  Had some minor difficulty in learning how to download and install apps, but it was short lived.  I'm 70 years old, so, if I can do it, anyone else can.

Reviews.Title: Close to the perfect tablet!
Reviews.Author: Danny Rosser "GYSSGT-USMC"
Reviews.Content: I actually upgraded from my Samsung Galaxy tab 10.1 to this. Almost all of my electronics are Samsung. Including my TVs and phones(my wife's phone as well). I was hesitant at first because I rooted and installed a very nice version of ICS. CM9 ROM to be exact.There was two key factors that sold me on this tablet.1-Quad plus 1 core processor2-With Asus hand in hand with Google, Asus will be among the first to receive the 4.1 Jellybean update; and future ones.So to say the least, I love my new Asus Tf300 tab. It does feel more like a 10.2 tablet compared to my Galaxy Tab, but is still a very sleek and sexy tablet.I am  fortuneate enough to receive my tablet with NO light bleed. I purchased mine at Best Buy because I didn't want to wait on shipping once I made my decision that I wanted one.Now, I will have to choose between the new Asus Infinity or new Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet. Yes, I am an Android tablet junkie.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet but fragile screen
Reviews.Author: C. Grant
Reviews.Content: I owned this the Asus Transformer Pad TF300 for 28 days before I had to return it.  I was quite disappointed, because overall I loved this little tablet.Without a good reason, the screen broke, with a U-shaped, single crack in the middle of it.  I don't know what caused the crack, since the week prior to the tablet's sudden demise it wasn't dropped, exposed to heat, or wasn't sat upon (except maybe the cat sat on it when I wasn't looking).  Maybe the case warped somehow (a sort of torque-twist might have caused that strange crack), but it wasn't treated harshly in any way.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!!!! BUY SOMETHING ELSE!! SCREEN DIES!
Reviews.Author: brian buskard
Reviews.Content: Used for about 4 hours on 2 trips I went on and screen dies even after reboot!!! You've been warned. I'm so, so disappointed. Cannot believe the lack of quality! They want $200. to fix it! yikes! First review I ever wrote! What a waste of money, I could Just Puke!!!

Reviews.Title: ya probably not
Reviews.Author: Katrina Turner
Reviews.Content: New? How can you receive something new and it doesn't even turn on. For those that work im sure it's a pretty nifty tablet, but im all set.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: BigC
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a substitute for a laptop.Overall the performance was very good .But I really wanted one with cellphone connectivity which this model doesn't have.Wi-Fi  worked well but I am not always in range of  a hotspot.Passed it to a young person who is thrilled to have it!!!. Went back to laptop and smartphone for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Big, heavy, and likely to tip over if docking station attached
Reviews.Author: Eric Sternot
Reviews.Content: Can be rooted. Battery lasts a pretty long time, especially when fitted with keyboard. Comes with a nice cleaning cloth. Pretty neat, but as a tablet, I felt it was too big to hold in my hands unless on my lap. Tablet is also pretty heavy. If fitted with keyboard docking station, be careful not to let it tip over.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this junk!
Reviews.Author: Manish Shrestha
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet in best buy and paid the full price for it when it first came out. The only reason I am writing this review is because people should stop buying this junk and look for other alternative tablets. This tablet always had issues and I hoped for it to get solved with its updates as the updates were pretty frequent.Anyways to the point, this is junk because:- WIFI signal is always low no matter how close you are at the router. This never got fixed with any of the updates.- GPS locking is OK. Sometimes takes about 4-5min to lock down the location.- Audio is a piece of crap.- Video is OK.- Performance is very slow when in power saving mode/balanced mode but tends to be a little better when in performance mode. However, it is still slow. The worst thing is the performance degradation is not noticeable when trying out the tablet in the store, but as you use it and try to do a little multitasking then it just breaks.- Has quad core processor, 1 GB RAM, and cannot handle any process intensive tasks. If you play a game like minion rush which is not even that process intensive, then it keeps skipping during display.- No resale value. I have been trying to resale this for around $180 and I just can't. No one buys it and my tablet is in mint condition.- Better alternatives out there with less price. For example: Nexus 7, Nexus 10, Samsung Galaxy Tab3. However the Nexus are manufactured by ASUS, so I would try Samsung instead. Personally not a fan of Samsung either, but hey I would bet that it performs well than this piece of junk even though the processor is dual core only.- Lot of bloatware apps included that makes your tablet slower than it already is.- The product build quality is not good as well. It's very plasticky and will break if u mistakenly drop it.- No exchange program with ASUS to replace it with a better one. I checked the exchange program with BEST BUY and they are offering $30 for it. Really????- Lastly, comment me to post the tablet for $180 if you want to buy it. It is in good condition and has a very light scratch at the right top corner. You can't find the scratch unless you want to find it. I just want to get rid of it. I wish ASUS gave me $180 back for it. I would pay the shipping charge and send them the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Cool tablet
Reviews.Author: Aaron G. Bishop "Aaron"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had any problems with it. It's fast and reliable, but i seems the only time I ever use it is when my laptop is further away or completely shutdown. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: It's an alright
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I can honestly understand why some users complained that the back is plastic instead of metal. It does change its shape based on room temperature. Like there would be pressure that pops up for no reason. I had to have it serviced for that a couple of times. I would honestly trade it in for better ASUS tablet WITH metal back. Because ASUS makes good quality than samsung despite they have alot of bells and whistles. ASUS is the way to go if you all about just quality only without bell and whistles. I really can't point out the pros and cons at this point. The good plus is that it is a good affordable tablet to buy which I purely love it despite faults on it.

Reviews.Title: only 1 thing wrong
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: the only thing wrong so far is that i expected the back of the tablet to be "blue".  I had originally wanted a red one, however could not find anyone who had one available.  The next best was the "blue" so I ordered it.  I was very chagrined to see that the back of mine is not blue however, it is black.  i know that is a very minor thing to be concerned about, however it is (so far) the ONLY thing i don't like about my new asus. I had originally thought to use my tablet for reading digital books only, however i am happy to see that i can play games and manage my social media page as well.  if anyone were to ask me - i would definitely recommend this tablet. the size was a major factor for me - i wanted something that would rival the size of a "real" book and this is perfect. i had balked at getting a tablet for a very long time as i love the feeling of having a real book, so the size matters to me. i also love that i can alter the size of the font and the color background of my pages.  that makes it very handy for reading at night without my reading glasses. i have not had occasion to use the camera other than to check out how it works.  i followed the instructions to charge the battery for the 1st time and was pleasantly surprised to find that i could read for approximately 8 hours or so on a full charge.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Gamer21
Reviews.Content: Love this Tablet. Much faster than my other Tablet Acer Iconia A200. Even has and extra core which I really like. Handles top edge gaming with a breeze and no hiccups. Love this Tablet!!

Reviews.Title: I have had no issues
Reviews.Author: scott r evenson
Reviews.Content: This has worked fine, except the battery does not last as long as stated. Otherwise its been a good unit.

Reviews.Title: Was what i was looking for.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  And not so high tech that a mawmaw can use, however will need help from friends to set up more detailed apps.

Reviews.Title: Great Android Tablet.
Reviews.Author: Saul Nova
Reviews.Content: It has a great balance between price and quality. If you don't need the best screen resolution, this is the perfect android tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Sheryl Brandmeyer
Reviews.Content: I got the refurbished model which saved me a ton of money.  It works great, looks great, etc.  No problems with it.  The only complaint I have is that it came with absolutely no paperwork at all so no instructions on charging it properly, features, or how to change settings.

Reviews.Title: nice tablet!
Reviews.Author: yabely
Reviews.Content: the tablet is nice, it works fine, it is fast and versatile.the first one i got from amazon was defective, but i called amazon and they sent me a new one real fast with no hold ups. this new tablet i got its working just fine with no issues. overall i am happy with my purchase, and with the costumer service from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Bought 5 of these and might get more!
Reviews.Author: lmcgilli "lmcgilli"
Reviews.Content: These were a big hit with the keyboard and case. The price is great for what you get. I have noticed that compared to my Nexus 7, I run into a few more software issues with fb and games where I have to restart. Have never had to do that with my Nexus. The 10" size is much better for meeting note taking and presentations.

Reviews.Title: Bought 5 of these and might get more!
Reviews.Author: lmcgilli "lmcgilli"
Reviews.Content: These were a big hit with the keyboard and case. The price is great for what you get. I have noticed that compared to my Nexus 7, I run into a few more software issues with fb and games where I have to restart. Have never had to do that with my Nexus. The 10" size is much better for meeting note taking and presentations.

Reviews.Title: Transformer TF300 is Great
Reviews.Author: Shephards
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed my transformer but with the 10" screen I advise getting a cover for it at the same time and you should look into the accident ins from squaretrade as well because I dropped my tablet and the LED screen cracked totally my fault but it still worked great I have sent it to squaretrade to have the screen replaced should be back to me within 10 days

Reviews.Title: ASUS TF300T - Not Bad!
Reviews.Author: Gerald W Sapatka Jr
Reviews.Content: I bought this pad as an entry level user to Android.  So far, this pad has not disappointed in any way.  The app that come on it are very useful and the ones you download from the play store are great!  For the money, this pad will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: SAMUEL C HUSTED
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything negative to say about this product.  Works great/as advertised no issues form me.  Will buy again!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for such a low price.
Reviews.Author: vijaypuvvada
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet at amazon warehouse deals for $260  QUAD CORE TABLET WITH JB 4.2.1 (I paid $220 As i applied for amazon CC and got $50 gift... mind blown). I have/had almost all brands of tablets before this... As I was paying so little price for this I thought it would have some defects.... But NONE. Even the screen brightness is awesome for indoor use. Fast and easy for customization. Asus has won many hearts by upgrading their products to the latest and the greatest software... This TF300 got Jellybean 4.2 recently (Not many high-end tablets are running 4.2 currently) and the best part is you can customize it to run stock android stuff like launcher, Notifications etc.  I'm very impressed by this product. For that price you can't beat all you get from this tablet. If you are a casual users this tablet is for you... If you are a gamer... yes this tablet is for you too (If you can just ignore the screen specs). I would 100% recommend this product to others. Good Job ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Great for traveling and general couch potatoing.
Reviews.Author: R. Sazanowicz
Reviews.Content: I purchased this table in conjunction with the keyboard dock.  Together it has days of battery life and works great.  Mine sees most of it's use on the airplane and on the couch while watching tv.  After the update to Android Jelly Bean, the tablet has seemed to slow down a bit but not enough to be of concern.  It still works well, has a crisp, clear, and bright display, and has been well worth the purchase.  The additional SD and MicroSD slots on the tablet and dock provided a huge storage boost.

Reviews.Title: it's faster then my laptop
Reviews.Author: Leigh D Haman
Reviews.Content: I wished that it worked better with all the Facebook games! It should have a headphone jack. I like how easy it is to use.I use it more then my laptop.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Lyn
Reviews.Content: The pics are clear, games are clear and respond well to touch.  I do miss the fact that I can get Adobe Flash Player install, but hey I guess one can't have everything......yet!

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Richard M. Holt
Reviews.Content: I'm not use to this technology, so it will take some getting use to. There were no real directions on how these things are supposed to work, as they must think that everyone must know how to make things happen, but being a computer geek, I'm slowly catching on. Apparently, you need to have an 'app' in order to do most everything, and apparently they think everyone uses google mail and has a google acccount. And with my big fingers, I finally figured out that by using a stylus, things happen much faster and more accurate. As far as I'm concerned, this will never replace my computer. I just wanted it to do email and browse the internet while on the road, and for that, this should do the trick.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: theslam
Reviews.Content: Excellent product... totally love it! Been more than a year now and I love ASUS products now after the transformer... Has been working great without any issues! Certainly would recommend this over any other tablet!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Christine Bird "ctbird"
Reviews.Content: who needs an ipad? this asus is of high quality and works seamlessly with my galaxy III. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Good product initially, Firmware update issues and terrible repair service
Reviews.Author: McCoolest
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with my purchase at first. Then I was prompted to do a firmware update. I accepted of course, because I assumed that the new firmware would not cripple my tablet. Perhaps a week after the update, my keyboard on the dock stopped working. It still accepts input via the touchpad and mouse key, only the keyboard keys stopped functioning. I sent the unit in for repair and it was returned without the problems being addressed.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Dale
Reviews.Content: This unit I bought for my wife and she loves it,easy to nav. and now I am looking to buy two more.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Lorena
Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet, ive only own it for 3 days so i cant say that much about but so far it is very nice, touchscreen is very responsive, however i compared it to my sisters samsung tab 2 and i found hers to be more responsive, i dont know if it is something you can configurate. I tried the hdmi port and works fine, connected an usb drive and worked nicely as well. I think this is a very good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: J. Harley
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these on sale last week.  I loved the specs, memory and price.  Considering the mediocre resolution (1280X800) the screen was actually bright and decent, although it took a little while for me to get used to it, considering it replaced my retina iPad.  I gave the iPad to my wife and switched to Android because I find the widgets and other customizable options to be very useful.  Although the specs of the ASUS look good on paper, the iPad was still much more responsive, especially with games.  Subway Surfers and Adrenaline 7 play flawlessly on the iPad.  The colors are rich and vibrant and the gameplay is smooth with no frame rate issues.  On the ASUS both games had dull colors and suffered from constant frame rate issues including artifacts and occasional stuttering.  I realize the iPad is better optimized for gaming, so I didn't hold this against the ASUS, especially since I spend less than 10% of my tablet time gaming.  That's one of the tradeoffs going from iOS to Android.  The good tradeoffs are the customizable interface and my fave, the widgets.  The TF300 was wonderful for the first week but on the ninth day, two bright spots appeared on the screen.  They were about the size of a pea and appeared in two different areas of the screen.  They were noticeably brighter than the rest of the screen. I exchanged it for another, came home, opened it and immediately scanned top to bottom for screen issues.  The screen was okay other than some backlight bleeding along the edges.  Figuring I was just unlucky with the first one, I settled down with the replacement and started reloading all of my apps and settings.  My joy lasted one day.  On day two a dead pixel just popped up out of nowhere.  I tried t ignore it but it was in a prominent spot of the viewing area.  No matter how hard I tried to ignore it, it attracted my eyes like a magnet.  Needless to say, I returned that one as well and gave up on the TF300.  Call me picky but if I'm paying over $300 for a tablet, I don't think a defect-free display is too much to ask.  I've purchased five iPads over the years, starting with the very first generation and none had screen issues; neither did my Samsung Galaxy Tab.  If I could get ahold of one with an acceptable screen, I think I'd love this tablet but twice is enough.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Weight loss That Works
Reviews.Content: My mom got an IPADI got this one and MINE IS BETTER! faster and has FREE APPS YEAHHHHHHNo need to spend 500+ on an Ipad get one of these!!They are amazing

Reviews.Title: Frustrating touchscreen problem, no solution found (until contacted, then fixed by ASUS)
Reviews.Author: D. W. Lunt
Reviews.Content: Got this in June, now it is November. Loved it when I first got it. Is responsive, does all kinds of things a tablet should and does it well; when it works right. Got it with keyboard. Glad I did. In August (after Amazon return window closed) Tablet touchscreen stopped responding. Would only work if attached keyboard, used it for a while, then disconnected from keyboard. Searched web and Asus site for support. Found very little info on web, some similar problems but no solutions. Found nothing on Asus support. Very awkward site to negotiate. Removed some apps, no improvement. Have rebooted device multiple times with no results. Lived with sporadic problem for a while then Asus pushed out OS update to Jelly Bean, problem went away. Then it started again a couple of days ago. I wanted to take some photos with it (excellent camera) but no touchscreen response. It sucks when trying to take photos with keyboard attached. I use this tablet for my references for a study I attend and cannot do it with keyboard attached, too many things to hold on my lap. Did not intend to use keyboard for routine work, only for occasional and when traveling. So tablet without touchscreen becomes $500+ paperweight which I don't need. Needed it for class last night but screen would not respond. Turned it on while writing this review this AM, now it works. Not very dependable like that. Spouse has Ipad II which has never had this problem. Starting to regret my purchase. Gave it 2 stars at this point.UPDATE 12/07/2012I had a very hard time finding specific support information for my problem. Looked around web, other forums, and ASUS site. Struck gold on Amazon when Tien Phan found my complaint on the Amazon site and contacted me. We established email connection and he and I attempted a couple of fixes including a system restore to factory defaults. When those software attempts did not work he determined it had to go back for service and provided me with an RMA to ship it to Texas. Prepared it (I still had original packaging) and sent it off on 11/23. Was able to track progress via shipper's site and the repair with ASUS RMA. Service turnaround was quick and had it back on 12/5. Have used it heavily past two days, no repeat of the screen freezing up. I am pleased with the device, raised it to 4 stars. I'll give it some more time before we get to 5. I am very happy with Tien's work and so happy he found me on Amazon.UPDATE 02/11/2013Wanted to leave a final update to this. Have used the tablet daily since ASUS repaired it. Taken it on travel, used with variety of hotel and other wi-fi connections. It works flawlessly. Have had no repeats of screen issues, acquires sites quickly and with clarity. Have updated stars to 5. I truly love it!

Reviews.Title: One shot tablet
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the tablet and its performance.  However, it's glass is not up to snuff.  Had a cat step on it and had a crack from one end of the screen to the other.  Input went completely dead.  I was going to order a replacement part, but replacement parts from reputable sellers are nigh impossible to find.  Not only that, but you have to replace the LED screen as well as it is attached via adhesive.  Repair costs are at least half the cost of the tablet, so take a pass on this disposable tablet.

Reviews.Title: Just doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Niellila
Reviews.Content: Offered this product to my wife for her birthday. What a disappointment! Nice design, specs, connectivity/storage vs Apple (Usb, sd, hdmi etc), value for money, etc, at least on paper. Then real life 2 days after having received the product is as follows: apps freeze all the time, even home screens get stuck all the time now, the machine would behave completely erraticaly registering touches out of nowhere, or would not register touches at all, etc. Keyboard dock just increases the frequency of these glitches. The huge bleeding on one side of the screen became a non issue at this point. Tried a couple of factory resets hoping to get rid of some of these issues, in vain. This product is completely unusable. Seems like there are major software/hardware integration issues. Anyhow returning it promptly before it breaks down altogether. Won't ask for a replacement as I don't see how this would resolve these structural issues. For such a brand as Asus it is unacceptable to sell things like that that just don't work - almost feels like a scam. My 2 year old Samsung Galaxy S I now feels like a Ferrari compared to this product. Also Have an iPad 2 for work and despite not being much of an Apple fan I have to recognize that user experience is just light years ahead of this.

Reviews.Title: ASUS TF 300 touch screen quit after 5 weeks
Reviews.Author: donna
Reviews.Content: Right after the one month warranty for Amazon returns passed the touch screen quit. Had to spend a lot of time on hold with tech support. Spent $16.80 for postage and waited 2 weeks to get tablet back. Not happy with customer support!I thought I was buying a quality product.This is ASUS' response:Dear Ms. Maemori,Thank you for contacting us in regards to the RMA process. Unfortunately we do not provide any refunds, I do apologize for your inconvenience. Please do let me know if you have any other questions.Thank you,Aaron LASUS Customer Care Team9/12/12Another thing I forgot to add is that when the touch screen froze the ASUS technician on phone support was unable to help me do a factory reset so I had to send tablet for repair with all my personal data on it.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality product
Reviews.Author: the amazonian
Reviews.Content: Full Disclosure: I did not buy this product from Amazon, but from Staples. However, I wanted to review this product in general.I bought it in March 2012, and the product started to have multiple problems in September 2012. I can't return it to Staples. SO I contacted ASUS Support and got it repaired, but the the problems were not completely fixed. The plastic back cover is of poor quality. The Tablet itself is of poor quality. The touch screen does not work correctly. Apps open and closed themselves. Tablet rebooted itself frequently. I upgraded to the latest Android and reset to manufacture setting, still same problems. So I decided to write this review.Bottom line: Not recommended product.This product works great for 6 months. I love it when I first got it. Then once problems started, there is no stopping it. The repair job was not good. It costs me $20 to mail the product to Texas to repair. 6 weeks later, the product was returned and it works for 1 month. Then same problems happen again.

Reviews.Title: Started off good, but...ended up returning it.
Reviews.Author: Maritza
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to receive this tablet since this was my first one. I've had it for 2 weeks now. For the record, i dont use it every day & is plugged into its charger in my room for at least 4 days out of the week.Everything was fine the first week. But this week it started turning off randomly. Since I've never had a tablet, i thought maybe it as turning off to perform updates, so i wasn't too concerned.  We'd hit the power button & it would power back up.Today, on a road trip i was using it, & it powered down again.  This time i couldn't turn it back on. I ended up calling ASUS & the rep walked me thru a cold boot (press the volume down button first, then the power button & hold them together til the screen comes back to life. It will go thru its motions & reboot to the desktop) I explained to the rep that at this point this was worrisome. He said if it happened again to do another cold boot. I told him if it happened again there was clearly an issue with the tablet & if i could send it back for an exchange.  He said I could send it back for servicing. "SERVICING"???!!!  Really, only 2 weeks old??!! I told him i didn't buy a new tablet to have it serviced after only 2 weeks. If there was another problem i wanted an "EQUIVALENT NEW IN BOX NON-DEFECTIVE" tablet. Let's see what happens over the course of our vacation & more usage. But i hope if i need to exchange, Amazon doesn't send me a "refurbished" one or tell me i need to have this one serviced. My only other "issue" is the serial #. Its a sticker by the charging port & the corners are coming up. If the sticker falls off i wont know what the serial# is. I'll have to write it down & file it for safekeeping. Cheesy. *UPDATE* I was searching on Amazon.com for a cover for this tablet earlier today & the browser crashed 6-7 times. VERY frustrating. Asus just downloaded a firmware update tonight so lets see if that fixes anything.7/7/12:  After 3 weeks, several crashes, random shut downs & reboots, coupled with several reviews about how delicate the screen is, I decided to return it. Is $385 a good deal? Yes, but couple that with all the problems, and that's an EXPENSIVE risk to take. As much as I prefer Android, this experience has made me lean towards an iPad. Think I'll wait for the iPad 3. Nice try ASUS, but you've have GOT to perfect this tablet.

Reviews.Title: asus tf300 royal blue
Reviews.Author: Madhat
Reviews.Content: great, even though it's only in royal blue it's a nice blue.. yeah they took out half the l.e.d's but it was not needed, if you want the FASTER clockspeed root and set it yourself, this puppy has a bad ass terga 3, great graphics! i can play bf3. starcraft and alot of others using splashtop thd, the speaker is eh.. but its a great tablet from a great company try it!

Reviews.Title: sending back to asus the 3rd time
Reviews.Author: rami
Reviews.Content: This tablet has a lot of problems. Sent back to Asus two times because it would not turn on after recharging. Now i have to send it back because it reboots every 10 min for no apparent reason. Stay away from such products.Save yourself money, time and frustration.

Reviews.Title: bad digitizer and no manufacturer suppor
Reviews.Author: NMF96
Reviews.Content: Bought an Asus TF300 for my son.  I used it extensively as it is a great tablet PC with fantastic functionality, speed, software, etc.  Unfortunately, after 4 months, the screen stopped sensing touch input.  Then the glass cracked.  I blamed my son initially.  Sent it to a PC repair firm in San Diego.  I have learned since through forums and talking to the repair technicians that this is a common problem with the TF300's.  Asus does not repair them.  The repair shops have great difficulty finding digitizer screens to replace them with.  They have several of these tablets in their shop and can't get digitizers for them.  I've been without the tablet for 2 months now.  I'll never hear the end of it from my wife, the Apple lover.  I know it's going to cost me about 200 bucks to get the thing fixed, if they can fix it at all.  I would highly recommend not buying an Asus product.

Reviews.Title: NO MORE ANDROID TABLET FOR ME
Reviews.Author: Gc "iPoker"
Reviews.Content: I have this tablet for over 3 months and poked around with almost every feature. For what is it worth, it is NOT worth it, and deserves 2 stars. It may have a quadcore, lots of ram, and a nice GPU in it, but all this hardware is useless because Jelly Bean cannot utilize the hardware very well. I do not like it. There are many ugly Apps that do not work well. There are not enough tablet optimized Apps, but many stretched out phone Apps... Jelly Bean is slow and not very responsive while multi-tasking. There is no way to end-task completely. I have no idea why there are so many stock Apps running in the background. If they are critical to the OS, then these Apps should be hidden. When I end-task on some Apps, they relaunch at same state. Cold reboot is the only way to close all the Apps completely. The Jelly Bean OS don't have well control over the running Apps. The browsers are not very responsive too. Some pages are distorted. I have tried the stock browser, Chrome, Dolphin, and Opera. They are all terrible. I cannot even play MP3 in the background without causing serious browser lags on some pages. Compared to Safari on iOS, these browsers are all FAR behind! They do not immediately start scrolling when touched like on safari, there is a slight annoying delay, and when you zoom in and out, there is rendering lag. The scrolling do not bounce naturally, they just kind of slide... Developers need to understand that the browser IS the most important App on tablets. There are light bleeds on every corner of the screen too, I don't really mind this, but it bleeds much more than my iPad 2, so I just have to mention it. My iPad 2 is fast, reliable, great looking Apps, and very responsive to EVERYTHING. Why can't this TF300 be like that? I don't understand. For $400, I expect the BEST and nothing less, period. When compared to other Android tablets, this one was supposed to be the best. I have little hopes for the other Android tablet at this point. Anyways, in conclusion, Android tablet sucks.

Reviews.Title: excellent android tablet
Reviews.Author: sailorcyte
Reviews.Content: PRO: great value and works well. Be sure to charge at least 6 hrs prior to first use.CON: need more accessories.  No Gorilla Glass..may need to get a screen protector to prevent scratches.

Reviews.Title: no really placent with the tf300
Reviews.Author: Jose  De la Cruz
Reviews.Content: Just got it a couple days ago, i'm playing with the tf300, at the begining i was happy for the response, but after the first day of use the web broswer didn't response right away, and i told myself this baby has a tegra 3, shouldn't be doing this and no mention the screen problems like moving up and down or the flick left side and debating to keep or returning to amazon

Reviews.Title: Was great.... Now Sucks !!!
Reviews.Author: T3ch5upp0rt
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that there are not enough stars  to rate this device WHEN IT WAS RUNNING ICS (Ice Cream Sandwich).  For all intents and purposes it's near flawless.Now, let me continue by saying that one star is way too many rate this device NOW THAT JELLY BEAN was pushed to it.Jelly Bean has issues connecting to 802.1x networks (i.e.: large offices or colleges).  Just use the search engine (that developed Android) and search for `Jelly Bean 802.1' and start reading (get a drink and some chow cause you going to be there for a while).  Also when the tablet wakes up from suspend mode, the wifi connection speed is significantly less.  Example:  tablet running at 52 mbs, after putting the tablet in to suspend mode then waking it up the connection speed is 5 mbs.  The noted internet work around is to go in to settings > wifi > forget the network, the reenter the network password - volia 52 mbs (unfortunately you need to do this each time you suspend the device).  Being a network tech, and having run 2 of these side by side, you can see the difference in the wifi connection speeds.If you are going to use this tablet at home with Jelly Bean it's probably livable, you can stop reading and save some time.The REAL issue is that ASUS is FORCING users to upgrade (and there is no downgrade option unless you root the device and void your warranty).After 5 calls to ASUS support:call 1: you can downgrade,call 2:  we apologize there is no downgrade option,call 3: supervisor set up RMA,call 4: called to discuss rma, got another supervisor.  He admits that they probably will not be able to duplicate this as they do not have an 802.1 network in their rma facility in Grapevine TX.  He does state that if it connects to wifi there they would just send it back.  I quickly point out that I know it connects to WEP / WPA2 - I want this to function like ICS.  Note: here the interesting part, he states if you got one that had ICS you could disable the update.  So off I go to the local store to get ANOTHER TF300T. I get home set it up and the first thing it does is try to upgrade to JB !!!call 5: another super visor, we apologize the is no option to disable the software push.Now lets examine that:  Imagine if that large software company in Redmond Washington, just pushed Vista to all the XP users, or pushed out Win 8 to all the Win 7 users - lawsuits would be filed the first day.  Imagine if HP just `pushed' patches to all the users of its server regardless of the consequences, again I believe there would be lawsuits.  When I asked the supervisor about this and where legally did they have the right to change a device that I paid for, his reply was `that the way the developers wrote it'.As of now one device went back to the local store... the other has ICS that keeps prompting to accept the JB update (every 5 min - interrupting whatever you are doing).  Asus' answer to this is to stop the CMclient and the DMclient which stop the prompts, I refer to this as the BM solution (as in bowel movement).Lastly, I'm not blaming ASUS for a flaw in JB, which lies with the JB developers.  I am blaming ASUS for NOT GIVING THEIR CUSTOMERS A CHOICE TO UPGRADE OR NOT,  AND TO ROLLBACK TO ICS.  This tablet was purchased because of Asus' reputation for standing behind their products.  After 5 calls they admit they do not have a customer service department, only a tech support department.  If you are buying this with ANY intention of using it in your job or school CHECK FIRST because you may want to consider a device from a manufacturer that a:) allows you to rollback or b:) gives you the option of upgrading or just sticking with ICS.7/1/2013  Note Google has fixed jelly bean - big pluses for Google !!! ASUS tech support - meh :-(

Reviews.Title: Tablet felt nice and responsive; keyboard dock, unfortunately, broke the charging port
Reviews.Author: Edward Brown
Reviews.Content: Got this for around $300 to use at school for taking notes, and some light C++ programming. The tablet looked great, was responsive, and relatively easy to navigate. The home screen was nice, and pretty customizable. Being able to use the keyboard was great, and the amount of extended battery life you get from it was amazing. Unfortunately the day after I got it, I went to plug the tablet into the keyboard dock and it wouldn't click. I flipped it upside down to find the charging port broken, I presume from detaching from the keyboard dock the previous night. I don't know if this was due to flimsy materials, or if it was due to the fact that I purchased refurbished from the Amazon warehouse.Amazon was awesome about the return, super fast, and even sent a UPS truck out to my house to pick up the tablet. Got my full refund within a week, and picked up a Nexus 10 instead.

Reviews.Title: Its good for some things but not others.
Reviews.Author: Gregory T Jeffery
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on using this tablet for games and other non work/school related things you dont have to search any farther. however if you are planning on using this for work or school get something different. The Android OS is not quite up with the user interfaces we would expect with Microsoft Office or Apple products.

Reviews.Title: You could do better but you could do worse
Reviews.Author: Hodor
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the TF300 after my Iconia 500 tablet died. I didn't get the keyboard attachment for this tablet so I can not speak to that. I've actually had this for about 9 months now, so I've been using it pretty extensively.The biggest complaint I have about this tablet: It's sluggish. After waking it up it may take 5-10 seconds before it starts responding to touching the screen. Or it may respond almost immediately. If I launch an app, I often have to wait up to 5 seconds before I can even interact with anything in the app. I have to reboot the tablet periodically to regain performance.This sluggishness doesn't make it unusable. Once an app is running and in-focus, it runs fine. It just seems that background processing and context-switching is very poor in this tablet. I do not know how much of that is the specific flavor of Android and how much of it is hardware.A second problem I have which may be linked to the sluggishness is the touch-screen doesn't seem to respond properly sometimes. Even when an app is clearly running (screen is updating, sound is playing, etc) I sometimes have to tap a button or icon a dozen times before the tablet realizes I'm actually interacting with it. I've verified this isn't due to calibration settings or the screen being dirty.By contrast the Acer Iconia 500 was very responsive both to touch input and general app performance. It has a lower-power CPU and less storage capacity, yet this supposedly more powerful tablet ultimately feels like a downgrade. :(My advice is you are considering this tablet is to try and use one for a while, such as borrowing a friends or trying it in a store. Or pick-up a used one and sell it if it doesn't meet your needs. For me, I regret buying it but since it was a sudden replacement need and not a planned upgrade, I consider it an acceptable in-betweener while I wait for the opportunity to buy a better tablet.

Reviews.Title: Incomplete product without a chord
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: I rated this product with three stars because I was aware of what I was getting. They however did not ship this product with a power supply chord but they advertised one would come with the product. I had to separately order a power supply chord because without the chord I can only use it until it ran out of power. I otherwise like the product it is very responsive.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: firelord554
Reviews.Content: I bought this lil guy for school and I love it. It linked all my apps from my phone so the tablet and works without any glitching. The only prob that I have had was that since it is an older model it is lacking in the Newest flash player, however that is not that much of a big deal except for a few websites (one in my case for online text books)

Reviews.Title: Haven't needed to use yet
Reviews.Author: Caroline A. Harris "C A Harris"
Reviews.Content: Hard to review a plan when I haven't needed to use it yet,  I will let you know when I do.,

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Frank A. Crabtree
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a friend.  Her first computer. I would like to have one for myself.  Needs better instruction book on how to use.

Reviews.Title: It died only 6 months after purchase KEEP AWAY FROM ASUS
Reviews.Author: Fabio J. S
Reviews.Content: I like to write reviews months later after I buy an item since its more unlikely that an item will fail as soon as a few days after being purchased...Well I am a very careful person when it comes to electronics, and specially hardware, In 6 months the tablet was out of my place as much as 4 times... so I cant say that Im a heavy user regarding outside of the house, the product was good (a little to slow for me even though I have the 32 gb version and only used 3 gb tops)So you can imagine my surprise when just the day before yesterday my tablet started to shut down on itself, I started up again and now it just keeps doing that on itself... it presents the power off menu every few seconds... its like the power button got stucked or something but its not stucked, at least not mechanically speaking...Asus its a good company but this kind of things just makes me discourage anyone thinking about buying one of their products... 400 bucks wasted its not a fair dealKEEP AWAY FROM ASUS

Reviews.Title: Asus TF201
Reviews.Author: Paultheman
Reviews.Content: ASUS Transformer Prime TF201-B1-GR Eee Pad 10.1-Inch 32GB Tablet (Amethyst Gray)Stay away from this product TF201 - I have 3 access points in my home to allow Wifi access.  I have talked with tech support and sent unit in multiple times for repair and still can not get the Wifi signal other devices in my home get. I thought I was getting a quality product, I was wrong. I will not be purchasing a ASUS product in the future - Samsung will be my next Tablet.

Reviews.Title: Screen Failure
Reviews.Author: Iván Rosas
Reviews.Content: I need help. My tablet have an screen failure.  Dont response tactil or have move alone. I need know to do it, repare or replace. I have a guarantie? I buy by Amazon. Regards

Reviews.Title: My firsr pad  a 700 has serviced my daughter well for two years
Reviews.Author: NeedToKnow
Reviews.Content: IWOULD LIKE TO HAVE HAD A USER MANUAL WITH IT. HAvE since FOUND A 90 PAGE MANUAL ON LINE. IT IS A BIG HELP. The on screen keyboard takes some getting used to. I have been told that there is a better key board app that can be down loaded.

Reviews.Title: My firsr pad  a 700 has serviced my daughter well for two years
Reviews.Author: NeedToKnow
Reviews.Content: IWOULD LIKE TO HAVE HAD A USER MANUAL WITH IT. HAvE since FOUND A 90 PAGE MANUAL ON LINE. IT IS A BIG HELP. The on screen keyboard takes some getting used to. I have been told that there is a better key board app that can be down loaded.

Reviews.Title: every thing was as presented
Reviews.Author: Terry Kelly
Reviews.Content: The tablet arrived when it was supposed to, it was in the original packaging. The tablet wasformy wife and she has been extremely happy with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Snow
Reviews.Content: I've had my Transformer for about 3 months now, and while I can honestly say that I really like this tablet, I do prefer the Ipad. The Transformer has a flexibility that Ipad doesn't with it's attachable keyboard, but the tablet itself is of a lesser quality. This lesser quality comes with a lesser price tag so it all works out.

Reviews.Title: So far soooo
Reviews.Author: Dan Trent
Reviews.Content: So far sooooo good. I am truly enjoying this product. I am using this for Real Estate Appraising and while hard to see outside, it is working out nice with the software I use. Thanks. AMAZON DO NOT TELL ME HOW MANY WORDS TO USE!! One of the dumbest things I have ever heard.

Reviews.Title: ok for the money
