Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get my first tablet. Everyone else in my family had theirs but i still had not found one and was determined to get the very best on the market. The Asus transformer 300 fit the bill. When the package arrived it had a small spider cracks on the bottom right hand corner but i thought nothing of it for the product was labeled "Like New" or perhaps had a problem in shipping. Everything worked fine for the first night but the next day the unit began to crash on me and restart on its own will. Not sure why this happened so i did a hard reset and called the customer support which was terrible and of no help which i could not find online. After a week this problem began to worsen and after two weeks the screen became unusable. I will never buy another ASUS until they improve the quality. I could and am going to buy an Ipad 2 for the same price as the transformer 300 its just not worth dealing with all the possible problems these units seem to have after only a short period of regular use. RETURNED

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: artfran
Reviews.Content: Great little tablet--am not getting the 8 to 10hrs. battery life yet--still this is 10 times better than my previous tablet--grafics are great--runs without stuttering when i play grafic intensive games--might be a bit heavy for female users

Reviews.Title: excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: nuk
Reviews.Content: This is my first android tablet . I think this one will make Apple scare.It can do almost everything like pc and more.

Reviews.Title: If I waited 12 more hours, would have saved $20.99
Reviews.Author: Name Here
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the haters are doing rating this product 2 stars and 1 star, do you work for a competitor manufacturer or what? You people work for Apple? Stop hating, this product is great for it's price. What do you expect paying only $379.00 on a 10.1" with quad core?The thing I hate was that, Amazon.com lowered the price to $379.00 after the day I purchased it for $399.99 !

Reviews.Title: I hate it
Reviews.Author: pat grant
Reviews.Content: very happy with it

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy - screen cracked while "swiping" to unlock screen.
Reviews.Author: Benny Franklin
Reviews.Content: Pros: Average tablet - similar to most android tablets.Cons: Wow, when swiping the screen to unlock the device, the screen cracked! What kind of quality is that? Refurb or not, I've owned many tablets and phones, and most use gorilla glass. Not so with this tablet. Buyer beware, this thing is junk. Do a search for cracked screens on ASUS tablets and you will see what I am talking about. I've purchased so many ASUS products because I thought it meant quality. Don't throw away your money on it. ASUS quality obviously has gone way down. I still have an HP tablet my teen daughter uses (and abuses). You would think the HP would have a cracked screen, not THIS one. The ASUS tablet barely got used. Too bad. I vote with my wallet and I encourage everyone considering this tablet to do the same.Other Thoughts: It's a shame the refurb only has a 3 month warranty. From what I have read though, most owners experiencing the erroneous cracked screen (new or refurb) have been denied any warranty work and have been accused of "abuse". Save yourself some heart ache and buy a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Dead on Arrival
Reviews.Author: Jay Jayatheerthan
Reviews.Content: I was in tablet market for quite sometime watching different specs, etc from multiple vendors. I knew I didnt want an Apple product as it was too restrictive for a tablet. For iPhone its fine. But tablet is more like a computer and so need flexibility and openness.So Android was the obvious choice. I liked the 4.x release when I checked out other tablets. I wanted one with quad core processor. That left me with Asus transformer tf300 and Acer a510 iconia (at least for now in my price range). Comparing them both I think Asus had an edge based on the review comments. I also checked them out in local stores to have a look at it. I found Acer to heat up after 5-10 min of usage. The pluses were battery and dolby. But I decided for Asus.I ordered it and was eagerly waiting to get my hands on it. When it came, I immediately opened up to start using it. Upon pressing the power button nothing happened. Tried few times - no luck. Thought the battery may not be fully charged. Plugged into the wall and let it charge few hours. The power button LED came on in amber color which gave me hope.After allowing it to be charged several hours, I tried again. No display. I can see the black color all over the screen. Nothing else. You can tell the difference between the screen switched off and the black color in the screen. I held the power button for several seconds in hope of doing a hard reset. That didnt help. I thought of hitting the reset button using a pin. But then thought, why should I do it. I paid in full for this and I shouldnt have to reset it the first time I am switching on. It didnt feel right. I packed it up and shipped it right back and got the refund.Now I am back in the tablet market - debating whether to give Asus another chance or not. Or go for Acer although it gets warm. Or wait for some more time until Amazon or Google to come up with a 10.1 tablet. Not sure what to do so I am waiting....I wanted to give zero stars. But Amazon doesnt let me do it. So giving one star.

Reviews.Title: Product that i ordered is not the same i have.
Reviews.Author: Chi Wai Ko
Reviews.Content: The product that i ordered was 32GB, but mine is 16GB. I have used this tablet for 2 months already but I don't even know it until my brother want to buy one. My brother asked me to check how many GB my tablet is, and then i noticed that mine is 16GB not 32GB. After that i contacted the seller and requested a refund, but the seller said what they can do is give me back 50 dollars or give me a 32 GB card. Just want to let other buyers know, if you guys buy the tablet from this seller, please check it is that a 16 GB or 32 GB.

Reviews.Title: 3rd time is not always a charm!
Reviews.Author: Turkster666
Reviews.Content: I bought my 1st TF300t through TigerDirect.Com only to return it after 2 days of use.Reason: would not recognize the device via the usb cable connected to a computer (I tried 4 computers I happen to have an extra usb cable which wasn't the problem)I bought my 2nd TF300t through Amazon.Com.  Once received I tried the USB connection to computer and worked perfectly.  Though I returned it 4 days later.Reason: after a couple days of use and letting the battery die, the device would not charge.  I tried a hard reset, cold reset, and different charger...oh, and I also tried the charger in the freezer trick.I bought my 3rd TF300t from Amazon.Com and received it 2 hours ago and guess what?  I just told Amazon I am returning it.Reason: Same issue as the 1st one, will not recognize the tablet via the USB cable while connected to any computer....AGAIN!I feel stupid I let it go this far, I should have thrown in the towel with the 2nd one failing on me.  Please learn from my mistake and stay away from this model tablet.

Reviews.Title: 2 Stars is pushing it!
Reviews.Author: Jolant02
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my son for his birthday and for the first 2 weeks it was perfect!  I researched all of the tablets and waited anxiously for this one to come out, which it did, 3 weeks before his birthday.  As I stated above it worked perfectly for the first 2 weeks and since...well let's list what has gone wrong.1) Cannot play Netflix movies on the tablet even though before I bought it I made sure everything said we could.2) After the first update on the tablet the screens started freezing in the middle of games, on the internet, etc...it is really annoying and very difficult to explain to your child why it does that when they are just trying to enjoy their new tablet.3) After ANOTHER update the tablet started skipping...it would pull up random games even though you didn't even click on that game!!I have tried numerous things to fix it and NOTHING works.  I want to return it but of course my "window" to return has expired.  I have not called customer service yet as I keep hoping they will fix these issues with another update.  BUT the fact that my children are playing on my ipad more than this tablet makes me want to get my money back for it and go buy another ipad for them!!Right now - this tablet is horrible - hence why they are only getting 2 stars from me - if i could give it a 0 I probably would since we really can't even use it right now.  I would rate it 5 starts if it worked the way it did when we first bought it!  As I stated before - it was PERFECT (with exception of no Netflix) - but now it is a waste of money!!

Reviews.Title: asus tf300
Reviews.Author: Got Here As Soon As I Could
Reviews.Content: it is trash as of june 2013 , junk as far as I a concerned , never cared for it anyways , I prefer a laptop instead .

Reviews.Title: buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Molly A. Wall
Reviews.Content: This product worked just fine, for two days. It was dropped from an easy chair onto carpet, a drop of one foot, and the screen cracked. Now the touch screen is useless.....useless. I called support, went through all  the hula hoops only to find that this is not covered under warranty, and to repair it is over 200 dollars. This product was not treated as a ping pong ball, it was treated gently, and it accidentally fell an astounding one foot onto padded lush carpet and now is not even a good paper weight. There must be a problem with the quality of their products for this to completely fail so easily. Carefully, use your own judgement...and buy the insurance if it is offered...because Asus will not stand behind their products.

Reviews.Title: Minor Issue
Reviews.Author: NYC Love Droid
Reviews.Content: This product is seamless except if you don't have a Gmail account it doesn't allow you to continue with the setup. [[ASIN:B007P4YAPK ASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue)]

Reviews.Title: awsome protector
Reviews.Author: lee
Reviews.Content: I love this protector. I work in very harsh environments such as deserts in west Africa and 200 miles offshore. I has done a good job.

Reviews.Title: very buggy
Reviews.Author: kyolance
Reviews.Content: I ordered at launch. Maybe is my bad luck. The product every so I often freezes after you do not use for periods. So there was a ritual of 15 minutes flipping it, turning it sideways, screen often unresponsive. Seems after it "warms" up it works fine. But is a tiresome to do that every so often you don't use and power up. Returned product and tried my luck by getting another New one. The new one 2nd even worse, screen would flash red borders had a red f rame constant. There was also a dot on screen that followed were you'd touch., which I thought wasn't normal. Then I tried camera, wouldn't switch from  photo to video, error message " unfortunately camera stopped working" .....really? Maybe its just bad luck for me but I won't recommend this buggy product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: defective screen on mine.
Reviews.Author: user_name_not_found
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet I think the second/third day it came out for my brother-in-law who is volunteering (teaching English) for a school in a rural village in Nepal. He has been living there for few months and will only return to US in about a year from now. Just after few days he got it, during a conversation I found out that the screen was all messed up. Can be seen here ([...]). The whole left edge of the screen, there are strange lines about 2 to 5 mm long all over from top to bottom about a mmm apart. Almost like bar codes from top to bottom. They started appearing about two days of taking it out of the box. He also told me that he has been super careful with the device, so this is not a case of mishandling.Now that the tablet is in Nepal I can neither return it nor claim a refund because it's so far away. To make it worse, the school he volunteers for is a plane ride away and it costs about $60-$70 (around that)just to get to Katmandu, even if there is a ASUS repair and warranty claim center. So, that's not an option. Now he has a defective tablet that he can not exchange and is doomed to have it the way it is. It may or may not be a good tablet, but in my case it sucked and it made me look like I bought something cheap for him. I am not saying he is ungrateful, but that's just the way I feel now. This was my first ASUS purchase in my life. I hear ASUS makes good products. Now, I am not so sure about it.ASUS needs to step up its game.

Reviews.Title: Bad product, worst service!
Reviews.Author: Eden
Reviews.Content: This is my revised review after the second unit arrived defective. The tablet is reasonably functional, but quality of construction is very poor, on top of spotty manufacturing process and failed quality control. My first unit had a defective camera with auto focusing problem. The TF201 model, which has a well-known problem with WiFi and GPS signals, has a better working camera (8MP back camera), but the GPS signal on TF300 is still very poor compared to other tablets such as Samsung Galaxy 2 7.0in. The second unit has a screen defect: the touch sensitivity is inconsistent over the surface. This means when I entered letters from the pop-up keyboard, some keys would not respond at all! There were also some dead pixel problem.So, while my experience in dealing with Amazon has been great, I think ASUS needs serious improvement on their quality control because 2 out of 2 TF300 I've received have some serious technical issues.Contacting ASUS customer support was extremely painful. It's difficult to get through to a live person and when I did, the quality of the tech was shameful! ASUS contracts out to some company in Jamaica for its support. And the customer care department ("highest level customers can reach to for tech support) in Fremont was also a waste of time. All they could do was to give me a "case number", but NEVER followed up on it. They gave me a run around when I tried to reach the management.I would NEVER buy any products with ASUS label on it again!

Reviews.Title: review for Amazon Service not my tablet
Reviews.Author: Dan Clark
Reviews.Content: received my TF300T on Thursday and it would not turn on nor charge.  Even after following self diag information from Asus, it would not charge.Followed product return tabs from original order with Amazon, and WOW am I impressed!  I knew I was gambling by ordering on release day, and lost, as the tablet was DOA.Contacted ASUS and verified it was not something I was doing/not doing, and followed their suggestion of returning to Amazon.  Painless return; for my first return in years of purchasing from them.  I received notice of new order at same time I got confirmation of return.  I will be receiving my replacement by Tuesday.... now that is customer service...  I was expecting that they would wait until they received the DOA tablet (Amazon paid) before shipping new one and am pleasantly surprised with their return policy.  I'll wait for new tablet before review the product, but felt compelled to review this great customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great Tab..Waited long enough for it
Reviews.Author: Edward Jillett III "Ted_from_Mass"
Reviews.Content: About time, was waiting and waiting for the Tegra 3...This is the tablet I was waiting for,did many many hours of research now it's all mine...

Reviews.Title: I sent it back
Reviews.Author: lm153fly
Reviews.Content: Asus TF300, I owned it for about a month before I sent it Back. I gave it two stars because maybe tablets are not for me. My wife and I decided to get tablets for "V" day. We got her the Asus TF101 and I decided to wait. None of the other Tablets were matching up on price, so when I saw the TF300 for the same price for the 32G, I jumped on it. Price wise it was a good deal.One of the first few days I had it, the letter "a" just kept rolling across the screen like it was stuck. It took me a few minutes to actually be able to get the tablet to turn off. Once I turned it back on, it was fine and it never happened again.It had a GPS, but the only time it would show me my location was when I would connected to a Wifi signal. I though I should be able to use it in my car like a GPS, but I guess not. I work in the back of the plane and my goal was, I thought it would be cool to be able to see my location when flying across the ocean.I didn't like pecking with one finger to get typed out whatever I was doing. I downloaded a swype like keyboard, like what my phone has, to make typing quicker. It seems different on a cell phone compared to a Tablets because of the distance of going back and forth across the tablet screen. Yes, for the Asus you can buy the keyboard and attach it to the tablet, but then I might have well just bought a laptop (which is what I'm looking for now).I tried a couple of games on it. I did like some of the flying games with the sensors it has to be able to tell how you're holding the tablet. But really alot of the games, all you're doing is moving your finger across the screen to interact with the game, I found it boring.Battery life, I felt like it didn't really last all that long before I was having to recharge it, maybe five hours. of course it depends on what you doing and in the bottom right corner, you could bring up a little display that would show if the GPS or wifi was on, etc. but there were several other symbols that I had no idea what they meant and I couldn't really get them to stay long enough in view, because they would slide back over out of view. There were like 7-8 symbols that displayed, but only half of the were vissible unless you slide over to side to see the other symbols.There were very few documents that came with the device, maybe if they had something that came with it that explained more of the features and how to properly use them.The last straw was when I was using a website to search for airline tickets for our vacation. I had typed in the three letters for the airport but the tablets was acting like there was noting typed in the provided field.I was wanting a tablet because I though they would be faster to use. They are a little faster than a laptop when first turing on, but I'm not impressed with tablets and am now researching which laptop to buy.

Reviews.Title: pathetic tablet
Reviews.Author: zak man
Reviews.Content: I must say this is the most pathetic tablet out there.  costant problems with the screen and it seems to have a mind of it's own.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Screen Quality
Reviews.Author: YoChaze
Reviews.Content: I was very shocked with the poor screen quality and color depth.  The colors are faded and dull.  I was very disappointed.  I have richer colors and much better picture quality on my cell phone.  I wish I would have purchased an Ipad2 or a samsung galaxy 10.1.

Reviews.Title: Useless, no directions, nothing works
Reviews.Author: Mkey "Mkey"
Reviews.Content: I thought I would buy a tablet rather than a laptop for its portability but I am living to regret my stupidity. First, after 12 hours charging first it, then the so called 15 hour battery/docking station I also bought, it would not turn on. I had to find a pin small enough to stick into the "reset" hole just to finally get it on! There appear to be no apps loaded on it, despite a list showing up when I poke on the All button. There are no directions on how to open them. The manual essentially just tells you how to turn the crappy thing on and THAT IS IT! Waste of $500- Run don't walk from ASUS products! If I could give it 0 stars I would.

Reviews.Title: paper specs
Reviews.Author: galaxy
Reviews.Content: On paper this seems like a great tab i was trying to decide between the galaxy tab2 10.1 an the asus transformer .tf300 had issues with 3 .tf300 slow browser apps hanging up switched back to back to galaxy and i know on paper the galaxy doesn't measure up i put them both through their paces

Reviews.Title: Technology not there yet - Said my Wife
Reviews.Author: Halfa
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife last week. She is very busy, so I set it up for her. After playing with it for a couple of hrs. She told me that it froze in FB several times, while opening photos and trying to post on her groups.She likes the concept (she has a Droid Bionic phone), but she preffers an ultrabook. She doesn't think that the technology on this item is there yet, in comparison to her laptop.We went to BestB to check the Asus Zenbook that was on sale for $949, but they have been out of stock for weeks.I guess I'll wait for the new Zenbook with the Ivy Bridge CPU next month.

Reviews.Title: May be it is just my bad luck, but...
Reviews.Author: Asanagi "’©“â"
Reviews.Content: It looks like I am gonna be the first person who write a 1 star review.....As TF300 been released from amazon, I pre-ordered it right after I hear from it. And here I just finish drop off the return package to the UPS and write a pretty objective report(or I think...)what's great:1. Tegra-3 processor, 4 core.1G Ram(some said it is 2G), 32G storage. since I am not a gaming person, I would like to leave speed part blank since I really don't think I tested this. Price-wise, this is THE most worthy to buy tablet.2. ICS 4.0. A OTA is available right after you turn on the tablet. right now it is running at ICS 4.0.3.3. Wifi works great, so does GPS. the indicator does not seems so accurate since it sometimes shows "poor signals" while it says excellent in the setting page.what is not so great......1. screen:Asus down grade the screen from IPS+ to IPS form tf201. It was not a significant difference, but it is becoming hard to read under the sun vs. tf201 is nice and clear. Color is not perfect, in my opinion. it is turning to be to over bright that some of the pictures would loose details.A big problem of the screen, also is the reason I decided to return it, is this. refer to this video:([...]). I have a same problem as shown on the video, on both the original one and the replaced one amazon mailed me. I am not too sure if it is a problem on the design or due from the software, since I upgrade my tablets once it come to me. But I don't want to waste time to give another shot since it have be present on 2 trys.2. plastic back:It does have a same size as TF201, however the plastic and the circles on the back makes it looks fat. Also not as stable as TF201. the gorilla glass is removed from this tablet, that make it feels soft. I mean, while you are holding this tablet on a corner, it feels bent for a small angle. On the left corner of mine, it clips when I am holding it with one hand. I result it from the softness of the back material.3. file system? (not so sure, may due for my wrong operation)In it's file, there are some sample pictures and musics. It took me a whole night to try to delete those files. and irony, I didn't find out it comes back after I reboot. Also, while I was trying to copy me music file to the tablet, several times, It shows a copy window but not copying. I'm in Windows 7, by the way.Thanks for great service from amazon. Tablets comes fast and did not give me any worry when I try to replace or return it.(returning the second one, hopefully not...)So, I am not recommending this tablet right now. problems might be solved after several batches. Just like the Transformer prime, TF201, It does have a great processor and strong capacity on gaming. But if one is not in to gaming or if games you play does not require too much. better not to try this product right now.

Reviews.Title: Defective product - would not buy again
Reviews.Author: prollygon
Reviews.Content: Waited a good week for this as a birthday present, and when it got here, there is some sort of crack in the screen, or a piece of hair underneath the glass, or something, when I got it. It's very prominent, and it's a brand new product. Very disappointed. Now I have to send it back and deal with a lot of trouble to get the product that I paid for.Also, I don't know how long I have to charge it for, but I left it charging for half an hour already (there is an orange light in the power button), and it doesn't turn on at all. I hold the power button for 1.5 seconds or more (as the instructions say) and there is no response whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Really bad build quality. Do not buy this if you plan on using on real life situations
Reviews.Author: danabeyin
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a director's monitor while I'm shooting.  The first day of shooting, I put it in my bag next to my macbook pro (both had neoprene sleeves) and when I took it out, the screen was GONE. The item has been used at home very lightly, no dropping, no hitting, NOTHING.And the first day when I needed to really USE it, it was gone.Not only it kind of ruined my shooting, it also made me look unprofessional to the crew and the actors.I could not even delete my personal data when I returned because I simply could not access the device at all, had to change my gmail password.The lesson I learned from this experience,NEVER TRUST A THIN TABLET FOR REAL LIFE PROFESSIONAL EVENTS.

Reviews.Title: Like somone said: wanted to love it but I just coul not.
Reviews.Author: Big Bull "Big Bull"
Reviews.Content: ASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue)I tried this and returned after 4 days. ery stressful to use. Want a site then to run the site they do not tell you want application you need to power the site and down load, Also then becomes a browser issue, one site in partiular(as if you are suppose to know needs the Dolphin Browser, but ehich one . There about 30 dolphon browsers. Then sometime you need to swith to desktop view from regular view> Who knows? Not a big fan of virtual keyboards. Drove me crazy. I will take a nice fast PClaptop anyday over this. I admire anyone that use this this and not be violentlt stressed. My high Hopes were dashedASUS Transformer TF300 T-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet (Blue)....not also sold for 349.99 at Microcenter

Reviews.Title: STANDING BY
Reviews.Author: S. Kleinschmit "Seabee890"
Reviews.Content: I chose this product because on paper and everything that I have seen would indicate that it is a better product than the Ipad 2,, I'm waiting to prove this correct but it has been THREE DAYS SINCE I ORDERED IT AND AMAZON HAS NOT EVEN BEGUN TO SHIP IT YET!!!!!!!! I sound cranky because this is my birthday present to myself from my wife and family, but since you will not support shipping directly to my Military base as an fpo-ap address. I have to wait until it gets to my wife and then I have to wait for her to send it to me.  This is bothersome!

Reviews.Title: TF-300 Display Downgrade
Reviews.Author: James G. Hagen
Reviews.Content: Really disapointed to learn that Asus has downgraded the TF-300 display from the TF-201. I had been looking forward to buying the TF-300 as it had all the features that that I wanted in a tablet. I understand from the reveiw that the display downgrade was due to cost reduction. The display is the primary user interface to a device and everyone wants the latest and greatest. What a pity, this could have been a great tablet
